Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Cease and Desist Request Alleged Debt Dear XXXX XXXX, I, XXXX XXXX, am requesting that you cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt, pursuant to theFair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) ). Under this law, you must stop contacting me except to confirm the cessation of collection efforts or to notify me of legal action. 
I also remind you of your obligations under15 U.S.C. 1692to avoid any unfair, deceptive, or abusive practices. Failure to comply with this request may result in complaints to theConsumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or legal action. 
As of the date of this letter : 1. I do not acknowledge the validity of the alleged debt. 
2. You are instructed to stop all communication with me immediately. ( that includes credit reporting ) The only communications I will accept moving forward are : Written confirmation that you have ceased collection efforts. 
Notification of any legal actions you intend to take. 
Please confirm receipt of this letter and compliance within15 business days to avoid arbitration. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information dispute by a consumer, an team of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, base on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( 1 ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. U.S Code 1681a-Definitions ; rules of construction, ( 1 ) In General-The terms consumer report Means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; ( B ) employment purposes ; or ( C ) any other purpose authorized under section 1681b of this title Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate Chase Auto Loan information on my report is inaccurate, this account has been paid as to the terms of the agreement I ask that this be reverse to pay as agreed. Please reverse the following item, immediately

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint regarding unprofessional conduct and potential misuse of my personal information by a real estate agent. During the leasing process for a rental property, the agent collected my Social Security Number ( SSN ), stating it was solely for verifying lease eligibility. However, I later discovered my SSN was used at a car dealership without my knowledge or consent. I have never been to or authorized dealings with this dealership. The agent mentioned that the landlord owns a dealership in XXXX, which raises serious concerns that my SSN may have been misused or shared without authorization.

The agents actions, including the potential misuse of my SSN, improper communication, failure to fulfill her obligations, and neglect of the propertys condition, demonstrate a severe lack of professionalism. I request that the XXXX investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate actions to hold the agent accountable for her misconduct.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Consumer complaint narrative:
My complaint concerns how MOHELA has classified the administrative forbearance in my account for three relevant months. In short, I have already reached 120 qualified payments for Public Student Loan Forgiveness ( PSLF ). My employer certification is pending with Federal Student Aid ( FSA ), but there are several issues that need to be resolved ASAP on Mohelas end, but they refuse to help by sending me back to FSA when the issue is on their end.

By the correct count, my final qualifying payment should have been XX/XX/XXXX, getting me to 120 qualifying payments. At issue with MOHELA is how it has classified two separate periods of forbearance. 

XXXX. XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX : Both these months should be listed as having a PROCESSING Forbearance that counts for PSLF, not an administrative forbearance that does not count. Since late XX/XX/XXXX, per Federal Student Aid 's guidance, I requested to be moved from SAVE ( which is currently paused and payments do not count for PSLF ) to IBR ( where payments do count for PSLF. Per FSA guidance, student loan providers that are unable to process the application for a payment swap must place borrowers in a 60 day processing forbearance, which FSA will count as qualified payments for forbearance. So, XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX should be listed as processing forbearance. 

As a last resort, if XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX do not count for whatever reason, then per Federal Student Aid guidance issued on XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted an electronic application to swap from SAVE to IBR on XX/XX/XXXX. While my application is being processed, Mohela should place. XXXX on a 60 day forbearance that should have XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX count for my XXXX qualified payments. Again, this is only last resort because per XXXX  guidance, and as a result of my repeated request to MOHELA since late XX/XX/XXXX to switch from SAVE to IBR ( see attached requests and responses ), and their confirmation on XX/XX/XXXX that my request was being processed, XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX should count as qualified payment months while I was placed on a processing forbearance 2. XX/XX/XXXX : Mohela inexplicably lists this month as being on administrative forbearance, that does not count for PSLF. However, I was pm forbearance during this period at the fault of my former loan provider while they swapped my loan payments plans. This month should also be listed as under a processing forbearance that counts for PSLF.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: I have a XXXX XXXX XXXX, operated by Wells Fargo. The app will not allow me to enroll in autopay without using a Wells Fargo online account. Because I do not have any checking account or credit card with Wells Fargo, I had to create an account to do this. Despite following directions and creating the account, technical issues with Wells Fargos website prevent me from being able to log in and enroll in autopay ( I reach a screen saying to call their account support, which I have done on at least XXXX separate occasions over the last year, only to be transferred between departments and receive no resolution after hours on hold ). The app provides no notice of payment due date ( as all my other banking apps do ), and I have been charged for late payments on multiple occasions as a result of not having autopay set up and not being able to enroll. After working with customer service to reset my username and password, it is still not allowing me to enroll and I was told there was no further support they could provide besides mailing me a form to complete and send back to enroll. The barrier to enrolling in autopay is unreasonable and feels intentional to take advantage of consumers and collect on forgotten / late payments by not reminding consumers of upcoming bill due dates. I think XXXX / Wells Fargo should be investigated for thisthey should be helping consumers pay bills as simply as possible, but instead have made it nearly impossible to do so.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Threatened to contact someone or share information improperly
Sub-issue: Contacted you after you asked them to stop
Consumer complaint narrative:
Sunday, XXXX XXXX XXXX - I was served an in-person summons to the door of my home from XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX The date printed on the summons and letter was XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. 

***This is the first formal complaint to the CFPB as per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, communication is prohibited before XXXX. *** XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX - I called and spoke with XXXX XXXX office about cooperating to settle any issues including their explanation of a proposed payment arrangement. Shortly afterward, details were confirmed in an email from his office that we'd discussed working toward finalizing a payment arrangement. A proposed document was sent for my signature, with a start date to the agreement as XX/XX/XXXX and with very little information/clarification about the terms of the payment arrangement. 

XX/XX/XXXX - I received a copy of the same summons with plaintiff 's directions in the USPS mail. The date printed on the summons and letter was XX/XX/XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX - The person who had served the original summons showed up to the door of my home again. They did not leave a document, and I had received no prior notice from XXXX 's office that he would be returning, or an email afterward explaining what was attempting to be delivered to me. 

XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX - I sent a cooperative email asking questions for clarification about the proposed payment arrangement and document for my signature. Within the same email, I included a formal request for further contact and visits to my home to stop : I'd also like to confirm whoever has been knocking on my door with documents from your office will no longer need to come to my house? After he delivered the first letter/summons Sunday, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX, I called and spoke with your office about cooperating to settle any issues including with this proposed payment arrangement on Thursday, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX which is when shortly afterward you sent this email. Since we'd already discussed and agreed on working toward finalizing a payment arrangement, I'm not sure why this person then showed up at my home again on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX. I am happy to work with you through the issue, but personally, as a <person> living alone I am not comfortable with a man I do not know showing up to my home, especially so early in the morning, on weekends, and after we'd already agreed on moving forward with working toward a payment arrangement, him showing up again without me knowing he is coming. That makes me extremely uncomfortable and I believe is against the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. Now that we are finalizing a payment arrangement, I'd like to request there are no more phone calls, emails, letters, visits to my home or otherwise unless it is in regard to clarifying my questions about the terms of a payment arrangement or if I've somehow not met the terms of a payment arrangement when we have all of the items clarified and finalized. 

XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I mailed the required Answer and Denial document copies to XXXX office via USPS priority. 

XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I received an email from XXXX office confirming receipt of yesterdays email, answering the questions contained in the email, but did not include acknowledgement of my request to cease further aggressive contact. 
XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I filed the required Answer and Denial documents with the County Court XXXX 

XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Cooperative emails remained going back and forth between myself and XXXX office to confirm all details working to finalize a resolution ; the last email from myself waiting for a reply from XXXX office. 

XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX - The person who had served the original summons showed up to the door of my home again. They did not leave a document, and I had received no prior notice from XXXX 's office that he would be returning, or an email afterward explaining what was attempting to be delivered to me. 

***This is the second formal complaint to the CFPB as per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, communication is prohibited if a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer. *** XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I sent a cooperative email asking for a reply to the last email I had sent to XXXX office on XX/XX/XXXX in attempt to resolve the issue. Also within the email was a second request that there be no more people sent to my home on behalf the issue at hand. 
As of today XX/XX/XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX, they came to my home again. I am going to send an email today requesting them to stop contact again. I have not done anything against the agreement I signed with them, I have made all payments and I have asked them if there is information that they need and they have not responded or contacted me besides sending this person to my home. 

Consumer wants to following added to the resolution : It can be added to the bottom portion of the resolution : They need to stop showing up to my home immediately, it is giving me extreme anxiety. I informed them I am a single woman that lives alone and when someone, especially a man, comes to my home knocking the way he does it is scary.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information dispute by a consumer, an team of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, base on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( 1 ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. U.S Code 1681a-Definitions ; rules of construction, ( 1 ) In General-The terms consumer report Means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; ( B ) employment purposes ; or ( C ) any other purpose authorized under section 1681b of this title Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate XXXX XXXX XXXX  information on my report is inaccurate, this account has been paid as to the terms of the agreement I ask that this be reverse to pay as agreed. Please reverse the following item, immediately

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Team, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Bank of America regarding their failure to address fraudulent charges on my business account. 
Specifically, there have been {$2900.00} in unauthorized transactions associated with XXXX ( Claim No. 
XXXX ) that have remained on my account for over a year and a half. 

I first contacted Bank of America about this issue on XX/XX/XXXX, but despite my efforts, the fraudulent charges have not been resolved. On XX/XX/XXXX, a representative informed me they could not find the charge after I submitted documentation. I was told that the back office needed to confirm the information. On XX/XX/XXXX, I was again informed that the charges had not been resolved and that Bank of America would need to issue me a check for the claim and associated fees. I was promised a callback that never occurred. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I escalated the issue with a representative named XXXX, who indicated this should have been resolved by now. Subsequent interactions included a call on XX/XX/XXXX, where I was assured a follow-up call would occur on XX/XX/XXXX, which did not happen. On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke with XXXX, a manager, who transferred me to the billing dispute department but stated they could not resolve disputes related to the small business credit card. I have continually been left without a resolution, and it is causing significant financial strain. 

Additionally, I have had various interactions with representatives, including XXXX XXXX in XXXX and XXXX XXXX in XXXX all of which have led to no resolution. The total amount in question, including other fees, is {$1400.00} plus the {$2900.00} in fraudulent charges.

Product: Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I noticed a fraudulent activity from XXXX XXXX which is linked with TD Bank system. I never opened an account with XXXX XXXX through TD Bank XXXX XXXX. This is an identity theft issue. There were unauthorized payments to my XXXXXXXX XXXX account from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. For example, the payments were withdrawn every month in the amount of {$61.00}, {$35.00}, and {$31.00}. I thought they were payments for my phone carrier bill. But they were not. Someone used my identity to pay the unknown product I did not authorize. The total amount XXXX XXXX charged to my XXXXXXXX XXXX  account is approximately over {$2100.00}. Therefore, I closed my XXXX checking account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from TD Retail Card Services. It said " This letter is in response to your report of a fraudulently opened account in your name. We have closed the above referenced account to prevent its future use. You will not be responsible for any purchases made on this account. '' But the company opened another account in my name to receive remaining payments for purchases made by the identity theft. On XX/XX/XXXX, they company mailed me another letter saying " Please be advised, due to the unauthorized transaction, account ending in XXXX was closed for your security, and a new account number ending in XXXX was established. Please refer to your next billing statement for your account number and minimum monthly payment. '' This is fraudulent because I never requested to open another account after I noticed the unauthorized transactions in my XXXX bank account. This doesn't make sense at all. 

Today, XXXX XXXX keep sending bills with late fee charge to make payments for the remaining balance of {$380.00} due by XX/XX/XXXX. The company continue sending bills after they acknowledged its fraudulently charged payments of approximately XXXX XXXX This is fraud. I have no reason to receive bills from XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I have attached all the files of fraudulently charged payments in my closed XXXX bank account. I also attached all the documents received from XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NY XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Request for Removal of Fraudulent Accounts from Credit Report and Immediate Blockage under 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 Dear XXXX, I am writing to you with a request under the provisions of the United States Code Title 15, Section 1681i, which empowers consumers to dispute inaccurate or fraudulent information in their credit reports. There is information on my consumer report that I did not provide written permission, instructions, or consent to be reported on my consumer report as a result of identity theft. Therefore, I am formally requesting that the reporting of this inaccurate and fraudulent information be blocked and deleted. 
My request for the blockage and deletion of this data is not a mistake, nor is it founded on any misrepresentation of facts on my part. I am committed to ensuring the accuracy and integrity of my credit report, and as such, I am rightfully seeking the removal of these wrongfully attributed transactions. It is crucial to clarify that the transactions identified in my report are in no way associated with any of my legitimate financial activities. As the victim of identity theft, these transactions do not represent any transaction undertaken by me as the rightful consumer. 
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am entitled to a fair and accurate representation of my credit history. I kindly ask that you investigate this situation promptly and take the necessary steps to remove the fraudulent accounts from my credit report. I understand the importance of a correct credit profile and its implications for my financial well-being. 
Enclosed with this letter are copies of documents substantiating my identity and the fraudulent nature of the reported transactions and trust that these documents will provide the evidence required to facilitate a swift resolution of this issue. I kindly request a written confirmation once the fraudulent accounts have been removed from my credit report. 
The identified transactions are not information related to any transaction by me as the consumer and must be deleted and removed from reporting on my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX Acc # XXXX, ACCOUNT XXXX  XXXX  XXXX account # XXXXAcount XXXX  XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX inquiry In accordance with the regulations stipulated in 15 U.S. Code 1681b, governing the permissible purposes of consumer reports, I hereby demand the immediate removal of all inquiries not initiated by myself from my credit reports. Specifically, the following inquiries are unauthorized and must be promptly deleted : You are required to do what I am asking and block these transactions from being reported to my consumer report within 4 days from the date of the receipt of this notice. I look forward to your response. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: It is crucial that consumer reporting agencies uphold their grave responsibilities when it comes to the handling of consumers personal credit files. After performing a re-investigation upon my credit file for accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX pursuant to 15 USC 1681ia1a, your company failed to follow proper procedures in regard to correspondence to me the consumer, in the handling of the reinvestigation. As clearly outlined within, 15 USC 1681i ( 7 ) ; 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy Subchapter 7 states the following ; ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a detailed description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. Further outlined within 15 USC ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) ; ( 6 ) Notice of results of reinvestigation ( A ) In general A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than XXXX business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency. ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. The correspondence mentioned above was NEVER made to me and therefore, your company is in direct violation of the FCRA and is now liable for monetary damages detailed within 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o. Not only was a proper reinvestigation not performed as the derogatory account mentioned is erroneous to begin with, your agency failed to follow the FCRAs clear rules in the handling of correspondence to me in association with the account in question. Please delete this erroneous account as I have sought legal counsel in this matter and intend on seeking damages associated with this complaint if this issue is not resolved. Thank you for your time.

ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX FLORIDA ) XXXX I looked at my credit report and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to 15 USC 1681i 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

This inaccurate and fraudulent reporting is significantly impacting my ability to obtain essential financial opportunities and is causing unnecessary harm to my credit standing. Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report after corrections are made. I have attached a copy of my government-issued ID, proof of address, and a copy of my credit report with the disputed items highlighted for your convenience. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and provide updates on the investigation and resolution in writing. You may contact me at the information listed above if further documentation is needed. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Re : Account # XXXX ( Late Payment ) Dear Sir/Ma'am, I am writing you this letter regarding payments that were marked late by your company for the following accounts on the following date ( XXXX ) : ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) It is my understanding that per XXXX XXXX XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) ( A ) ( i ), my consumer report should not contain information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer ( XXXX ) and the person ( you ) making the report. Payment history and the late payments associated with payment history negatively impacts my consumer report and are considered as part of my transactions and experiences between your company and me. 
Furthermore, I am requesting that you provide me with, in writing, the reasonable procedures ( according to 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ) that you have adopted to ensure that each periodic statement is mailed to me ( the consumer ) not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Include also, all the information required by Section 1637 ( b ) of Title 15. 
You have 30 days from the date that you receive this letter to provide me with the information that i am requesting. If you do not provide this information in the allotted time given, then it will be assumed that you can not verify the late payments on the dates specified above ( lacking reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of my account ) and I would timefore request that you remove the late payments from my account and consumer report with the following consumer reporting agencies ( XXXX, Experian XXXX XXXX or all that apply ) and update the accounts to positive. 
Please forward any changes to my account to the address below. Thank you for your time and consideration in this matter. I look forward to hearing back something positive. 
Regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Texas XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Cc : CFPB FTC XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. 

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am formally disputing the inaccurate and unverified entries on my credit report, which have significantly impacted my ability to obtain a mortgage to buy a home for my family. I have spent over five months attempting to resolve these discrepancies with the credit bureaus without success. Despite my numerous disputes, the credit reporting agencies have failed to verify these debts, provide documentation, or correct the errors, in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other relevant laws. 

The following accounts are under dispute due to inaccuracies, missing or unverified documentation, and failure to correct or remove erroneous information : XXXX - FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ), which requires that a consumer can request the full details and verification of any debt reported. This account has not been validated by the creditor after multiple requests, violating my right to have accurate and verifiable information reported. 

REGIONS BANK - FCRA Section 1681i, which mandates that if a consumer disputes an item, the credit reporting agency must investigate the dispute within a reasonable time. XXXX XXXX XXXX failure to provide validation of the debt within the 30-day window violates this law. 
XXXX - FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) obligates the reporting agencies to maintain accurate and up-to-date records. The inaccurate reporting of this account continues despite my multiple attempts to request supporting documentation, leading to a violation of my right to fair and accurate credit reporting. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) - FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) requires that any information provided must be thoroughly investigated and corrected if inaccurate. XXXX has not provided any adequate verification, and the account continues to be incorrectly reported. 
XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) - FCRA Section 1681s-2 ( b ) outlines the responsibilities of furnishers of information to ensure accurate reporting. XXXX has not met these responsibilities, leaving inaccurate information on my report without verification. 
XXXX XXXX - Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Section 1692g requires validation of debts when disputed. I have not received adequate proof of the debt 's validity, and the reporting remains inaccurate across multiple bureaus. 
XXXX XXXX ( second listing ) - The repeated inaccurate reporting of this account violates both the FCRA and the FDCPA, as the account has not been properly validated or corrected after my disputes. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX  -FCRA Section 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate and resolve disputes in a timely manner. XXXX XXXX failure to provide verification of the debt or correct the report after multiple disputes constitutes a violation of this law. 
The presence of these inaccuracies is preventing me from obtaining a mortgage, which has a direct and negative impact on my ability to purchase a home for my family. I have made every effort to correct the errors, but the credit bureaus have failed to act within the parameters of the law, causing ongoing financial harm. 

Despite my repeated requests for validation and documentation, I have yet to receive any proof of these debts or their accurate reporting. As a result, the credit bureaus are violating my rights under the FCRA, FDCPA, and other consumer protection laws that ensure I have access to accurate credit information.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of an auto repossession on my credit report under account XXXX XXXX. This account was previously removed from my XXXX credit file, which demonstrates that the information is either inaccurate, unverifiable, or incomplete. Also, this account is being inaccurately reported for the full loan amount instead of reflecting the proper deficiency balance after the vehicle was sold at auction, as required by law. Furthermore, I was not provided with a required notice detailing the auction results and the remaining balance, which further invalidates the accuracy of this reporting. Therefore, I am requesting that you immediately investigate and remove this account from my credit file as required by federal law. 

Under 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and consistent records. Disparities in reporting across the XXXX major bureaus call into question the accuracy of the information being furnished and your adherence to your duty under the FCRA to ensure maximum accuracy in consumer credit reports ( 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ). Credit bureaus must report only accurate, complete, and verifiable information. Reporting the full loan amount after a repossession and sale violates this standard of accuracy.

UCC 9-611 and 9-616 ( Uniform Commercial Code ) : Creditors are required to notify the borrower in writing of the time and place of the auction or sale of repossessed collateral ( 9-611 ). Additionally, after the sale, the creditor must provide an explanation of how the proceeds were applied, including the deficiency balance ( 9-616 ). Failure to provide this notice invalidates the debt or the claimed deficiency amount. 

Additionally, the failure to verify the accuracy of this account may also constitute a violation of 15 USC 1681i, which requires prompt reinvestigation when a consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of an item. Given that XXXX has already removed this account, I believe the same standard of accuracy should apply to your records. 

If the furnisher of this information ( XXXX XXXX  ) is unable to provide documentation verifying its accuracy and compliance with those applicable laws I stated, you must remove the account immediately. Reporting unverifiable or incomplete information violates 15 USC 1681s-2 ( b ), which prohibits furnishers from knowingly reporting inaccurate data.

I am also concerned that continuing to report this repossession despite its removal from another bureau may lead to harm under 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which provide for remedies in cases of willful or negligent noncompliance with the FCRA. 

Reasons for Dispute : XXXX. Failure to Provide Required Notices : I did not receive a pre-sale notice or post-sale explanation of the proceeds and deficiency balance, as required by UCC 9-611 and 9-616. Without these notices, the creditor is in violation of its legal obligations, and the reporting of the debt is invalid. 

XXXX. Incorrect Amount Reported : If the repossessed vehicle was sold, only the deficiency balance ( remaining amount after the sale proceeds were applied ) can be reported, not the full loan amount. Reporting the full balance is a clear violation of 15 USC 1681e ( b ), requiring accuracy in credit reporting. 


Requested actions : I respectfully request that you XXXX. Reinvestigate the Account : I request that you reinvestigate this account and verify its accuracy with the furnisher of the information and require the furnisher to provide COMPLETE documentation verifying its accuracy. 

XXXX. Obtain Proof of Notices and Accuracy : Require the furnisher to provide documentation of the auction results, the pre-sale and post-sale notices, and the calculation of the deficiency balance. If they can not provide this information, the account must be removed from my report. 

XXXX. Correct or Remove the Account : If the information can not be verified or is found to be incomplete or inaccurate, this account must be corrected or removed from my credit file as required under 15 USC 1681i. 

XXXX. Provide me with a written response within 30 days, as required by the FCRA, detailing the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 


Please note that I am prepared to escalate this dispute to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), or other appropriate authorities if necessary. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your written response.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NY XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Request for Removal of Fraudulent Accounts from Credit Report and Immediate Blockage under 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 Dear XXXX, I am writing to you with a request under the provisions of the United States Code Title 15, Section 1681i, which empowers consumers to dispute inaccurate or fraudulent information in their credit reports. There is information on my consumer report that I did not provide written permission, instructions, or consent to be reported on my consumer report as a result of identity theft. Therefore, I am formally requesting that the reporting of this inaccurate and fraudulent information be blocked and deleted. 
My request for the blockage and deletion of this data is not a mistake, nor is it founded on any misrepresentation of facts on my part. I am committed to ensuring the accuracy and integrity of my credit report, and as such, I am rightfully seeking the removal of these wrongfully attributed transactions. It is crucial to clarify that the transactions identified in my report are in no way associated with any of my legitimate financial activities. As the victim of identity theft, these transactions do not represent any transaction undertaken by me as the rightful consumer. 
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am entitled to a fair and accurate representation of my credit history. I kindly ask that you investigate this situation promptly and take the necessary steps to remove the fraudulent accounts from my credit report. I kindly request a written confirmation once the fraudulent accounts have been removed from my credit report.

Specifically, the following inquiries are unauthorized and must be promptly deleted : You are required to do what I am asking and block these transactions from being reported to my consumer report within 4 days from the date of the receipt of this notice. I look forward to your response. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
The complainant ( XXXX ) drafted a Billing Error Notices Pursuant to Account no. XXXX to Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Arizona [ XXXX ] which was delivered on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, additionally, XXXX also provided within the referenced separate billing error notices, Notices of Defaults, in which included the necessary data of notice and discovery of which Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have knowledge or come to discover that XXXX delivered a tender of payment before Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX indenture trustee XXXX XXXX XXXX including the date such payment was delivered associated with XXXX XXXX account with Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Pursuant to 12 CFR 1026.13 - Billing error resolution ( c ) Time for resolution ; general procedures. ( 1 ) The creditor shall mail or deliver written acknowledgment to the consumer within 30 days of receiving a billing error notice, unless the creditor has complied with the appropriate resolution procedures of paragraphs ( e ) ( Procedures if billing error occurred as asserted. If a creditor determines that a billing error occurred as asserted, it shall within the time limits in paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) of this section : ( 1 ) Correct the billing error and credit the consumer 's account with any disputed amount and related finance or other charges, as applicable; and ( 2 ) Mail or deliver a correction notice to the consumer. ). and ( f ) ( Procedures if different billing error or no billing error occurred. If, after conducting a reasonable investigation, a creditor determines that no billing error occurred or that a different billing error occurred from that asserted, the creditor shall within the time limits in paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) of this section : ( 1 ) Mail or deliver to the consumer an explanation that sets forth the reasons for the creditor 's belief that the billing error alleged by the consumer is incorrect in whole or in part ; ( 2 ) Furnish copies of documentary evidence of the consumer 's indebtedness, if the consumer so requests ; and ( 3 ) If a different billing error occurred, correct the billing error and credit the consumer 's account with any disputed amount and related finance or other charges, as applicable. of this section, as applicable, within the 30-day period; and ( 2 ) The creditor shall comply with the appropriate resolution procedures of paragraphs ( e ) and ( f ) of this section, as applicable, within 2 complete billing cycles ( but in no event later than 90 days ) after receiving a billing error notice.

Pursuant to the statute rule 12 CFR 1026.13 ( 3 ) Acceleration of debt and restriction of account prohibited. A creditor shall not accelerate any part of the consumer 's indebtedness or restrict or close a consumer 's account solely because the consumer has exercised in good faith rights provided by this section. A creditor may be subject to the forfeiture penalty under 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( e ) ( Any creditor who fails to comply with the requirements of this section or section 1666a of this title forfeits any right to collect from the obligor the amount indicated by the obligor under paragraph ( 2 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, and any finance charges thereon, except that the amount required to be forfeited under this subsection may not exceed {$50.00}. ) for failure to comply with any of the requirements of this section. A tender of payment was delivered before Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX indenture trustee for XXXX XXXX XXXX in which was to discharge the debt and to crediting XXXX 's account for past, current and future related payments to her principal account per the expiration of the underlying contract between XXXX and Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX. see 12 CFR 1026.13 ( 4 ) A reflection on a periodic statement of the creditor 's failure to credit properly a payment or other credit issued to the consumer 's account. The references of Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX indenture trustee is located in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and XXXX filings, which also includes the mailing address in which the tender of payment was delivered to be [ ing ] an accurate address in which the billing error notice & notice of default was sent to. After such expiration of dates, Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX continued to request payments from XXXX in which to subject XXXX of breaching the contract in which to apprehend the goods. 




The primary such requirement, at issue in this case, is that if a creditor receives written notice from a consumer that indicates [ his ] belief that [ his ] statement contains a billing error within 60 days after the creditor transmitted that statement, the creditor must comply with two separate obligations. ( citing 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) ). First, within 30 days of receiving that written notice, it must acknowledge receipt to the consumer in writing. 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) ( 3 ) ( A ). Second, within two billing cycles and in no event later than ninety days after the consumer files his written dispute, it must either ( 1 ) make appropriate corrections to the consumers account, including the crediting of any finance charges on amounts erroneously billed, or ( 2 ) conduct [ ] an investigation into the dispute and send a written explanation to the consumer setting forth to the extent applicable the reasons why the creditor believes the account... was correctly shown in the statement. Id. 1666 ( a ) ( 3 ) ( B ) ( i ) ( ii ). The creditor must take these steps before making any attempt to collect the disputed amount. Bridgecrest XXXX XXXX XXXX was given NOTICES and did not comply with such obligations and must be subject to the forfeiture penalty under 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( e ) for failure to comply with any of the requirements of this section.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXXXXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly.

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately.

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA.

Please mail your response to my address listed above.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, This is my second formal dispute regarding inaccurate and fraudulent information on my credit report resulting from identity theft. Despite my previous effortsincluding submitting an FTC Identity Theft Report, a police report, and placing fraud alertsthe disputed accounts remain on my report. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to have any unverifiable or inaccurate information removed. The accounts in question, listed below, were fraudulently opened and do not belong to me : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX {$1000.00} I have already contacted the credit reporting agencies and the collection agencies involved, but the issue remains unresolved. I am requesting your assistance to ensure these accounts are properly investigated and removed from my credit report if they can not be verified. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Complaint Regarding Fraudulent Check Deposit and Bank Handling I am writing to formally lodge a serious complaint regarding the mishandling of our account, the fraudulent deposit of a check, and the banks lack of proper procedures to prevent such incidents. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, we were unable to log into the TD Bank app. We called customer service and were told that our account had been frozen. The next day, we went to a TD Bank branch and spoke with the manager, who confirmed the account was frozen. We requested the funds in the account to be returned to us, and the manager said they needed approval from higher-ups to decide whether the money would be returned through the branch or via a mailed check.

We went back to work, and the following day, we received a call saying that only the funds in the checking account could be returned to us, while the money in the savings account would be sent to our address by mail within about seven days. We repeatedly asked the manager if the check could only be deposited into the account of the payee and if others wouldnt be able to deposit it. The manager confirmed this and stated that the bank would only issue one check. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, we noticed that a newly issued XXXX credit card ending XXXX hadnt arrived yet, but fraudulent transactions had already occurred. Fortunately, XXXX had blocked these transactions. Since we were working, we couldnt check the mail daily. On XX/XX/XXXX, we went back to TD Bank to speak with the manager about the check because we suspected it might have been stolen. However, the manager told us to wait another week and return if the check hadnt been received. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, we received a check for {$75000.00} with the account number ending in XXXX. We assumed this was the check for the savings account because the manager had said the bank would only send one check. On XX/XX/XXXX, the check was rejected by the bank. We went to TD Bank around XXXXXXXX XXXX, but the manager wasnt available, and the staff said no one could handle the issue. They emailed to inquire about the check, and the staff advised me to come back on XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, we were notified by TD Bank that the check issued for our savings account ( ending in XXXX ) in the amount of {$76000.00} had been fraudulently deposited. However, the bank has yet to determine which bank the check was deposited into. This is extremely concerning, as we were assured that only the payee could deposit the check, and that no one else would be able to do so. We were also told that the bank would only issue one check, which we received on XX/XX/XXXX, under the assumption that it was the correct one for the savings account. 

We have never receive the check.We are deeply troubled by the fact that the check, which should have been sent to us, was stolen and successfully deposited by someone else. We are particularly alarmed by the fact that such a significant sum was deposited without proper verification, especially given the circumstances. We were never informed that someone other than the account holder could deposit the check, nor were we advised of any safeguards or verification processes in place to prevent this type of fraudulent activity. Why was such a large amount allowed to be deposited into another bank without proper checks? 

The handling of this situation has been deeply frustrating. Since the check was fraudulently deposited, we have had to take additional steps, including reporting the matter to the police. We are very concerned about the lack of accountability and the apparent failure to safeguard our funds, which has resulted in significant distress. 

I respectfully request an immediate investigation into this matter, along with a full explanation of the actions taken by the bank to prevent fraud and the procedures followed in processing our check. I also request that the bank take responsibility for the loss of funds and provide us with a clear plan for how this situation will be rectified. 

I expect a prompt and thorough response to this complaint, and I trust that TD Bank will take appropriate action to address this issue and prevent any future occurrences of this nature.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding XXXX XXXX and their mishandling of the reporting on my account ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX claims that I missed a payment in XXXX of XXXX, an allegation I firmly dispute, as I have maintained consistent and on-time payments throughout my relationship with them. Despite my efforts over the course of several years to dispute this inaccuracy, each investigation conducted by the credit bureaus has concluded that the reported late payment is " verified, '' yet no tangible proof has ever been provided to substantiate this claim. 

Credit reporting agencies are obligated to ensure that all reported information is accurate and substantiated. This repeated failure to provide proof of the alleged late payment is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. XXXX XXXX has not been able to supply the necessary documentation to prove that a missed payment occurred, despite my numerous requests for verification, including the original statement and payment records from that time. 

This willful non-compliance by XXXX XXXX and the subsequent failure of the credit bureaus to address the issue properly have caused significant harm to my credit profile. As a result, I have been unjustly penalized for something that is not only incorrect but unverified. Such negligence has gone on for far too long and is a clear and blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. 

The continued reporting of this erroneous late payment without adequate proof is unacceptable and warrants immediate correction. If the disputed late payment can not be verified with concrete evidence, by law, it must be removed from my credit report. Should this matter not be rectified promptly, other avenues will have to be explored.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on to be inaccurate.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Please remove the following items from my credit report, immediately : EXPERIANXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/year> Experian XXXX Department XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct XXXX XXXXXXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Consumer complaint narrative:
You Violated the United States Code Law NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability. 
Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 
YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. 

Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors i see you are disregarding it so heres my breakdown. 
1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves. 
2. What is a FCRA violation? 
Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you. 
Reporting agencies mixing up one person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes. 
3. My rights under the fair credit reporting act Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes. 
Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions. 
Disputeand have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable. 
Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ). 
I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate and they are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied i am in distress because of your mistakes. 
The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 


Accounts Affected by the Crime FTC Report Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I AM A VICTIM OF IDENTITY THEFT AND XXXX DATA BREACH. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information. 
in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4. 
business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer. 
( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report. 
( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. 
( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft. 
( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed. 
( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block. 
( c ) Authority to decline or rescind. 
( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error, or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. 
( 2 ) Notification to consumers. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer. 
shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i. 
( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title. 
( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew. 
or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block. 
( d ) Exception for resellers. 
( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller. 
( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft. 
( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information. 
( 3 ) Notice In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting. 
agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale. 
( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section. 
1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft. 
( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Please mail your response to my address listed above.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX I looked at my credit report and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681i 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department po box XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Credit monitoring or identity theft protection services
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is in reference to inaccurate information that is being providing to EXPEEIAN from DRPT OF EDXXXX and EXPERIAN is publishing to my consumer file.The inaccurate information is in regards to late payments which never occurred with said company. What is being reported is below. XXXX ( 90-days late ) XXXX ( 120-days late ) This account shows positive payments prior to these dates which is a direct indication something is wrong and inaccurate with its reporting. UNDER ( FCRA ) CREDIT REPORTING AGENCIES ARE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN ACCURATE AND COMPLETE INFORMATION. FCRA 607 ( b ) ( 15 U. S. C 1681 e ( b ) .. BE CLEAR IM NOT ASKING FOR VALIDATION BUT IT TO BE REMOVEDFROM MY EXPERIAN CREDIT FILE OR UPDATED TO POSITIVE PAYMENT HISTORY. 


THE ABOVE ACVOUNT Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Metro 2 guidelines established by the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ), I request that your organization investigate and correct any inaccuracies or non-compliant reporting associated with this account. 

Account Information : Creditor Name : [ Creditor Name ] Account Number : [ Account Number ] Date ( s ) of Alleged Late Payments : [ List Dates ] Upon reviewing my credit report, I noticed that the late payment information reported for this account appears to violate the Metro 2 format standards, which require accurate, complete, and consistent data reporting. Specifically, I believe that the following Metro 2 compliance codes may not have been applied correctly : Compliance Condition Code ( CCC ) : Late payments must be reported with proper CCC designations to indicate the account 's actual status during the period in question. 

Payment Rating Field : This field must accurately reflect the timeliness of payments based on the billing cycle. Misreported data here could result in erroneous late payment reporting. 

Account Status Code : This must align with the current account condition. An outdated or incorrect status could inaccurately reflect delinquencies. 

Date of First Delinquency ( DOFD ) : Any late payment information must include a proper DOFD to ensure compliance with credit reporting standards. 

Given the potential for inaccurate reporting, I request that your organization : Conduct a thorough investigation of the reporting for this account. 

Validate the accuracy of the reported late payments against Metro 2 standards. 

Provide documentation supporting the accuracy of the reporting if no changes are made. 

Remove or correct any data that is inconsistent with the Metro 2 guidelines or FCRA requirements. 

Please consider this letter a formal dispute under the FCRA. I have enclosed copies of my credit report highlighting the disputed entries, as well as any supporting documentation that may assist in your investigation. 

I expect to receive a response to this dispute within 30 days, as stipulated under the FCRA. If the inaccuracies are not corrected, I may escalate this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or take legal action to ensure compliance. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and notify me of the results of your investigation.
