Consumer complaint narrative:
The credit agency has willfully violated my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by unlawfully reinserting inaccurate and unverifiable items into my credit report without proper notification as required by 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ). These violations have caused significant damage to my credit profile, including a drastic drop in my credit score, leaving it lower than before the insertion. This blatant disregard for compliance constitutes a serious breach of 15 USC 1681e ( b ) for failing to maintain accuracy in reporting and further violates my privacy under 15 USC 1681b. 

Your negligent and erroneous reporting has caused statutory damages, severe harm to my financial reputation, and hindered my ability to achieve future goals. Additionally, these actions are deceptive and violate FDCPA 15 USC 1692e for misrepresentation and CBA standards, further escalating the harm caused. 

I demand immediate correction of all false and damaging information, statutory damages for the harm caused, and a formal acknowledgment of your violations. Failure to act promptly will result in further legal action to seek remedies for these violations, including additional penalties for the inconvenience and harm caused to my financial future. 


Experian know exactly what items there were because it was deleted. 

XXXX. XXXX credit card ( Multiple accounts ) I only had one 2. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX ( Violating IRS guidelines/delete immediately ) XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( reporting inaccurate billing information/ account has fraudulent charges on the account. Please update the account immediately and the creditor didn't contact me or advise me whats going on with the credit card due to me not knowing whats going on. The company closed the account. )

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX filed an identity theft report through the FTC, ( XXXX ) I also included a police report ( XXXX ) cover letter of dispute. Copy of identification, validation documentation of my legal address and a lease agreement without signatures per leesee request. 

I sent these documents through US mail to all 3 major credit bereaus, I also uploaded the documentation, police report and FTC report to all 3 bereaus. 

I've actually uploaded the supporting documentation multiple times to all of the Bereaus, XXXX, Experian and XXXX throughout the month of XXXX. 

Since uploading the original documentation plus a dispute letter outlining my rights through the resource pages on the FTC website I have uploaded additional documentation validating my residence outside of the US from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. 

The accts that were not blocked or deleted were disputed originally and again on XX/XX/XXXX when I uploaded the lease agreement to all 3 bereaus. 

XXXX and Experian have platforms that provide multiple ways of disputing accts on my credit report and XXXX website is set up to navigate the user through a sales funnel for the paid membership that they offer users that require frequent credit reports and scores. 
Since beginning the repair journey I've logged over 26hours online and on chat plus phone calls to agents at XXXX. 
Nothing in that entire time has provided online access to my credit report. 
They continual share the same troubleshooting data that they have in script and that I have followed multiple times to get a copy of my report. 

I recently filed a dispute about the issues with Transunions timeliness and less than attentive concern to address the inquiries and fraudulent accts that are still on my credit report. My request was to get results or answers to my original dispute and identity theft case filed early XXXX. 
XXXX has told me that the platform they use has technical issues and that they will be resolved within 2 to 3 days of time however this is not true, I can not access my credit report through the XXXX platform. 

My request is that XXXX remove the hard inquiries from my credit report as they are fraudulent and numerous, I also request that they block the additional accts that I disputed with documentation on XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX with validating documentation that I included with all of my disputes. 

The complaint that I filed prevuousky through CFPB about XXXX barely touches the issues, delays and absence of action that XXXX has exampled throughout my effort to restore my good credit standing. The process has not been as stated in the Fair Credit Reporting Act and I want the hard inquiries and fraudulent accts blocked from my profile, and from potential credit opportunities. 
The response that I received after using this platform to express the problems that have been encountered do not hold this company accountable for the lack of action and the lack of progress despite following the FTC guidelines to restore my credit rating to pre identity theft condition. 
By allowing XXXX additional time after 30 days has passed is not providing me the consumer with anything that I wasn't already experiencing before addressing my issues to the CFPB. 

PLEASE make XXXX address the identity theft accts on my report, remove all of the fraudulent inquiries so I can begin to build a healthy FICO score. The opportunity that having good credit provides has been stolen from me and time is of the essence. I own a company and can not provide the basics of ownership to the people that XXXX employee. Getting funding of any amount to grow the company in order to hire more people is passing me by and the time, effort and energy that I have applied to just getting back to XXXX has been mountainous by any standard. 

My request is to not give this company any more of the most valuable commodity we have as humans, TIME. 
Please make this company do the right thing and remove the negative and fraudulent inquiries that plaque my credit profile immediately. 

Thank you so very much! 

With respect, consideration. 

Kindly XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX and Social Security Number : XXXX, and Date of XXXX, Contents of Complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you shall block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of : Unauthorized Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXhese accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. Rule 9037 Protecting Privacy for Filings the credit bureaus have failed to protect my privacy.

RULE 9037 is a law in place to protect privacy filings to the public the purpose of credit reporting is for creditors to REPORT NOT THE CREDIT BUREAUS.

The credit bureaus are violating my privacy rights also being that I am a victim of identity theft they are putting me at risk.

I did not request the bureaus to report, furnish, and/or transmit bankruptcy court records or any third party information on my credit file. These bankruptcies are not being reported or validated by the courts.

Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that these accounts were created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting.

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure these accounts are removed from my credit reports immediately.

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address these violations promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian Credit Union XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute Regarding CFPB Complaint # XXXX Dear Experian, This letter serves as a formal demand for immediate corrective action regarding the inaccurate reporting of the XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX on my consumer report. Per your response to CFPB Complaint # XXXX, you stated that the account was verified with the original creditor, XXXX XXXX . However, my original dispute explicitly outlined why this account should either reflect a {$0.00} balance or be removed entirely, as XXXX XXXX has failed to provide proof of debt cancellation or otherwise substantiate the alleged debt. 
Background and Current Issues 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX Lack of Verification XXXX XXXX XXXX confirmed that the account was charged off. However, despite my request, they have failed to provide a 1099-C forma document required to verify any cancellation of debt reported to the IRS. Instead, they assert that I remain obligated for the debt without providing the legally required documentation to support their claim. 
2. Experian 's Inaccurate Reporting o By continuing to report this account without verification, Experian is knowingly disseminating inaccurate and unverifiable information. This action directly violates my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Laws Violated 1. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Information o Experian is obligated to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information it reports. Failing to remove or update this account to reflect a {$0.00} balance violates this provision. 
2. 15 U.S. Code 1681i Dispute Resolution o Experian must conduct a thorough investigation when a consumer disputes an account. If the original creditor can not or will not verify the accuracy of the account, Experian must either delete it or update it to reflect accurate information. By relying solely on unverifiable information from XXXX XXXX, Experian has violated this section. 
3. 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( a ) Furnisher Responsibilities o XXXX XXXX , as the furnisher of this information, is obligated to report only accurate and complete information. Their failure to provide a 1099-C while claiming the debt remains owed contradicts their reporting to the IRS, thereby violating this provision. 
4. 15 U.S. Code 1681c Obsolete Information o If this account was charged off and reported to the IRS as a loss, it is either canceled debt or an uncollectible charge-off. Reporting such an account with a balance due is misleading and does not align with the FCRA 's requirements to ensure accurate reporting. 
Demand for Immediate Action I demand that Experian : 1. Update the Account to Reflect a {$0.00} Balance o Since this account was reported to the IRS as a charge-off or canceled debt, it must reflect this on my consumer report. 
2. Delete the Account Entirely o If XXXX XXXX can not or will not provide sufficient verification of the debt, this account must be removed from my consumer report under FCRA guidelines. 
3. Provide a Detailed Response o Provide me with a written explanation of the steps Experian has taken to ensure compliance with the FCRA, including details of your investigation process for this account. 
Failure to comply with the FCRA and rectify this issue will leave me no choice but to pursue further legal remedies, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and seeking civil damages as allowed under 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Negligent Noncompliance ). 
I expect a full resolution within 15 days of receipt of this letter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Yes, Section XXXX of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) governs the time period that negative information can remain on your credit report. It outlines the requirements for removal of certain negative items after a specified period, as follows : Key Provisions of Section 605 ( FCRA ) Regarding Credit Reporting : 1. General Time Limitations on Negative Information : Most negative information, such as accounts in collections or charged-off accounts, can remain on your credit report for up to 7 years from the date of the first delinquency that led to the negative status. 

XXXX. Bankruptcies : XXXX XXXX  bankruptcies can remain for 10 years, while XXXX XXXX bankruptcies remain for 7 years. 

3. Fraudulent Accounts : Under Section 605B of the FCRA, if an account is opened fraudulently ( as in the case of identity theft ), you are not liable for the fraudulent debt, and the account must be removed from your credit report once you report the fraud to the credit bureaus. 

4. Inaccurate Information : Any information that is inaccurate or incomplete must be corrected or removed from your credit report after a dispute investigation. If the information can not be verified, it must be removed from your report.

5. Fraud Alerts and Identity Theft Protections : If youve filed a fraud report, you have the right to request a fraud alert or to place a credit freeze, and fraudulent accounts should be removed from your credit report once you present evidence such as a police report and FTC identity theft report.

How This Applies to my Situation : Since I have reported the account as fraudulent ( via the XXXX Police Department report and FTC identity theft affidavit ), Section 605B applies to my case. 

Under the FCRA, once the identity theft is reported and verified, Experian is required to remove the fraudulent account from my credit report, even if XXXX continues to assert the account is valid. 



XXXX. So I'm Contacting Experian Directly : Explicitly reference Section 605B of the FCRA that under the law, the fraudulent account must be removed from your credit report due to the identity theft reports I have filed with the XXXX Police Department and the FTC. 

XXXX. Include Supporting Documents : attach the XXXX Police Report and the FTC Identity Theft Report to to my dispute, as these are key pieces of evidence to support my claim. 

XXXX. I'm Cite FCRA Requirements : Experian Subject : Formal Dispute Request for Removal of Fraudulent Account Under FCRA Section 605B Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of a XXXX XXXX account ( Account Number : XXXX ) on my credit report. As previously stated, this account was opened fraudulently without my knowledge or consent, and I have provided supporting documentation, including a XXXX Police Department report and an FTC identity theft affidavit. 



Under Section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), once I report identity theft and provide documentation confirming the fraudulent nature of the account, you are required to remove the fraudulent account from my credit report. As a victim of identity theft, I am entitled to have this account removed, and I request that you take immediate action to comply with the law. 



Please find attached the following documents for your review : XXXX Police Department Report ( XXXX XXXX : XXXX ). 

FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report Number : XXXX ). 



I kindly request that you promptly update my credit report to reflect the removal of this fraudulent account. If the account can not be verified as legitimate, it must be removed from my credit file in accordance with the FCRA. 



I expect your response within the 30-day timeframe required under the FCRA. Should you fail to take the appropriate action, I will pursue further remedies, including escalating this matter with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and considering legal options. 



Sincerely,

Violations of Federal Laws : This misreporting violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) under sections 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 1681s-2, which require accurate reporting and correction of errors. 
Account Information Account Type : Auto Lease Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$21000.00} Date Reported : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Status : Open and Current Monthly Payment : {$580.00} Payment History : Incorrectly shows a XXXX late payment in XX/XX/XXXX. 
Requested Resolution I request that Experian investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate late payment from XX/XX/XXXX. Please provide written confirmation of this correction within 30 days. 
Enclosed are bank statements and autopay records to verify my on-time payments. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this dispute. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding an issue I encountered with Experian related to the removal of a remark from my credit report and the subsequent resubmission of that remark without proper certification, which I believe violates federal law. 

On XX/XX/year>, I contacted Experians customer service and spoke with a representative named XXXX ( confirmation number : XXXX ). During this conversation, I was informed that a remark associated with my credit accounts from XXXX and XXXX XXXX had been removed. However, this remark was later resubmitted to my credit report without the proper certification as required by federal law. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I understand that credit reporting agencies must ensure that all information reported is accurate and verifiable. It is my belief that Experian has failed to comply with these requirements by allowing XXXX and XXXX XXXX to resubmit the remark without a certification, which I understand is required for such actions. 

I respectfully request that your office investigate this matter thoroughly. The resubmission of this remark without the necessary documentation appears to be a clear violation of federal regulations, and I am seeking your assistance in ensuring this issue is corrected and that my credit report is accurately updated. 

For your reference, I have attached any relevant documentation, including my communication with Experian, the details of the remark in question, and any supporting records. 

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and appreciate your efforts in ensuring fair and legal credit reporting practices.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently checked my credit report and discovered that Credence has placed an item on my report that I was not previously aware of. At no point did I receive a written notice from Credence informing me of this alleged debt, as required under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 1692g ( a ). This notice is critical because it would have outlined my rights to dispute the debt and request validation within 30 days of their initial contact. 

Additionally, the lack of notice has denied me the opportunity to properly address or dispute the debt before it was reported to the credit bureaus, which is a violation of my consumer rights under both the FDCPA and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Credence 's failure to notify me and provide me with the opportunity to dispute the debt prior to reporting it has caused unnecessary harm to my credit and financial well-being. 

I am requesting that Credence : Immediately provide full validation of the alleged debt, including any agreements or documentation tying me to the debt. 
Remove the entry from my credit report until proper validation is completed. 
Ensure full compliance with federal laws, including providing written notice and an opportunity to dispute any alleged debt in the future. 
This failure to notify me and respect my rights under federal laws has caused undue stress and harm, and I request the CFPB 's assistance in addressing and resolving this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
There are two bankruptcies being reported on my credit file listed below : XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy : REFERENCE NUMBERXXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy : REFERENCE NUMBER:XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  When I reached out to the courts I was told they do not report to the credit bureaus.

The credit bureaus also stated they do not participate in the investigation of the disputes but fail to explain who does. Who is the source because the bankruptcy court isn't reporting these records.

Rule 9037 Protecting Privacy for Filings the credit bureaus have failed to protect my privacy.

Additionally, the Bankruptcy Court does not report, furnish, and/or transmit bankruptcy Court records or other information to the credit reporting agencies.

The bankruptcy court, for cause, may protect an individual, with respect to the following types of information to the extent the court finds that disclosure of such information would create undue risk of identity theft or other unlawful injury to the individual or the individuals property.

The credit reporting agencies independently obtain Bankruptcy case information.

RULE 9037 is a law in place to protect privacy filings to the public the purpose of credit reporting is for creditors to REPORT NOT THE CREDIT BUREAUS.

The credit bureaus are violating my privacy rights also being that I am a victim of identity theft they are putting me at risk.

I did not request the bureaus to report, furnish, and/or transmit bankruptcy court records or any third party information on my credit file. These bankruptcies are not being reported or validated by the courts.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on My Credit Report under FCRA 1681 ( c ) ( 2 ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information that appears on my credit report. This dispute is filed under the protections afforded by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 1681 ( c ) ( 2 ), which outlines my rights as a consumer to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information directly with the furnisher of the information and ensures that such disputes are properly investigated.

Additionally, I am invoking my rights under the following laws that further protect consumers from inaccurate credit reporting : 1. FCRA 1681 ( i ) : This section requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputed information within 30 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute.

2. FCRA 1681 ( e ) : This section mandates that information reported about a consumer must be accurate and complete.

3. FCRA 1681 ( s ) : This section provides additional protections against identity theft, ensuring fraudulent accounts are removed promptly after proper verification.

4. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : This act prohibits debt collectors from reporting false or misleading information to credit reporting agencies.

Disputed Item Details : * Creditor/Furnisher Name : XXXX XXXX * Account Number : XXXX * Date of Reported Issue : XX/XX/year> The following information is incorrect or incomplete for the following reasons : 1- accounts number shows incomplete 2-date reported do not match in the 3 credit bareus 3- the account has been marked as charged off repeatedly that is illegal I have attached the following documents as evidence to support my dispute : 1. A copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed item ( s ) 2. [ Other supporting documents, such as proof of wrong information reported in my credit report Pursuant to the FCRA and the above-mentioned laws, I respectfully request the following actions : 1. Investigate the disputed information with the furnisher of the data.

2. Correct or delete the inaccurate information if the investigation confirms its inaccuracy.

3. Provide me with the results of the investigation and a corrected copy of my credit report.

4. If applicable, provide me with the name, address, and telephone number of the furnisher contacted during the investigation.

Please be advised that the FCRA mandates credit reporting agencies to complete investigations within 30 days of receiving a dispute. I expect a timely resolution to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : I am a XXXXXXXX XXXX  law abiding citizen. I am XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX held to highest degree and regard of moral, civil, and ethical duties and dealings. I am gainfully employed and do not engage in low vibrational and distasteful acts such as what is being described below. 
Unsure of exact initial dates, but on or about XX/XX/2024 I was contacted by an XXXX XXXX  fraud department representative regarding " potential fraudulent activities '' that had taken place on my fathers bank account in which I am a co op due to him developing XXXX XXXX. I was informed that there were several checks that were deposited into his primary account ( which is where he received his SSI checks every month ) and the bank cleared but returned back as " bad checks ''. This was my first time learning of these circumstances and I explained to the representative that the checks in fact had to be fraudulent because I did not recognize the names of the individuals that appeared on them. I also explained that I was only on the account because of my fathers failing cognition and just in case we ever ran into problems such as him losing his card or inability to access his account, that my being on there would streamline this process of getting these issues situated, yet I've never as much passed a check through his account nor do I receive monetary gains through this account. The representative asked me to get in contact with my father because they were having no success at getting ahold of him because of phone connectivity issues. She did inform me at this time that they would proceed to close the account the first week of XXXX if there was no resolve. I would end up having the same issues with phone connectivity with my father as well and was unsuccessful at verifying things until the account was " closed '' with XXXX XXXX. Once I was able to get to my father, he did inform me that his wallet was stolen ( which because of his XXXX XXXX, he kept his PIN number to his ATM card taped to the back of his card ). 
On or around XXXX, XXXX, I was attempting to be placed on my Husbands bank account with XXXX XXXX  when I was informed by the XXXX representative who ran a consumer banking report that I would not be able to be placed on his account due to me being flagged by " XXXX '' for " fraudulent check activity ''. I immediately requested my XXXX file and received my consumer report in the mail late XX/XX/2024 which did state that I was reported for " Suspected fraudulent activity '' involving an unpaid balance of {$2300.00}, owed to XXXX XXXX. After becoming aware of this, I made a trip up to XXXX XXXX  XXXX in XXXX, Kansas where I was able to speak to a management team member by the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX did provide me a copy of the bank statements showing that there had been a total of 3 checks that were apparently deposited at the ATM into my fathers account. I asked XXXX were any camera 's used to attempt to catch those responsible for the fraudulent activities to which her response was " no ''. I asked XXXX if they tried to validate who wrote out the checks because the handwriting was not mines nor my fathers, to which XXXX responded " no ''. Thirdly, I asked to see who endorsed the checks to check the signature and to my surprise, none of the three checks were ever endorsed. I asked XXXX why did the bank not take responsibility for allowing the checks to completely clear without an endorsement on the back to which her response was " we were using the " good faith '' rule to allow them to clear, as we have never had any issues with your fathers account in the past ''. XXXX refused to reverse their decision to " hold me responsible '' for their bank allowing unendorsed, fraudulent checks to clear with every indication that these checks were not legit. 
Unfortunately, I have been denied access to being added to my husbands bank account with XXXX XXXX  due to me being added to XXXX, I have been denied an auto loan with my own XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and most recently learned that the fraudulent checks have been passed to a third party who have now flogged me that much more by adding a " collections account '' to my credit report, which has lowered my score more than XXXX XXXX. Not to mention my aging father has suffered all the same. 
Please see all exhibits attached below including the checks deposited with no endorsement, my fathers one page bank statement showing the banks allowed the cashing of the fraudulent checks, and my personal XXXX XXXX file showing the suspicious activity alert and amount owed to XXXX XXXX  ( as well as the many credit pulls I had attempting to gain access to a new auto loan for which I was denied, this includes my personal credit union who I've been in excellent standing with for more than 13 years ). After all, my bank would never cash an unendorsed check, not even a legitimate one.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear [ XXXX/Experian/XXXX   ], I am writing to formally dispute the inclusion of multiple inaccurate and unauthorized accounts on my credit report. Specifically : 1. An account reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) regarding a vehicle loan. 
2. An account reported by XXXX Bank, which I have never had any dealings with. 

I have never opened an account with either XXXX XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX, nor have I had any financial transactions or agreements with these institutions. The reporting of these accounts is false, unverifiable, and a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681.

As per the FCRA, you are required to ensure all information on my credit report is accurate and verifiable. Failure to do so constitutes a direct violation of federal law. These accounts can not be verified because they are fraudulent and do not belong to me.

Demands : 1. Remove these accounts from my credit report immediately and ensure no further reporting from these institutions regarding these accounts.

2. Provide written confirmation of the removal of these accounts within three ( 3 ) days of receiving this letter. 
3. Cease reporting any negative or unauthorized information about me from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, or any related entities. 

Failure to act within the specified timeframe will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and pursuing legal remedies. 

I have attached a copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed accounts for your reference, along with the required proof of my identity, including a government-issued ID and utility bill. 

Please treat this correspondence as a formal and urgent dispute. I expect a resolution within the next three ( 3 ) business days to avoid further action. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Consumer Reporting Agency Subject : Request for Removal of Inaccurate Information Based on XXXX XXXX Dear Consumer Reporting Department, I am writing to inform you that after disputing the following accounts with XXXX, the accounts were fully deleted from my XXXX credit report as of XX/XX/year>. The accounts involved in the dispute were : XXXX XXXX Delaware XXXX 's XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX As you are aware, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they report. Since XXXX has deleted these accounts from their records, the information should no longer be considered valid or reportable on my credit file with your agency. Therefore, I respectfully request that you conduct your own investigation into these accounts and delete them from my credit report as well, in accordance with the findings by XXXX. 

In accordance with FCRA Section 1681i, if the information reported by you can not be verified, it must be removed from my credit file within XXXX  days of this notification. As XXXX has already determined that these accounts were unverifiable and have removed them, I trust that you will take appropriate action to ensure that my credit report is accurate and up to date. 

Please be advised that if these unverifiable accounts are not removed from my credit report within XXXX days, I will have no choice but to consider further legal action to enforce my rights. Under FCRA Section 1681p, I have the right to seek damages for any violations, including the right to sue for failure to remove inaccurate or unverifiable information. 

I expect to receive written confirmation that the accounts in question have been removed from my credit file within the legally required XXXX period. Should the accounts not be deleted, I will pursue all legal remedies available to me, including filing a lawsuit. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please notify me of the status of your investigation and removal of these accounts from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute fraudulent accounts on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent, and their reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX XXXX ( Experian, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX ) XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX

Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that these accounts were created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting.

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure these accounts are removed from my credit reports immediately.

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address these violations promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

Thank you for your urgent attention to this matter.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Subject : Formal Complaint : Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Account and Correction of Personal Information To Whom It May Concern, I am submitting this personal statement to request the immediate removal of the following XXXX unauthorized hard inquiries from my credit report. These inquiries were made without my explicit consent or permissible purpose under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, and their presence on my report is a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX conducted an unauthorized inquiry. Additionally, on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX via Dealer made inquiries that I did not authorize. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, an inquiry was made by XXXX XXXX XXXX, which was done without my knowledge or approval. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, multiple inquiries were performed without my consent, including by XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX. Similarly, on XX/XX/XXXX, unauthorized inquiries were conducted by XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX via Dealer. 

Additional unauthorized inquiries include those by XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, as well as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, all on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Lastly, on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX via XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX conducted inquiries without permissible purpose. 

These inquiries are negatively impacting my creditworthiness and were performed in direct violation of federal law. I respectfully request that these inquiries be removed immediately to ensure compliance with my rights as a consumer. 



I am submitting this formal complaint regarding the unauthorized and inaccurate information being reported on my consumer credit report by Experian, XXXX, and XXXX. Specifically, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number XXXX ) is unlawfully reporting an account that I did not authorize or consent to, and no debt validation has been provided. 

Additionally, I must highlight that only my legal name, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, should be reported. Any variations, inaccuracies, or unauthorized aliases are a misrepresentation of my identity and must be removed immediately. 

Violations of Federal Law XXXX. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Under FCRA Section 605B, unauthorized accounts must be blocked within XXXX business days of receiving appropriate documentation. I have submitted my FTC Identity Theft Report, government-issued identification, proof of address, and SSN, which legally suffice. 
XXXX. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : Security Credit Services has failed to validate the alleged debt. Continuing to report an unverified debt violates federal law and my rights as a consumer. 
XXXX. Unfair and Deceptive Practices ( FTC Act, Section 5 ( a ) ) : By retaining and reporting unauthorized information, the credit bureaus are engaging in deceptive practices that harm my creditworthiness. 
XXXX. Consumer Privacy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : The agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy. Reporting incorrect names and unauthorized accounts contravenes this obligation. 

My Demands XXXX. Immediate Removal : The account with XXXX XXXX XXXX and any unauthorized aliases or addresses must be removed from my report within XXXX ( XXXX ) business days. 
XXXX. Correction of Personal Information : Only my legal name, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and my correct address, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX, should be reported. 
XXXX. Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation that the unauthorized account and incorrect information have been removed and will not appear again. 

Consequences of Noncompliance Failure to act promptly will result in escalation, including filing further complaints with regulatory authorities and pursuing all legal remedies. This includes : Statutory damages of {$1000.00} per violation under FCRA. 
Punitive damages for willful violations of federal law. 
Liability under 18 U.S.C. 894 for extortionate collection practices if applicable. 

Thank you for addressing this matter promptly. I expect full compliance within the stated timeframe. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX

The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX RE : Fraudulent Accounts and Inquiries Immediate Action Required ( XXXX : XXXX ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to demand the immediate and permanent deletion of fraudulent accounts and inquiries that have been unlawfully reported on my consumer file as a result of identity theft. This information must be removed without delay and must never be reinserted into my file under any circumstances. Any failure to comply with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) will not be tolerated. 

XXXX XXXX Violated : 1. 15 USC 1681b ( c ) Furnishing Reports Without Consumer Authorization As per the statute, consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from furnishing records of inquiries connected to credit or insurance transactions that I, the consumer, did not initiate. The following inquiries must be permanently removed from my report without delay.

2. 18 U.S.C. 1028A Aggravated Identity Theft I am a victim of identity theft. Under this law, any fraudulent use of my identity is a federal crime punishable by an additional term of two years imprisonment for the offenders. Your negligence in verifying this information perpetuates the criminal activity and further damages my financial standing.

3. 15 USC 1681c2 Block of Fraudulent Information Pursuant to this law, you are required to block all fraudulent information related to identity theft within four business days of receiving a valid identity theft report. Additionally, you are legally barred from reinserting this information unless thorough and verifiable documentation is provided and I am notified in writing, as required by the FCRA. 

Fraudulent Accounts : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts were not authorized by me and must be removed from my report immediately. Furthermore, I demand confirmation in writing that this information has been deleted and will not be reinserted into my credit file in the future. 

Failure to Act : If these fraudulent accounts and inquiries are not permanently deleted and an updated consumer report is not sent to me promptly, as mandated under 15 USC 1681c-1 ( 2 ), I will escalate this matter to the following entities : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, both in your jurisdiction and mine Non-compliance will lead to formal legal action, including seeking damages for the harm caused by your continued violation of my rights.

Enclosures : Copy of my government-issued ID Proof of address ( vehicle registration ) Copy of my Social Security card FTC Identity Theft Report I expect immediate and decisive action. I also remind you of your obligations under the FCRA to ensure that once fraudulent information is deleted, it is not reinserted without following the strict legal guidelines for doing so. Failure to comply will result in further legal action and formal complaints to federal and state agencies. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

This is your final opportunity to correct your violation and avoid legal consequences. I expect your full cooperation and confirmation that the account has been removed from my credit report. 
You have XXXX  days to comply with this demand.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Account No. XXXX Continued Debt Dispute, Consumer Rights Violations, and Immediate Demand for Compliance Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to demand immediate compliance with my previous request for debt validation and to address multiple violations of my consumer rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my initial contact in XX/XX/XXXX and subsequent communications, Transworld Systems continues to fail to meet its legal obligations. 

Chronological Events Regarding this Account : XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : Mailed Certified Letter Requesting Debt Validation o On this date, I mailed a certified letter to Transworld Systems requesting full validation of the alleged debt in accordance with my rights under the FDCPA. I demanded a signed agreement between myself and the original creditor, as well as proof of assignment and the monetary compensation accepted by XXXX XXXX XXXX for this debt. 

2. Follow-Up Call to Transworld Systems o After receiving no adequate response to my request, I called Transworld Systems to follow up. During this call, a representative unlawfully requested that I pay {$1.00} to receive debt validation, which is a direct violation of the FDCPA. A consumer is not required to make any payment to receive validation of a debt. 

3. Filed a Complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) - Case # XXXX o On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) under Case # XXXX due to Transworld Systems ' failure to provide the requested debt validation. However, Transworld Systems marked the case as a duplicate and did not properly investigate or resolve the matter, which further violates my rights. 

XXXX. Opened Another CFPB Case - Case # XXXX o After the initial complaint went unresolved, I opened another case with the CFPB under Case # XXXX, requesting an investigation into Transworld Systems ' ongoing non-compliance with my original request from XX/XX/XXXX. Despite this, I received yet another letter from Transworld Systems confirming their non-compliance, further substantiating their violations. 

FDCPA and FCRA Violations : Below, I have outlined the specific violations under the FDCPA and FCRA that Transworld Systems is committing : 1. Failure to Provide Adequate Debt Validation ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ) o Under the FDCPA, upon receiving a consumer 's request for debt validation, a debt collector must cease all collection activity until they provide the requested validation. This includes providing a copy of the signed agreement with the original creditor and proof of assignment. Transworld Systems has failed to provide these documents, which is a direct violation of the law. 

2. Failure to Cease Collection Activities ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ) o Transworld Systems has not ceased collection activities, including reporting this debt to the credit bureaus, while the debt remains in dispute. Under the FDCPA, once a debt is disputed, they are required to halt all collection actions until proper validation is provided. 

3. Failure to Provide Proof of Debt Assignment and Transfer ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 2 ) ( A ) ; FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) ) o I have requested proof of assignment and proof of the transfer of this debt from XXXX XXXX XXXX  to Transworld Systems , including the amount paid for the debt. These documents are critical to properly validate the debt, yet Transworld Systems has failed to provide any such evidence, violating both the FDCPA and FCRA. 

4. Unlawful Request for Payment to Validate Debt ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ) o During a phone conversation with a representative, I was unlawfully asked to pay {$1.00} in order to receive debt validation, which is an explicit violation of the FDCPA. Debt collectors are prohibited from requesting payment in exchange for debt validation. This request is not only inappropriate but also unlawful under FDCPA Section 1692g ( b ), which prohibits the imposition of any fees for validation. 

XXXX. Failure to Investigate CFPB Complaints ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692d, 1692e ) o After filing my complaints with the CFPB ( Case # XXXX and XXXX # XXXX ), Transworld Systems failed to investigate and resolve the matter properly. Instead, they marked the complaint as a duplicate and failed to provide the necessary documentation and response. This behavior constitutes deceptive and misleading practices, as outlined in FDCPA Section 1692d and 1692e.

I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX I looked at my credit report and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681i 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute the reporting and handling of account, as it contains several violations of my rights under federal law. Specifically, under 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to privacy, which has been violated by furnishing or sharing my account information without my express written consent. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish account information without my explicit written instructions, which I have not provided. Furthermore, per 15 U.S.C. 1681a paragraph ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), transactions improperly reported that do not meet consumer reporting standards should be excluded from my consumer report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, a creditor may not treat payments on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose unless proper notice is mailed to the consumer at least 21 days before the due date. To my knowledge, I did not receive any such notice or statement. Lastly, 15 U.S.C. 1637b requires that creditors provide clear and timely disclosures of payment terms, which I did not receive in relation to this account. Based on these violations, I demand the immediate removal of all late payments associated with this account from my credit report, written confirmation that any improperly included transactions have been removed, and proof that all required notices and disclosures were properly sent.

Consumer complaint narrative: I received a call from my bank saying that my bank account had fraudulent activity. I checked my bank and asked what the fraudulent activity was. They said that somebody had called saying that someone had opened an account with their name with my bank. I was then confused so I decided to check my credit report. I checked all three credit bureaus and realized that XXXX of the XXXX credit bureaus had multiple credit reports on my file that were not mine. XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted the particular credit bureau on their website and submitted a dispute for the many reports on file that did not belong to me. I was not able to handle the dispute online and was directed to call the number of that XXXX credit bureau for further help. The person that was helping me on the phone was able to pretty much remove every report that was not mine as it seems there was a credit file mix. However, a couple months later, I noticed that XXXX of the reports was not removed from my credit report from the other person. And that report happens to be a bankruptcy which is affecting my credit in a very negative way. XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a bankruptcy dispute to contact that XXXX credit bureau to have that bankruptcy that did not belong to me removed from my credit report. Unfortunately, they did not remove the bankruptcy from my credit report, so I decided to act and contact the court that issued the bankruptcy and tell them that it was not mine. They also told me that I would have to contact the credit Bureau and file a dispute which I had already done previously. I ended up submitting a second bankruptcy dispute with new updates from the court that issued the bankruptcy to the other individual. Once again, I was denied the removal of the bankruptcy from my credit report, so I decided to make a complaint.

Also, violation of due process, trespass & defamation of character.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am concerned about the validity and accuracy of your recent investigation of these accounts that are reporting on my credit report. Last month I requested an investigation because I felt the item was not being reported legally. Couple of days ago I received a letter stating that you have ceased investigation of my credit reports because, in your opinion, you believe that I have used a third-party credit repair agency. Not only do I believe this to be a stall tactic on your part to grant you an additional 30 days to comply with my original request, but I believe it to be a blatant violation of the FCRA. 
I have attached a copy of my government issued ID as well as mail showing proof of address. So, there shouldnt be no confusion or stall tactics on your end. I have maintained a careful record of my communications with you for the purpose of filing a complaint with the FTC should you continue in your non-compliance. 
I request this under 15 U.S. Code 1692g - Validation of debts. If information is not provided or the false reporting isnt removed ; as in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ), you may be liable for your willful non-compliance. Credit reporting laws ensure that bureaus report only 100 % accurate credit information. Every step must be taken to assure the information reported is completely accurate and correct. The following information therefore needs to be reinvestigated. 


1.Please explain to me what your representatives uncovered to lead them to believe that you are reporting this item as it legally should be reported? 
2.What certified documents were reviewed to conclude your investigation? 
3.Please provide a complete copy of all of the information that was transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation. 
4.What did it cost your company to obtain the documents needed to complete your investigation? 
5.Please provide proof of your timely procurement of certified documents. 
6.Did you speak directly to any agent of the company that was reporting the information to confirm the accuracy of what you are reporting? 
7.If yes to above : a.Who did you speak to? 
b.On what date? 
c.How long was the conversation? 
d.What was their position? 
e.What telephone number did you call? 
f. What is the name of the employee of your company that spoke directly to the above party? 
g.What is the position of the employee of your company that spoke directly to the above party? 
h.How long has that employee been employed by your company? 
i.What formal training was provided to this employee to investigate items of this kind? 
j.Was there any email or written communication between members of your company and the above party? 
8.If so, please provide copies of all correspondence ; supply copies of any and all conclusive documentation to prove that you have in fact conducted a reasonable investigation of the account in question. 
9.Provide the date of the commencement of delinquency 10.Provide the SPECIFIC date reporting that these items will cease Enclosed with your response to the above questions I respectfully request a notarized affidavit confirming the information that is provided is true and correct as per my civil rights granted under several federal laws. This information should not come as a form letter response. 

My initial dispute was detailed and directly related to the account in question. A template response will not be an acceptable response. If you can not supply ALL of the above information in a timely manner as detailed in several laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I must immediately demand the permanent removal of this item from my credit report. 

This erroneous entry is detrimental to my overall credit rating and has caused me severe financial and emotional distress. If you choose not to provide the above requested deletion or requested/required documentation of your investigation, I will pursue the enforcements of my constitutional rights via federal court proceedings. As you are well aware this information will come out through my formal discovery process, and necessary depositions. I have recently studied constitutional consumer protection laws along with civil/federal court procedures. I will represent myself pro-se and will formally request a jury trial.

I am already involved in litigation with the car dealership that sold me this vehicle, the maker of the vehicle and the insurance company for knowingly selling me this vehicle with hidden engine issues. I am writing to dispute fraudulent information on my credit report pursuant to 15 U.S.C.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, XXXX falsely placed my mortgage into bankruptcy. On XX/XX/year>, at approximately XXXXXXXX XXXX EST, I contacted XXXX via their customer service phone line. I informed them that I had not filed for personal bankruptcy and was instructed to submit my proof to their legal department. On the same dayXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I submitted the actual docket, which showed that a company I worked for two years ago had filed for bankruptcy. My name was not included in their bankruptcy filing. 

The XXXX representative provided me with the name of their attorney and advised me to speak with him. On XX/XX/year>, I spoke with XXXX XXXX, an attorney from the law firm XXXX XXXX XXXX, who was handling the case. I explained the error to him, and he requested that I send him the proof. During the call, at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXST, I sent him the docket. He assured me that he would address the issue. However, as of the date of this report, he has not corrected the problem. 

On XX/XX/year>, XXXX continued to engage in fraudulent misrepresentation and unfair or deceptive trade practices by changing the mortgage address to a different address. Despite being presented with clear evidence, they have ignored it and appear to be engaging in willful blindness.

And during the times that I was waiting for someone to help me with this situation I was getting several 30 days behind. I did not have XXXX dollars to pay for a monthly payment. I finally spoke to someone at about XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX morning and she told me that my payments will be only {$160.00} each month and that is what I have paid for 1 yr and a 1/2. And she said she would send the situation up to a management team to state the conversation as well and nothing changed. Still never late. This is impacting my credit in a really big way. It shows that my monthly bills are much higher than they are. It has dampened and darkened many things that I could do with my life and my home it causes denial each time. I have disputed with all credit bureaus as well. I am very distraught.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Experian, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX. 
Subject : Demand for Immediate Late Payment Removal To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally demand the immediate removal of the late payment from all credit reporting agencies due to your blatant violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Account Number : XXXX Under FCRA XXXX XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ), it is your legal obligation to notate an account as in dispute once a consumer challenges its accuracy. You have failed to fulfill this requirement, despite my previous dispute notification. This constitutes a serious violation of federal law and demonstrates your reckless disregard for my rights as a consumer.

Your failure to properly update the dispute status of this account means you are reporting false and misleading information. According to FCRA 1681s-2, this violation provides me with automatic grounds for account removal.

I am demanding that you : 1. Immediately remove this late payment from all credit reporting agencies.

2. Provide written confirmation of the late payment deletion within 15 days.

Failure to Comply Will Result in Legal Action : If you do not comply with this demand, I will take the following action without further notice : File formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ).

Pursue legal action under FCRA Sections 1681n and 1681o for willful or negligent noncompliance, which may include claims for statutory damages, punitive damages, and attorneys fees.

This is your final opportunity to correct your violation and avoid legal consequences. I expect your full cooperation and confirmation that the account has been removed from my credit report.

You have 15 days to comply with this demand.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I discovered multiple late payment entries associated with my account that were inaccurately reported. As you are aware, Consumer Reporting Agencies bear a significant responsibility to ensure that all consumer information is reported with maximum accuracy. It is essential that the information reflected on my credit profile is both accurate and truthful. 

Specifically, I have never been late with any payments for my XXXX XXXX account ( Account # XXXX ). I respectfully request a thorough investigation into these erroneous late payment entries and demand that you provide verifiable proof, including statements, that demonstrate these payments were indeed late. To assist in this process, I can provide supporting documentation, including bank statements, payment notifications, timestamps from the XXXX payment app, and screenshots. 

Additionally, it is important to note that there have been substantial testimonies and reviews from numerous XXXX customers who have experienced similar issues regarding premature reporting of late payments. These reports indicate a pattern of errors where late payment flags are applied prematurely, negatively impacting credit scores. This further highlights the possibility of an internal issue with XXXX XXXX reporting practices, which needs immediate investigation. 

If sufficient proof can not be provided to substantiate these late payments, I demand the immediate removal of the derogatory marks and request that the account status be corrected to reflect " on time, never late, '' as this accurately represents the history of my payments. 

I have previously submitted multiple requests to the credit bureaus to address this issue, but to no avail. I am now seeking your assistance to rectify this error and ensure that my credit profile accurately reflects my payment history. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX ; TD Bank account management with TD Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Disputes had been reported to TD Bank ; ref Merchant purchased products or services. Consumer paid for {$140.00} at hair salon on XX/XX/XXXX. Consumer advised Merchant the service was below expectations and resulted in damage to hair and color applied was backwards from the formula designed to the sections as needed. The Merchant was advised. Merchants tend not to refund consumers for botched services and tend to maximize their denial until the Bank places a dispute or reason for refunds. TD Bank applied a dispute claim to the account by provisional credit. The expectations by the consumer is for TD Bank send notifications to the merchant, ref a claim or charge back. The Merchant may or may not agree with the claim, although it's customary to have the merchant make good on poor service or lack of service. TD Bank claims that there was no error made on the purchase ; therefore, the consumer pays back the credit. The consumer is left with poor service and the bill. T D Bank explanations aren't in line with the process of investigating debit purchases, because those funds are provided by the consumer deposits. Instead of following through with sufficient investigation, TD Bank rather have VISA determination as to errors rather than disputes that will effect the consumer and the merchant goes free. 
Second, a new submission was entered by the consumer, when TD Bank requested documentation from the consumer, explaining the incident or concerns and was made to fax documents direct to TD Bank claims department after the first decision of denial. Consumer contends that TD Bank isn't managing disputes directly with XXXX, instead is relying on XXXX to make determination by only looking into errors or fraudulent charges on bank card. It's obvious, there's no remedy to canceled orders, canceled service, botched services, or returned purchases. That's an issue and an ongoing problem within the industry. XXXX doesn't want to charge back an item to the Merchant ; given its working relationship. The Consumer is considered the payer and my not have alternatives to resolutions through financial institutions. 
Third, TD Bank mismanagement of disputes effects the bottom line in the consumers daily balance. In this case, the consumer had positive balance on XX/XX/XXXX. After TD Bank reversed {$140.00} on the account it caused negative balance. Plus TD Bank charged ( 2 ) overdrafts due to the reversal.

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to you regarding a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights, protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) ). Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I have identified the following accounts that have breached these legal provisions : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts have accessed my credit information without my explicit authorization, which constitutes a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights. Additionally, some of these accounts contain obsolete information that should be excluded from my credit report as stipulated in 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ).

According to 15 USC 1681, Section 602 ( A ), I have the right to privacy. Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681, Section 604 ( A ), Section 2, a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. Also, 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include any adverse item of information that is more than seven years old, other than records of convictions of crimes.

Finally, under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), no person shall furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Additionally, according to 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), a person shall not furnish information if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative: Now according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' Unfortunately I am victim of unfair practices.I am a consumer and Experian and XXXX Just to remind you I have a right to not have my information shared with third parties this is also backed ( 15 usc 6801 ) which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. " 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : IN ACCODANCE with the WRITTEN instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and Experian do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, Experian whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked effective immediately. Another reminder ( 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) a reference A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' I have yet to be informed of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission and is against the law. XXXX and Experian are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A chuonsumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting

It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information dispute by a consumer, an team of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, base on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( 1 ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. U.S Code 1681a-Definitions ; rules of construction, ( 1 ) In General-The terms consumer report Means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; ( B ) employment purposes ; or ( C ) any other purpose authorized under section 1681b of this title Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate.
