Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to you regarding a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights, protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) ). Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I have identified the following accounts that have breached these legal provisions : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts have accessed my credit information without my explicit authorization, which constitutes a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights. Additionally, some of these accounts contain obsolete information that should be excluded from my credit report as stipulated in 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ).

According to 15 USC 1681, Section 602 ( A ), I have the right to privacy. Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681, Section 604 ( A ), Section 2, a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. Also, 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include any adverse item of information that is more than seven years old, other than records of convictions of crimes.

Finally, under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), no person shall furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Additionally, according to 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), a person shall not furnish information if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

ACCOUNTS : XXXX  XXXX XXXX After I received correspondence from your agency, it stated that the accounts I disputed were verified by your agency. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) please complete this inaccurate account or delete it from my consumer reports.

The Law Cleary States : ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller. 

I DO NOT consent to any E-OSCAR verification as this method is not reliable or lawful, according to the standards set for by the FCRA. 

I am requesting that you validate the following items non-electronically, by performing a reasonable and FAIR re-investigation : Please provide the following details of the methods by which you verified these accounts : a. Identity and position of the representative contacted? 
b. Date, duration, and substance of the conversation?

c. Contact details utilized?

d. Identity, position, and tenure of your company 's employees involved?

e. Details of formal training imparted to said employee?

f. Copies of all written correspondence?

Your agency also seems to be in violation of non-compliance and negligent non-compliance with being in direct violation or the following laws : 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court.

( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

These are now multiple attempts to handle this matter privately. If these accounts keep getting verified by a faulty e-Oscar system when I know these accounts are erroneous and destroying my credit worthiness, I will in fact sue your agency for the maximum monetary damages that the FCRA allows.

Your agency has less than 30 days to respond with a fair reasonable re-investigation or I will have no choice but to seek legal action. This investigation must be validated by the information that I have listed above. If the information is not validated, then it must be deleted immediately from my consumer report!

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
In early XX/XX/XXXX received a letter from Freedom Mortgage indicating that an escrow refund check had been issued from my account, but not yet cashed. This was concerning to me as my escrow account should not be ahead at this time of year. 


I recalled that upon first purchasing my mortgage from XXXX, Freedom Mortgage did not properly implement my four-installment property tax payment plan. This plan is an election allowed by XXXX XXXX which sees the property tax from the previous year paid in four equal installments in XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. The election to use this payment plan is present in my Initial Escrow Disclosure Agreement, and communicated to Freedom in document provided by XXXX ( see attached ). 


Freedom is not heed these documents when paying my property tax, doing so in a single lump sum and thus overdrawing my escrow account at the end of XXXX. However, when I contacted them concerning this issue, they were quick to resolve the problem to my satisfaction. This left me with the impression they were properly managing the account. 


That was not the case. 


Upon closer inspection I have found severe errors with the Escrow Analysis performed by Freedom Mortgage in XXXX and XXXX of XXXX. 


In XXXX of XXXX  Freedom Mortgage issued an excess XXXX property tax payment to XXXX XXXX XXXX This was in addition to the erroneous lump sum amount they paid in XXXX in XXXX, evidently when they corrected my tax payment election they made it go into effect in XXXX not XXXX. Freedom contacted XXXX XXXX to request a refund, which was granted. 


Upon receiving the refund in XXXX of XXXX Freedom Mortgage conducted an Escrow analysis from the dates of XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. As a result, they did not include the XXXX and XXXX payments in their calculations and planned my Escrow to pay half of the actual task burden. This led Freedom to simultaneously predict an account shortage while lowering the amount I was required to pay. As a result of this XXXX estimate Freedom determined that I needed a new minimum balance of {$750.00}. 


In XXXX of XXXX I met that minimum balance prompting Freedom to again perform an escrow analysis. This time the analysis indicated I was to pay a single {$3300.00} property tax payment in XXXX of XXXX. This was half the actual sum, paid in a single installment, six months after the first payment would be due in XXXX. 


As a result of this baffling analysis Freedom further reduced my monthly escrow payment and issued a reimbursement check to me for {$410.00} to address what they identified as an excess balance in my account. When this check was not cashed Freedom sent a second letter asking me to confirm its receipt, causing me to look deeper into the situation. 


I contacted Freedom Mortgage on XXXX and made them aware of their misadministration. I asked for the following actions to occur : 1 ) Cancel the reimbursement check and apply its funds to my escrow account. 

2 ) Restore my escrow payment to the balance found in their XX/XX/XXXX analysis ( XXXX monthly ), as this would cover upcoming predicted withdrawals in XXXX, if only they would tolerate a temporary negative balance in XXXX of that year. 

3 ) Give me a consistent point of contact regarding my escrow account, as the issues were ongoing. 


I also voluntarily increased my XX/XX/XXXX escrow payment to {$650.00}, for a total payment of {$2800.00}. Freedom was requiring a total payment of {$2500.00}, with {$370.00} going to escrow. 



Since contacting their customer service Freedom has not responded to me directly despite their automatic reply indicating they would do so within 7 business days. However, I am reasonably certain they did read my letter as they did take the following actions : 1 ) Cancel the reimbursement check and apply its funds to my escrow account. 

2 ) Perform escrow reanalysis and set my monthly payment starting in XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  to {$780.00} a month, for a total payment of {$2900.00}. 


This situation has lead me to believe that Freedom Mortgage has mismanaged my account due to incompetence, then failed to make a good faith effort to resolve the situation. I, as a lay person, should not be the backstop for their accounting and projection errors. It is ridiculous to see my escrow swing from a {$410.00} dollar reimbursement to requiring an additional {$410.00} a month without any surprise expenses. This sees extra money leaving my pocket to compensate for Freedom 's mismanagement. 


Attached to this complaint is supporting documentation, including a letter I provided to Freedom Mortgage explaining the error in detail.

Consumer complaint narrative: RE : XXXX XXXX XXXX It is crucial that consumer reporting agencies uphold their grave responsibilities when it comes to the handling of consumers personal credit files. After performing a re-investigation upon my credit file for accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX pursuant to 15 USC 1681ia1a, your company failed to follow proper procedures in regard to correspondence to me the consumer, in the handling of the reinvestigation. As clearly outlined within, 15 USC 1681i ( 7 ) ; 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy Subchapter 7 states the following ; ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a detailed description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. Further outlined within 15 USC ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) ; ( 6 ) Notice of results of reinvestigation ( A ) In general A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than 5 business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency. ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. The correspondence mentioned above was NEVER made to me and therefore, your company is in direct violation of the FCRA and is now liable for monetary damages detailed within 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o. Not only was a proper reinvestigation not performed as the derogatory account mentioned is erroneous to begin with, your agency failed to follow the FCRAs clear rules in the handling of correspondence to me in association with the account in question. Please delete this erroneous account as I have sought legal counsel in this matter and intend on seeking damages associated with this complaint if this issue is not resolved. Thank you for your time.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Unfair and Punitive Practices by Bridgecrest Dear [ Consumer Protection Bureau ], I am writing to file a formal complaint against Bridgecrest, the finance company for XXXX, for engaging in practices that have caused significant and ongoing harm to my credit and financial standing. These actions appear to be punitive, unfair, and potentially in violation of consumer auto loan laws. 

In XX/XX/year>, Bridgecrest charged off my auto loan and repossessed the vehicle. Despite declaring the loan as a charge-off, they have continued to report the payments as late, which has severely defamed my credit profile and caused my credit score to plummet. This reporting has persisted for over three years, effectively destroying my ability to secure new financing. 

The following issues highlight the unfairness of Bridgecrests actions : Improper Reporting of Late Payments Post-Charge-Off : After charging off the loan, Bridgecrest continues to report payments as late, even though the debt was declared a charge-off. This practice is punitive and misleading, as a charge-off typically signifies that the creditor has written off the debt as uncollectible. 
Repossession of the Vehicle : Bridgecrest repossessed the vehicle, further indicating that the debt was no longer active. Despite this, they continue to report late payments, compounding the harm to my credit. 
Corporate Credit Write-Off : Bridgecrest likely obtained a corporate credit write-off for the charged-off loan, yet they continue to penalize me by reporting late payments, creating a scenario of triple jeopardy.

Prolonged Damage to Creditworthiness : For over three years, Bridgecrests actions have unjustly destroyed my credit score, making it nearly impossible for me to obtain new financing or rebuild my financial stability. 
These practices appear to violate principles of fairness and transparency in consumer lending and credit reporting. Additionally, they may conflict with regulations governing the proper handling of charged-off debts, repossessions, and credit reporting.

I respectfully request that the Consumer Protection Bureau investigate Bridgecrests practices and take appropriate action to ensure compliance with consumer protection laws. I also request that Bridgecrest be required to cease reporting late payments on the charged-off loan, correct my credit report, and provide restitution for the financial harm caused by their actions. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please feel free to contact me at [ your contact information ] if additional information or documentation is required.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal dispute to request the deletion of the account with National Credit Adjust ( Account Number : XXXX ) from my credit report due to several discrepancies that violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Below are the discrepancies observed across the credit bureaus : Inconsistent Account Status Reporting : XXXX reports the account as " Open '', while XXXX lists it as " Closed '', and XXXX does not report the status. This inconsistency in account status violates the FCRA, as it provides conflicting information across credit reports and could confuse creditors or affect creditworthiness. Under FCRA Section 1681e ( b ), credit bureaus must ensure accurate and consistent reporting of account statuses. The discrepancies in account status across the bureaus could be misleading and result in incorrect credit assessments. 

Discrepancies in Payment Status and Past Due Information : XXXX lists the payment status as " Late 120 Days '', while XXXX reports the account as " Collection/Charge-off ''. XXXX also reports the account under the " Collection/Charge-off '' status. The past due amounts reported by XXXX and XXXX also differ significantly, which could lead to an inaccurate picture of the accounts standing.Under FCRA Section 1681i, consumers are entitled to a report that accurately reflects their accounts. The differing descriptions of the payment status and past due balances across bureaus are inaccurate and violate this section of the FCRA. 

Inconsistent Reporting of Last Activity and Last Payment Dates : The last activity date is reported differently by the bureaus : XXXX lists it as XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX lists it as XX/XX/XXXX. This inconsistency can affect the accurate aging of the account and may impact its removal date.Under FCRA Section 1681c, negative items must be removed after seven years from the date of last activity. The conflicting activity dates could result in the account remaining on my report longer than legally allowed, violating the FCRA. 

Discrepancy in Creditor Type and Account Description : The creditor type is reported differently across the bureaus : XXXX lists it as " Factoring Companies '', while XXXX lists it as " Bulk Purchase Finance ''. This inconsistency affects the accurate representation of the account. Under FCRA Section 1681i, consumers have the right to dispute and correct inaccurate information. The inconsistent reporting of the creditor type and account description is inaccurate and must be corrected. 

Lack of Dispute Status on All Reports : XXXX reports the account as disputed, but XXXX and XXXX do not reflect this dispute, despite the account being flagged as disputed.Under FCRA Section 1681i, a credit reporting agency must note when an account is disputed. The failure to indicate the dispute status on XXXX and XXXX violates the consumers right to a complete and accurate credit report. 

Given these discrepancies, I respectfully request that this account be deleted from my credit reports. The inaccuracies across the three credit bureaus violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and the reporting of conflicting and erroneous information may be damaging my creditworthiness. 
The errors you are reporting on my account are permitting me from buying a home for my family. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing this complaint to formally address the willful and persistent violations committed by XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX regarding fraudulent accounts and unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. Despite three previous attempts to resolve these issues and over 90 days passing since my initial disputewell beyond the legally mandated 30-day period under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) these inaccuracies remain unresolved. The credit bureaus have not complied with federal and state laws requiring the removal and blocking of fraudulent accounts and inquiries. The following violations have been committed : Failure to Investigate and Resolve Disputes : FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) mandates that credit bureaus investigate and resolve disputes within 30 days. More than 90 days have elapsed since my initial dispute without resolution. Failure to Notify of Negative Information : Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, creditors are required to notify consumers within five days of reporting a debt. I was never notified of these fraudulent accounts and inquiries. Failure to Ensure Maximum Accuracy : FCRA 607 ( b ) requires credit bureaus to ensure the maximum accuracy of the information they report. Discrepancies in balances, credit limits, and reporting dates indicate noncompliance. Failure to Remove and Block Fraudulent Accounts : Under FCRA 605B, upon receipt of evidence of identity theft, credit bureaus are required to remove and block fraudulent accounts and inquiries from credit reports. Despite providing substantial evidence, this has not occurred. Failure to Protect Consumer Data : Under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6801-6809 ), financial institutions and credit bureaus are required to safeguard consumer information. The presence of these fraudulent accounts demonstrates a failure to protect my data. Identity Theft Protections Ignored : The Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ) criminalizes the unauthorized use of personal information. The fraudulent accounts and inaction by the bureaus violate my rights under this statute. State Law Violations : Under Florida Statute 817.568, identity theft is addressed as a criminal offense. The credit bureaus failure to act constitutes a violation of state protections. Fraudulent Accounts and Inquiries XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) ** : Incorrect delinquency reporting and credit limit inaccuracies and Reporting discrepancies in balances and dates, and balances exceeding credit limits. affinity plus fcu, republic bank ( Inquiry ID unavailable ) : Unauthorized inquiry recorded without my knowledge or consent. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account # XXXX ) : Fraudulent account added without consent, failed to report for three months, and I was not notified five days prior to reporting, violating 15 U.S.C. 1692g. These accounts are fraudulent and were added to my credit report without my consent. I was not notified within five days of their reporting as required by 15 U.S.C. XXXX692g. Additionally, these accounts show discrepancies and lack proper validation. Requested Resolution Under FCRA 605B, I demand the immediate removal and permanent blocking of these accounts and inquiries from my credit report. Additionally, I request : A thorough investigation into the reporting failures and evidence of identity theft. Written confirmation of the removal and blocking of these accounts and inquiries. Implementation of fraud alerts and compliance with federal and state identity theft protections. The continued presence of these fraudulent accounts on my credit report has caused significant financial harm and emotional distress. If these issues are not resolved promptly, I will pursue legal action to protect my rights and escalate this matter to other regulatory authorities.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally to file a complaint regarding charge off accounts that continue to be reported on my credit report, despite qualifying as income under IRS guidelines. The reporting of these accounts without the issuance of a 1099-C form is both misleading and a violation of my rights under federal law.

Background The accounts in question was charged off by the creditor which legally classifies the balance as canceled debt and, therefore taxable income under the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC ) 6050P. According to this provision creditors are required to issue a 1099-C form for canceled debt exceeding {$600.00} allowing the debt to report it as income to the IRS, however I have not received a 1099-C for these accounts yet the creditor continues to report the balance to the credit reporting agencies as an active charge-off.

Legal Basis for Complaint Violation of IRC6050P The Internal Revenue mandate that creditors report canceled debt exceeding {$600.00} to the IRS and provide the debtor with a 1099-C form. The failure to issue this form not only prevents me from properly reporting my taxable income but also raises concerns about the creditors adherence to federal law.

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Creditors and furnishes are obligated to report accurate information to credit reporting agencies. Reporting a charge off account as delinquent without issuing the legally required 1099-C creates an inconsistency between the IRS classification and the creditors reporting practices, constituting inaccurate reporting under the FCRA.

Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) 1036 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) : it is considered an unfair, deceptive or abusive act or practice ( UDAAP ) to report a charge off accounts as collectible or delinquent when it should be classified as income and documented through a 1099-C.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The issue is with Comenity Bank regarding a XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX purchase. 
I made a purchase back in or around XX/XX/year>. The purchases were : Magnetic Curtain Rods and a floor mat. 
Unfortunately the curtain rods did not work for me so I returned them however I kept the floor mat. 
I returned the curtain rods ( at my expense ) sometime in late XXXX or early XXXX. I called about XXXX weeks later to make sure that they were received. I was told by customer service that XXXX was in the process of installing a new technology system and that they could not access any records. I was told to call back in a few weeks. I called back XXXX or XXXX weeks later. I was informed that they were having issues with the new system that was installed and I should call back. I called back a week or XXXX later. Now I am informed that they have no record of my items being returned. In the meantime I have made XXXX or XXXX payments to more than cover the mat that I kept. 
I have been dealing with this all year. We are getting nowhere. They claim to have looked into this XXXX or XXXX times, and they conclude the same, and that is that I owe them for this merchandise. 
The original order was around {$220.00}. Now they are insisting that I owe over {$400.00} ( this included all types of late fees... etc ). 
Look I am a XXXX year old veteran. I am not trying to swindle XXXX XXXX  out of {$200.00}. I also am not in a financial position to give them money that I DO NOT owe them. 
Obviously either the XXXX XXXX lost the package or XXXX receiving dept misplaced it. Either seranio is not XXXX I feel I should be responsible for. I wish I had sent the packages registered but honestly I just could not afford it. 
I returned the merchandise and paid for the XXXX item I kept. I am sick and tired of going around in circles with them regarding this issue. 
they are destroying my already pathetic credit. 
I want them to take this off my credit in a manner that will not harm it any more. I can not be responsible for what the XXXX XXXX or their receiving dept does. 
I promise to close this account ant to NEVER utilize XXXX  ever again nor will I ever recommend them to a living or deal soul!!! 
Please help me. I am so tired of dealing with this!!!!!!!!!!! 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute fraudulent accounts on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent, and their reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( TransUnion ) XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( TransUnion ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, I have the right to block and demand removal of information resulting from identity theft. Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : I am a XXXX XXXX  law abiding citizen. I am XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX held to highest degree and regard of moral, civil, and ethical duties and dealings. I am gainfully employed and do not engage in low vibrational and distasteful acts such as what is being described below. 
Unsure of exact initial dates, but on or about XX/XX/year> I was contacted by an XXXX XXXX  fraud department representative regarding " potential fraudulent activities '' that had taken place on my fathers bank account in which I am a co op due to him developing XXXX XXXX. I was informed that there were several checks that were deposited into his primary account ( which is where he received his SSI checks every month ) and the bank cleared but returned back as " bad checks ''. This was my first time learning of these circumstances and I explained to the representative that the checks in fact had to be fraudulent because I did not recognize the names of the individuals that appeared on them. I also explained that I was only on the account because of my fathers XXXX XXXX and just in case we ever ran into problems such as him losing his card or inability to access his account, that my being on there would streamline this process of getting these issues situated, yet I've never as much passed a check through his account nor do I receive monetary gains through this account. The representative asked me to get in contact with my father because they were having no success at getting ahold of him because of phone connectivity issues. She did inform me at this time that they would proceed to close the account the first week of XXXX if there was no resolve. I would end up having the same issues with phone connectivity with my father as well and was unsuccessful at verifying things until the account was " closed '' with XXXX XXXX. Once I was able to get to my father, he did inform me that his wallet was stolen ( which because of his XXXX XXXX, he kept his PIN number to his ATM card taped to the back of his card ). 
On or around XXXX, XXXX, I was attempting to be placed on my Husbands bank account with XXXX XXXX  when I was informed by the XXXX representative who ran a consumer banking report that I would not be able to be placed on his account due to me being flagged by " XXXX '' for " fraudulent check activity ''. I immediately requested my XXXX file and received my consumer report in the mail late XX/XX/year> which did state that I was reported for " Suspected fraudulent activity '' involving an unpaid balance of {$2300.00}, owed to XXXX XXXX. After becoming aware of this, I made a trip up to XXXX XXXX  XXXX in XXXX, Kansas where I was able to speak to a management team member by the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX did provide me a copy of the bank statements showing that there had been a total of 3 checks that were apparently deposited at the ATM into my fathers account. I asked XXXX were any camera 's used to attempt to catch those responsible for the fraudulent activities to which her response was " no ''. I asked XXXX if they tried to validate who wrote out the checks because the handwriting was not mines nor my fathers, to which XXXX responded " no ''. Thirdly, I asked to see who endorsed the checks to check the signature and to my surprise, none of the three checks were ever endorsed. I asked XXXX why did the bank not take responsibility for allowing the checks to completely clear without an endorsement on the back to which her response was " we were using the " good faith '' rule to allow them to clear, as we have never had any issues with your fathers account in the past ''. XXXX refused to reverse their decision to " hold me responsible '' for their bank allowing unendorsed, fraudulent checks to clear with every indication that these checks were not legit. 
Unfortunately, I have been denied access to being added to my husbands bank account with XXXX XXXX  due to me being added to XXXX, I have been denied an auto loan with my own XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and most recently learned that the fraudulent checks have been passed to a third party who have now flogged me that much more by adding a " collections account '' to my credit report, which has lowered my score more than XXXX XXXX. Not to mention my aging father has suffered all the same. 
Please see all exhibits attached below including the checks deposited with no endorsement, my fathers one page bank statement showing the banks allowed the cashing of the fraudulent checks, and my personal XXXX XXXX file showing the suspicious activity alert and amount owed to XXXX XXXX  ( as well as the many credit pulls I had attempting to gain access to a new auto loan for which I was denied, this includes my personal credit union who I've been in excellent standing with for more than 13 years ). After all, my bank would never cash an unendorsed check, not even a legitimate one.

XXXX. Unfair and Deceptive Practices ( FTC Act, Section 5 ( a ) ) : By retaining and reporting unauthorized information, the credit bureaus are engaging in deceptive practices that harm my creditworthiness. 
XXXX. Consumer Privacy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : The agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy. Reporting incorrect names and unauthorized accounts contravenes this obligation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I discovered multiple late payment entries associated with my account that were inaccurately reported. As you are aware, Consumer Reporting Agencies bear a significant responsibility to ensure that all consumer information is reported with maximum accuracy. It is essential that the information reflected on my credit profile is both accurate and truthful. 

Specifically, I have never been late with any payments for my XXXX XXXX account ( Account # XXXX ). I respectfully request a thorough investigation into these erroneous late payment entries and demand that you provide verifiable proof, including statements, that demonstrate these payments were indeed late. To assist in this process, I can provide supporting documentation, including bank statements, payment notifications, timestamps from the XXXX payment app, and screenshots. 

Additionally, it is important to note that there have been substantial testimonies and reviews from numerous XXXX customers who have experienced similar issues regarding premature reporting of late payments. These reports indicate a pattern of errors where late payment flags are applied prematurely, negatively impacting credit scores. This further highlights the possibility of an internal issue with XXXX XXXX reporting practices, which needs immediate investigation. 

If sufficient proof can not be provided to substantiate these late payments, I demand the immediate removal of the derogatory marks and request that the account status be corrected to reflect " on time, never late, '' as this accurately represents the history of my payments. 

I have previously submitted multiple requests to the credit bureaus to address this issue, but to no avail. I am now seeking your assistance to rectify this error and ensure that my credit profile accurately reflects my payment history. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: It is crucial that consumer reporting agencies uphold their grave responsibilities when it comes to the handling of consumers personal credit files. After performing a re-investigation upon my credit file for accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX pursuant to 15 USC 1681ia1a, your company failed to follow proper procedures in regard to correspondence to me the consumer, in the handling of the reinvestigation. As clearly outlined within, 15 USC 1681i ( 7 ) ; 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy Subchapter 7 states the following ; ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a detailed description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. Further outlined within 15 USC ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) ; ( 6 ) Notice of results of reinvestigation ( A ) In general A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than XXXX business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency. ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. The correspondence mentioned above was NEVER made to me and therefore, your company is in direct violation of the FCRA and is now liable for monetary damages detailed within 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o. Not only was a proper reinvestigation not performed as the derogatory account mentioned is erroneous to begin with, your agency failed to follow the FCRAs clear rules in the handling of correspondence to me in association with the account in question. Please delete this erroneous account as I have sought legal counsel in this matter and intend on seeking damages associated with this complaint if this issue is not resolved. Thank you for your time.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt - XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX ) XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  XXXX. I am writing in response to an alleged debt. I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g. I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : XXXX. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. XXXX. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. XXXX. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. XXXX. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. XXXX. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. XXXX. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, XXXX removed this account XXXX  days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within XXXX days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within XXXX  days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( XXXX ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
FTC REPORT PERSONAL STATEMENT : I am filing this FTC Identity Theft Affidavit to report due to fraudulent accounts that show on my consumer FICO credit report which I do not recognize as reported and which result from identity theft and fraud. I demand that the previously mentioned fraudulent items be removed from each of my consumer credit reports and that all collection activity related to said items cease according to my rights within the FCRA and FDCPA laws. This is preventing me from being able to get approved for my home loan and I am in disbelief. 


CFPB PERSONAL STATEMENT : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request under FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the XXXX credit reporting agency , block and remove information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. 
This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of a few Personal credit card accounts. 
ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/2024 These accounts have resulted in fraudulent hard inquiries and collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report, leaving me with so much stress. I demand that the previously mentioned fraudulent items be removed from each of my consumer credit reports and that all collection activity related to said items cease according to my rights within the FCRA and FDCPA laws. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all previous consumer credit accounts, closed accounts, collections, and hard inquiries result from identity theft and fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX FLORIDA ) XXXX I looked at my credit report and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681i 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

On XX/XX/year>, XXXX falsely placed my mortgage into bankruptcy. On XX/XX/year>, at approximately XXXXXXXX XXXX EST, I contacted XXXX via their customer service phone line. I informed them that I had not filed for personal bankruptcy and was instructed to submit my proof to their legal department. On the same day, at XXXX XXXX I submitted the actual docket, which showed that a company I worked for two years ago had filed for bankruptcy. My name was not included in their bankruptcy filing. 

The XXXX representative provided me with the name of their attorney and advised me to speak with him. On XX/XX/year>, I spoke with XXXX XXXX, an attorney from the law firm XXXX XXXX XXXX, who was handling the case. I explained the error to him, and he requested that I send him the proof. During the call, at XXXXXXXX XXXX  EST, I sent him the docket. He assured me that he would address the issue. However, as of the date of this report, he has not corrected the problem. 

On XX/XX/year>, XXXX continued to engage in fraudulent misrepresentation and unfair or deceptive trade practices by changing the mortgage address to a different address. Despite being presented with clear evidence, they have ignored it and appear to be engaging in willful blindness.

in XXXX of XXXX  during a difficult time with lost. I went into my account online to make the payment I was very new to online payments at that time. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am concerned about the validity and accuracy of your recent investigation of these accounts that are reporting on my credit report. Last month I requested an investigation because I felt the item was not being reported legally. Couple of days ago I received a letter stating that you have ceased investigation of my credit reports because, in your opinion, you believe that I have used a third-party credit repair agency. Not only do I believe this to be a stall tactic on your part to grant you an additional 30 days to comply with my original request, but I believe it to be a blatant violation of the FCRA. 
I have attached a copy of my government issued ID as well as mail showing proof of address. So, there shouldnt be no confusion or stall tactics on your end. I have maintained a careful record of my communications with you for the purpose of filing a complaint with the FTC should you continue in your non-compliance. 
I request this under 15 U.S. Code 1692g - Validation of debts. If information is not provided or the false reporting isnt removed ; as in XXXX v. Trans Union Corp., XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX  XXXX XXXX ), you may be liable for your willful non-compliance. Credit reporting laws ensure that bureaus report only 100 % accurate credit information. Every step must be taken to assure the information reported is completely accurate and correct. The following information therefore needs to be reinvestigated. 


1.Please explain to me what your representatives uncovered to lead them to believe that you are reporting this item as it legally should be reported? 
2.What certified documents were reviewed to conclude your investigation? 
3.Please provide a complete copy of all of the information that was transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation. 
4.What did it cost your company to obtain the documents needed to complete your investigation? 
5.Please provide proof of your timely procurement of certified documents. 
6.Did you speak directly to any agent of the company that was reporting the information to confirm the accuracy of what you are reporting? 
7.If yes to above : a.Who did you speak to? 
b.On what date? 
c.How long was the conversation? 
d.What was their position? 
e.What telephone number did you call? 
f. What is the name of the employee of your company that spoke directly to the above party? 
g.What is the position of the employee of your company that spoke directly to the above party? 
h.How long has that employee been employed by your company? 
i.What formal training was provided to this employee to investigate items of this kind? 
j.Was there any email or written communication between members of your company and the above party? 
8.If so, please provide copies of all correspondence ; supply copies of any and all conclusive documentation to prove that you have in fact conducted a reasonable investigation of the account in question. 
9.Provide the date of the commencement of delinquency 10.Provide the SPECIFIC date reporting that these items will cease Enclosed with your response to the above questions I respectfully request a notarized affidavit confirming the information that is provided is true and correct as per my civil rights granted under several federal laws. This information should not come as a form letter response. 

My initial dispute was detailed and directly related to the account in question. A template response will not be an acceptable response. If you can not supply ALL of the above information in a timely manner as detailed in several laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I must immediately demand the permanent removal of this item from my credit report. 

This erroneous entry is detrimental to my overall credit rating and has caused me severe financial and emotional distress. If you choose not to provide the above requested deletion or requested/required documentation of your investigation, I will pursue the enforcements of my constitutional rights via federal court proceedings. As you are well aware this information will come out through my formal discovery process, and necessary depositions. I have recently studied constitutional consumer protection laws along with civil/federal court procedures. I will represent myself pro-se and will formally request a jury trial.

I have been disputing inaccuracies on my credit reports with the three credit bureaus since XX/XX/year> without resolution. These errors are severely impacting my ability to secure a mortgage for my family. The following accounts contain specific inaccuracies and violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and I request immediate investigation and correction : XXXX. XXXX XXXX  ( Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : This account is listed as a collection/charge-off with a past due amount of {$1000.00}. 
The last payment was made on XX/XX/year>, and the account was closed on XX/XX/year>. 
Payment history inconsistencies are noted between TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX, with TransUnion reporting " NONE REPORTED '' while XXXX and XXXX show derogatory statuses. 
Requested Action : Due to these reporting discrepancies and unresolved dispute status, I request this account be deleted from all three credit bureaus. 
2. XXXX  XXXX ( Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : This account is open and reported as current, but there are late payments reported in XXXX and XX/XX/year>. 
TransUnion and XXXX show 30- and 60-day late payments, while XXXX shows consistent reporting errors.Dispute remarks indicate prior disputes, but the errors remain unresolved. FCRA Violation : Inaccurate reporting despite previous disputes violates 611 of the FCRA. Requested Action : Update the account to reflect no late payments and accurate payment history across all bureaus. 
XXXX XXXX  ( Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : The account is reported as open, but payment history shows multiple late payments ( 30, 60, 90, 120 days ) starting in XXXX XXXX and XXXX show discrepancies in the timeline of these late payments. FCRA Violation : Reporting inconsistent and inaccurate late payments despite current account status. Requested Action : Update the account to reflect no late payments and correct reporting. 
XXXX. XXXX ( Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : This account is listed as a collection/charge-off with a balance of {$510.00}. Payment history is " NONE REPORTED '' across all three bureaus. FCRA Violation : Failure to verify and accurately report account details violates 623 of the FCRA. Requested Action : Request this account be deleted due to unverifiable information and reporting inaccuracies. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : Listed as a collection/charge-off with a balance of {$710.00}. Payment history is " NONE REPORTED '' across all bureaus. 
FCRA Violation : Inaccurate reporting of a collection account without verifiable payment history. Requested Action : Request this account be deleted due to lack of verification and inaccurate reporting. 
XXXX. XXXX ( Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : Account reported as a collection/charge-off with a balance of $ XXXXInconsistent reporting between XXXX and XXXX, with TransUnion showing no reported history. FCRA Violation : Failure to ensure maximum accuracy under 607 ( b ) of the FCRA.

sted Action : Request this account be deleted due to inaccurate and incomplete reporting. Summary of Violations Failure to Correct Inaccuracies ( 611 FCRA ).

Reporting Inaccurate Information ( 623 FCRA ).

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Failure to Delete Fraudulent Accounts from Credit Report violanting the law FCRA To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against [ Credit Bureau Name ] for their failure to remove fraudulent accounts from my credit report as required by law. 
I recently disputed several accounts on my credit report under the claim of identity theft, pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2. I submitted a Police Report and an FTC identity theft report ( FTC Report Number : XXXX ) as evidence. The credit bureau acknowledged my dispute but has not complied with the requirements set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Despite my initial request for the blocking of these fraudulent items, the following accounts remain on my credit report : XXXX XXXXXXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) - Description of Investigation : Pursuant to the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. 

15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) - Verification Requirement : Per the FCRA, you are required by federal law to verify all accounts and public information through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( s ). Without such verification, there is a risk that erroneous or fraudulent information could be included in credit reports. Given the lack of adequate verification, I request the removal of this unauthorized public record information. 

Accuracy Compliance : Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my credit report. If the information can not be verified, per 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), I request that you delete any unverifiable information. 

Failure to Investigate Accurately ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ) : After submitting a dispute regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, I did not receive a thorough investigation within the mandated 30-day timeframe. The results of the investigation did not adequately address my concerns. 

According to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, credit reporting agencies are required to block disputed information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days of receiving a valid identity theft report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) and 1681i ( 7 ), any unverifiable or inaccurate information must be removed from my credit report. 
Inadequate Compliance Procedures ( 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) ) : The bureau has not demonstrated that it has implemented reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information provided on my report. I am requesting detailed information on the procedures used during the investigation. 

I demand that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that these fraudulent accounts are deleted from my credit report. I expect a prompt resolution to this issue and would appreciate any guidance you can provide regarding my rights in this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) : I am filing this complaint against XXXX ( the creditor/furnisher ) and TransUnion ( the credit reporting agency ) regarding erratic and inconsistent reporting of my payment history for an account, which has caused significant financial and emotional harm. Despite no material changes to my account, the reported payment history has been altered multiple times in recent months, resulting in a substantial and unfair negative impact on my credit score. These changes reflect violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and a failure by both the creditor and the credit reporting agency to ensure the accuracy of the information furnished. 

Key Issues and Violations 1. Erratic and Inconsistent Payment History Updates : My payment history for the XXXX account has been updated and altered multiple times over a short period, as follows : XX/XX/XXXX : Payment history was changed, significantly altering late payment statuses for key months ( e.g., XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ). These changes reflected a positive correction to some entries. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Payment history was updated again, altering the reporting for prior months and resulting in further confusion about the accuracy of the reported data. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Payment history was altered once more, introducing new late payments for months that had previously been corrected, including 90 Days Late for XX/XX/XXXX and Payment After Charge-Off or Collection for XX/XX/XXXX. 
These repeated updates suggest gross negligence or intentional misreporting by XXXX or TransUnion. The FCRA requires both furnishers and credit reporting agencies to maintain accurate and consistent reporting under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

2. Failure to Ensure Accuracy of Information ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : XXXX, as the furnisher, has repeatedly altered my payment history for the same account without explanation or evidence of accuracy. 
TransUnion, as the credit reporting agency, has failed to verify the accuracy of the information before including it in my credit report. 
Case Law : In XXXX v. XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ), the court ruled that credit reporting agencies and furnishers must ensure that the information they report is accurate and not misleading, even if technically accurate. 

XXXX. Negligent or Willful Misreporting ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o ) : The erratic changes to my payment history and the lack of proper investigation suggest either negligence or intentional efforts to maintain negative reporting. 
These actions have directly harmed my credit score, as demonstrated by the following : A XXXXpoint decrease on XX/XX/XXXX. 
A XXXXpoint decrease on XX/XX/XXXX, despite positive updates. 
A XXXXpoint decrease on XX/XX/XXXX, following a mix of positive and negative updates. 
This pattern of reporting changes reflects willful noncompliance, entitling me to statutory and actual damages for the harm caused. 

XXXX. Failure to Notify of Disputed Status ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( f ) ) : If XXXX or TransUnion claim these updates are related to an ongoing dispute or correction process, they have failed to notify me or mark the account as disputed on my credit report. This failure violates the FCRA and deprives me of the protections provided to consumers during disputes. 

XXXX. Emotional and Financial Harm : These inaccuracies and fluctuations have caused significant emotional distress and financial harm, including : Denial of credit applications due to the sudden and unexplained drops in my credit score. 
XXXX  and frustration caused by the lack of transparency and accountability from XXXX and TransUnion.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding XXXX XXXX and their mishandling of the reporting on my account ( Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). XXXX XXXX claims that I missed a payment in XXXX of 2022, an allegation I firmly dispute, as I have maintained consistent and on-time payments throughout my relationship with them. Despite my efforts over the course of several years to dispute this inaccuracy, each investigation conducted by the credit bureaus has concluded that the reported late payment is " verified, '' yet no tangible proof has ever been provided to substantiate this claim. 

Credit reporting agencies are obligated to ensure that all reported information is accurate and substantiated. This repeated failure to provide proof of the alleged late payment is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. XXXX XXXX has not been able to supply the necessary documentation to prove that a missed payment occurred, despite my numerous requests for verification, including the original statement and payment records from that time. 

This willful non-compliance by XXXX XXXX and the subsequent failure of the credit bureaus to address the issue properly have caused significant harm to my credit profile. As a result, I have been unjustly penalized for something that is not only incorrect but unverified. Such negligence has gone on for far too long and is a clear and blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. 

The continued reporting of this erroneous late payment without adequate proof is unacceptable and warrants immediate correction. If the disputed late payment can not be verified with concrete evidence, by law, it must be removed from my credit report. Should this matter not be rectified promptly, other avenues will have to be explored.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the intervention of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) in addressing a matter of negligence and non-compliance by TransUnion. Despite my repeated disputes, supported by extensive documentation, both agencies have failed to remove fraudulent accounts and unauthorized hard inquiries from my credit reports. 
I have submitted ample evidence to TransUnion including : Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report Police Report Bank Statement Social Security Card Government-Issued Identification ( ID ) XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX proving I was XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX in XXXX during the time a fraudulent XXXX XXXX account and other accounts were opened.

Despite providing this overwhelming documentation, these credit bureaus have continued to report erroneous accounts and inquiries, causing severe harm to my creditworthiness. Specific fraudulent entries include : 1. Accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX It is clear that TransUnion has failed in their legal obligation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to ensure the accuracy of my credit report and investigate disputes promptly and thoroughly. Their negligence has resulted in ongoing financial harm, including : Credit score damage Inability to secure credit Emotional distress I demand that the CFPB take immediate action to hold TransUnion accountable for their failure to resolve this matter. Specifically, I request : 1. Removal of all fraudulent accounts and hard inquiries identified above.

2. A full investigation into the compliance failures of these credit bureaus.

3. Assistance in ensuring that both agencies prevent future inaccuracies in my credit report. 
I have attached copies of the supporting documentation submitted to TransUnion and XXXX for your reference. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this critical matter. Should you need further information or clarification, please do not hesitate to contact me directly.

Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute fraudulent accounts on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent, and their reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( TransUnion ) XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( TransUnion, XXXX ) XXXXXXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX ( TransUnion, XXXX ) XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( TransUnion, XXXX ) Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, I have the right to block and demand removal of information resulting from identity theft. Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that these accounts were created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting. 

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure these accounts are removed from my credit reports immediately. 

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address these violations promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i. 

Thank you for your urgent attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Unfair and Punitive Practices by XXXX Dear [ Consumer Protection Bureau ], I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX, the finance company for XXXX, for engaging in practices that have caused significant and ongoing harm to my credit and financial standing. These actions appear to be punitive, unfair, and potentially in violation of consumer auto loan laws. 

In XX/XX/year>, XXXX charged off my auto loan and repossessed the vehicle. Despite declaring the loan as a charge-off, they have continued to report the payments as late, which has severely defamed my credit profile and caused my credit score to plummet. This reporting has persisted for over three years, effectively destroying my ability to secure new financing. 

The following issues highlight the unfairness of XXXX actions : Improper Reporting of Late Payments Post-Charge-Off : After charging off the loan, XXXX continues to report payments as late, even though the debt was declared a charge-off. This practice is punitive and misleading, as a charge-off typically signifies that the creditor has written off the debt as uncollectible. 
Repossession of the Vehicle : XXXX  repossessed the vehicle, further indicating that the debt was no longer active. Despite this, they continue to report late payments, compounding the harm to my credit. 
Corporate Credit Write-Off : XXXX likely obtained a corporate credit write-off for the charged-off loan, yet they continue to penalize me by reporting late payments, creating a scenario of triple jeopardy. 
Prolonged Damage to Creditworthiness : For over three years, XXXX  actions have unjustly destroyed my credit score, making it nearly impossible for me to obtain new financing or rebuild my financial stability. 
These practices appear to violate principles of fairness and transparency in consumer lending and credit reporting. Additionally, they may conflict with regulations governing the proper handling of charged-off debts, repossessions, and credit reporting.

I respectfully request that the Consumer Protection Bureau investigate XXXX practices and take appropriate action to ensure compliance with consumer protection laws. I also request that XXXX be required to cease reporting late payments on the charged-off loan, correct my credit report, and provide restitution for the financial harm caused by their actions. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please feel free to contact me at [ your contact information ] if additional information or documentation is required.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX filed an identity theft report through the FTC, ( XXXX ) I also included a police report ( XXXX ) cover letter of dispute. Copy of identification, validation documentation of my legal address and a lease agreement without signatures per leesee request. 

I sent these documents through US mail to all 3 major credit bereaus, I also uploaded the documentation, police report and FTC report to all 3 bereaus. 

I've actually uploaded the supporting documentation multiple times to all of the XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and Transunion throughout the month of XXXX. 

Since uploading the original documentation plus a dispute letter outlining my rights through the resource pages on the FTC website I have uploaded additional documentation validating my residence outside of the US from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. 

The accts that were not blocked or deleted were disputed originally and again on XX/XX/XXXX when I uploaded the lease agreement to all XXXX bereaus. 

XXXX and XXXX have platforms that provide multiple ways of disputing accts on my credit report and XXXX website is set up to navigate the user through a sales funnel for the paid membership that they offer users that require frequent credit reports and scores. 
Since beginning the repair journey I've logged over XXXX online and on chat plus phone calls to agents at Transunion. 
Nothing in that entire time has provided online access to my credit report. 
They continual share the same troubleshooting data that they have in script and that I have followed multiple times to get a copy of my report. 

I recently filed a dispute about the issues with Transunions timeliness and less than attentive concern to address the inquiries and fraudulent accts that are still on my credit report. My request was to get results or answers to my original dispute and identity theft case filed early XXXX. 
XXXX has told me that the platform they use has technical issues and that they will be resolved within XXXX to 3 days of time however this is not true, I can not access my credit report through the transunion platform. 

My request is that transunion remove the hard inquiries from my credit report as they are fraudulent and numerous, I also request that they block the additional accts that I disputed with documentation on XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX with validating documentation that I included with all of my disputes. 

The complaint that I filed prevuousky through CFPB about Transunion barely touches the issues, delays and absence of action that Transunion has exampled throughout my effort to restore my good credit standing. The process has not been as stated in the Fair Credit Reporting Act and I want the hard inquiries and fraudulent accts blocked from my profile, and from potential credit opportunities. 
The response that I received after using this platform to express the problems that have been encountered do not hold this company accountable for the lack of action and the lack of progress despite following the FTC guidelines to restore my credit rating to pre identity theft condition. 
By allowing Transunion additional time after 30 days has passed is not providing me the consumer with anything that I wasn't already experiencing before addressing my issues to the CFPB. 

PLEASE make transunion address the identity theft accts on my report, remove all of the fraudulent inquiries so I can begin to build a healthy FICO score. The opportunity that having good credit provides has been stolen from me and time is of the essence. I own a company and can not provide the basics of ownership to the people that I employee. Getting funding of any amount to grow the company in order to hire more people is passing me by and the time, effort and energy that I have applied to just getting back to XXXX has been mountainous by any standard. 

My request is to not give this company any more of the most valuable commodity we have as humans, TIME. 
Please make this company do the right thing and remove the negative and fraudulent inquiries that plaque my credit profile immediately. 

Thank you so very much! 

With respect, consideration. 

Kindly XXXX XXXX

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, has violated my rights.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Demand for Debt Validation and Removal of Inaccurate InformationXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TransUnion : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally demand immediate validation of the following accounts currently being reported on my credit file. As per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 1681i, I am requesting that you provide me with detailed documentation proving the accuracy and legitimacy of these accounts. Failure to provide the requested validation will result in the immediate removal of these accounts from my credit file.

Accounts in Question : XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX ) Account ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Account ( Account Number : XXXX ) I request that you provide the following documentation for each of these accounts : 1. Proof that I owe the debt, including the original signed contract or agreement, and full transaction history.

2. The amount of the debt, including any fees, charges, or interest added to the principal balance.

3. The name and contact information of the original creditor and any party that has made attempts to collect the debt.

4. Proof that you are authorized to collect on the debt if a third-party collection agency is involved, or that the creditor still owns the debt.

5. Any communication, records, or documents that validate your claim to this debt, as well as confirmation that the debt has not been settled, paid, or discharged.

I am fully aware of my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which gives me the legal right to request full validation of any alleged debt before it is reported on my credit file. As outlined in FDCPA Section 809, if you are unable to provide the required documentation within 30 days from the receipt of this letter, you must immediately cease reporting this debt to the credit bureaus and remove it from my credit report.

Furthermore, under FCRA Section 1681i, you are obligated to investigate and ensure the accuracy of any information reported on my credit file. Failure to provide sufficient documentation or prove the accuracy of these accounts within the statutory time frame will result in the immediate removal of these items from my credit report.

Please be advised that continued reporting of these unverifiable and inaccurate accounts will be considered a violation of my rights under both the FDCPA and FCRA, and I will take further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the Attorney General 's office.

This is a formal request for debt validation, and I expect a prompt response within the legally required 30-day period. Failure to provide the requested information will result in the immediate removal of these accounts. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Formal Demand for Immediate Removal of Inaccurate InformationXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TransUnion : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally demand the immediate removal of the following accounts from my credit report. The continued reporting of these accounts is in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other relevant consumer protection laws.

Accounts in Question : XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX ) Account ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Account ( Account Number : XXXX ) The presence of these accounts on my credit report is inaccurate, outdated, and/or unverifiable. As per Section 1681i of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, you are required to investigate and ensure the accuracy of the information reported on my credit file. I have already disputed these accounts with the creditors in question, and the failure to resolve this issue in a timely manner constitutes a violation of my rights.

I am fully aware of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). If you fail to conduct a full investigation and remove these accounts within the statutory 30-day period as required by law, I will have no choice but to take further action, including but not limited to filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) , and the Office of the Attorney General in my state.

Additionally, under Section 1681e ( b ) of the FCRA, you are obligated to ensure the accuracy and integrity of all information on my credit report. These accounts do not meet that standard and should be immediately removed.

I request that you take the necessary steps to : 1. Investigate these accounts as per Section 1681i of the FCRA.

2. Remove the aforementioned accounts from my credit file within the statutory 30-day period.

3. Provide me with a written confirmation of the removal and an updated copy of my credit report showing the accurate status of my credit file.

Failure to comply with this request will result in legal action, and I will pursue any and all remedies available to me under the law.

This is a final demand for resolution, and I expect prompt action on this matter.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
