( 5 ) A computation error or similar error of an accounting nature of the creditor on a statement.

As I know the creditor didnt notify me 21 days before with a statement so there should be no late payments on these accounts. I demand to see hard solid proof from the creditor bank account that I didnt pay and was marked late because this clearly a billing error.

The items below should all be updated to paid as agreed on my consumer report. 

Account : XXXX XXXX Months and Years of Late Payments : As a consumer by law these accounts on this letter must be updated or deleted immediately or I will seek monetary compensation for violation of my rights in small claims court in my city and state under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX liability because Ive been violated. Also, we already involved and sent this letter to the Complaint portal for ( Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, State Attorney Generals Office, XXXX XXXX XXXX and Federal Trade Commission ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
There are two bankruptcies being reported on my credit file listed below : XXXX XXXX bankruptcy : REFERENCE NUMBERXXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy : REFERENCE NUMBER:XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX When I reached out to the courts I was told they do not report to the credit bureaus.

The credit bureaus also stated they do not participate in the investigation of the disputes but fail to explain who does. Who is the source because the bankruptcy court isn't reporting these records.

Rule 9037 Protecting Privacy for Filings the credit bureaus have failed to protect my privacy.

Additionally, the Bankruptcy Court does not report, furnish, and/or transmit bankruptcy Court records or other information to the credit reporting agencies.

The bankruptcy court, for cause, may protect an individual, with respect to the following types of information to the extent the court finds that disclosure of such information would create undue risk of identity theft or other unlawful injury to the individual or the individuals property.

The credit reporting agencies independently obtain Bankruptcy case information.

RULE 9037 is a law in place to protect privacy filings to the public the purpose of credit reporting is for creditors to REPORT NOT THE CREDIT BUREAUS.

The credit bureaus are violating my privacy rights also being that I am a victim of identity theft they are putting me at risk.

I did not request the bureaus to report, furnish, and/or transmit bankruptcy court records or any third party information on my credit file. These bankruptcies are not being reported or validated by the courts.

If they are not updated immediately, I will have no other option but to take legal action due to the immense stress this has caused me. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
You Violated the United States Code Law NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability. 
Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 
YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified.

Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors i see you are disregarding it so heres my breakdown.

1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves. 
2. What is a FCRA violation?

Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you.

Reporting agencies mixing up one person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes.

3. My rights under the fair credit reporting act Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes. 
Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions.

Disputeand have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable.

Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ). 
I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate and they are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied i am in distress because of your mistakes. 
The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 


Accounts Affected by the Crime FTC Report Number : XXXX First Name : XXXX Last Name : XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, OH XXXX XXXX Phone : XXXX Email : XXXX I AM A VICTIM OF IDENTITY THEFT AND XXXX XXXX BREACH. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX INQUIRIES : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Credit Card Opened by the Thief Company or Organization : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Credit Card Opened by the Thief Company or Organization : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Credit Card Opened by the Thief Company or Organization : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit Card Opened by the Thief Company or Organization XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Fraudulent Personal or Business Loan Company or Organization XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ohio XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX INQUIRIES : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information.

in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4.

business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer. 
( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report.

( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft.

( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed.

( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block.

( c ) Authority to decline or rescind.

( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error, or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions.

( 2 ) Notification to consumers. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer.

shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i.

( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title.

( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew.

or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block.

( d ) Exception for resellers.

( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller.

( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft.

( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information.

( 3 ) Notice In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting.

agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale.

( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section.

1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft.

( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am formally disputing the inaccurate and unverified entries on my credit report, which have significantly impacted my ability to obtain a mortgage to buy a home for my family. I have spent over five months attempting to resolve these discrepancies with the credit bureaus without success. Despite my numerous disputes, the credit reporting agencies have failed to verify these debts, provide documentation, or correct the errors, in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other relevant laws. 

The following accounts are under dispute due to inaccuracies, missing or unverified documentation, and failure to correct or remove erroneous information : XXXX - FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ), which requires that a consumer can request the full details and verification of any debt reported. This account has not been validated by the creditor after multiple requests, violating my right to have accurate and verifiable information reported. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX FCRA Section 1681i, which mandates that if a consumer disputes an item, the credit reporting agency must investigate the dispute within a reasonable time. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX failure to provide validation of the debt within the 30-day window violates this law. 
XXXX - FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) obligates the reporting agencies to maintain accurate and up-to-date records. The inaccurate reporting of this account continues despite my multiple attempts to request supporting documentation, leading to a violation of my right to fair and accurate credit reporting. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) requires that any information provided must be thoroughly investigated and corrected if inaccurate. XXXX has not provided any adequate verification, and the account continues to be incorrectly reported. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  - FCRA Section 1681s-2 ( b ) outlines the responsibilities of furnishers of information to ensure accurate reporting. XXXX has not met these responsibilities, leaving inaccurate information on my report without verification. 
XXXX XXXX - Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Section 1692g requires validation of debts when disputed. I have not received adequate proof of the debt 's validity, and the reporting remains inaccurate across multiple bureaus. 
XXXX XXXX ( second listing ) - The repeated inaccurate reporting of this account violates both the FCRA and the FDCPA, as the account has not been properly validated or corrected after my disputes. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXFCRA Section 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate and resolve disputes in a timely manner. XXXX XXXX failure to provide verification of the debt or correct the report after multiple disputes constitutes a violation of this law. 
The presence of these inaccuracies is preventing me from obtaining a mortgage, which has a direct and negative impact on my ability to purchase a home for my family. I have made every effort to correct the errors, but the credit bureaus have failed to act within the parameters of the law, causing ongoing financial harm. 

Despite my repeated requests for validation and documentation, I have yet to receive any proof of these debts or their accurate reporting. As a result, the credit bureaus are violating my rights under the FCRA, FDCPA, and other consumer protection laws that ensure I have access to accurate credit information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
FTC REPORT PERSONAL STATEMENT : I am filing this FTC Identity Theft Affidavit to report due to fraudulent accounts that show on my consumer FICO credit report which I do not recognize as reported and which result from identity theft and fraud. I demand that the previously mentioned fraudulent items be removed from each of my consumer credit reports and that all collection activity related to said items cease according to my rights within the FCRA and FDCPA laws. This is preventing me from being able to get approved for my home loan and I am in disbelief. 


CFPB PERSONAL STATEMENT : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request under FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the XXXX credit reporting agency , block and remove information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. 
This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of a few Personal credit card accounts. 
ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX These accounts have resulted in fraudulent hard inquiries and collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report, leaving me with so much stress. I demand that the previously mentioned fraudulent items be removed from each of my consumer credit reports and that all collection activity related to said items cease according to my rights within the FCRA and FDCPA laws. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all previous consumer credit accounts, closed accounts, collections, and hard inquiries result from identity theft and fraud.

Improper Use of My Credit Report : My credit report appears to have been accessed and shared without my consent, resulting in unauthorized inquiries and potential violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I request an investigation into these inquiries and removal of all entries made without proper authorization. 
Reporting Agencies Involved : This dispute concerns all major credit reporting agencies : XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion. 

Request for Action : Verify the accuracy of the account details and provide documented evidence supporting the current status. 
Remove any unauthorized credit inquiries or correct any improper sharing of my credit data. 
Update my credit report to reflect accurate information. 
Additional Information : Account Open Date : XX/XX/XXXX Current Balance : {$1000.00} Error Discovered : XX/XX/XXXX Please process this dispute in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). If you require additional information, do not hesitate to contact me. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to a response within the XXXXday period as stipulated by the FCRA. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, This is my final request for the immediate removal of the alleged debts associated with # XXXX from my credit report. I have no knowledge of these accounts or any relationship with XXXX XXXX XXXX or its creditors. 
I previously requested full validation of these debts, as required by law, but you have failed to provide the necessary documentation. Your response to my requestif anydoes not meet the requirements under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Specifically, you have not provided : XXXX The original signed contract. 
XXXX Proof of the debts ownership chain. 
XXXX Evidence of any fees or interest added. 
XXXX Proof that the required notices were sent before reporting these debts. 
Since you have not validated this debt, I demand the immediate removal of these accounts from my credit report. Failure to comply will result in legal action, including complaints to the CFPB, FTC, and a lawsuit for violations of the FDCPA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To : XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Request for Removal of Unverifiable Account Dear Consumer Reporting Department, I am writing to inform you that after disputing the following accounts with XXXX, the accounts were fully deleted from my XXXX credit report as of XX/XX/year>. The accounts involved in the dispute were : XXXX XXXX Delaware XXXX 's XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX As you are aware, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they report. Since XXXX has deleted these accounts from their records, the information should no longer be considered valid or reportable on my credit file with your agency. Therefore, I respectfully request that you conduct your own investigation into these accounts and delete them from my credit report as well, in accordance with the findings by XXXX. 

In accordance with FCRA Section 1681i, if the information reported by you can not be verified, it must be removed from my credit file within XXXX days of this notification. As XXXX has already determined that these accounts were unverifiable and have removed them, I trust that you will take appropriate action to ensure that my credit report is accurate and up to date. 

Please be advised that if these unverifiable accounts are not removed from my credit report within XXXX  days, I will have no choice but to consider further legal action to enforce my rights. Under FCRA Section 1681p, I have the right to seek damages for any violations, including the right to sue for failure to remove inaccurate or unverifiable information. 

I expect to receive written confirmation that the accounts in question have been removed from my credit file within the legally required XXXX period. Should the accounts not be deleted, I will pursue all legal remedies available to me, including filing a lawsuit. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please notify me of the status of your investigation and removal of these accounts from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Failure to Delete Fraudulent Accounts from Credit Report violanting the law FCRA To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against [ Credit Bureau Name ] for their failure to remove fraudulent accounts from my credit report as required by law.

I recently disputed several accounts on my credit report under the claim of identity theft, pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2. I submitted a Police Report and an FTC identity theft report ( FTC Report Number : XXXX ) as evidence. The credit bureau acknowledged my dispute but has not complied with the requirements set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Despite my initial request for the blocking of these fraudulent items, the following accounts remain on my credit report : MT XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) - Description of Investigation : Pursuant to the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. To date, I have not received this required information.

15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) - Verification Requirement : Per the FCRA, you are required by federal law to verify all accounts and public information through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( s ). Without such verification, there is a risk that erroneous or fraudulent information could be included in credit reports. Given the lack of adequate verification, I request the removal of this unauthorized public record information.

Accuracy Compliance : Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my credit report. If the information can not be verified, per 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), I request that you delete any unverifiable information.

Failure to Investigate Accurately ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ) : After submitting a dispute regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, I did not receive a thorough investigation within the mandated 30-day timeframe. The results of the investigation did not adequately address my concerns.

According to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, credit reporting agencies are required to block disputed information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days of receiving a valid identity theft report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) and 1681i ( 7 ), any unverifiable or inaccurate information must be removed from my credit report.

Inadequate Compliance Procedures ( 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) ) : The bureau has not demonstrated that it has implemented reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information provided on my report. I am requesting detailed information on the procedures used during the investigation. 

I demand that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that these fraudulent accounts are deleted from my credit report. I expect a prompt resolution to this issue and would appreciate any guidance you can provide regarding my rights in this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear [ XXXXTransUnion ], I am writing to formally dispute the inclusion of multiple inaccurate and unauthorized accounts on my credit report. Specifically : 1. An account reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) regarding a vehicle loan. 
2. An account reported by XXXX XXXX, which I have never had any dealings with. 

I have never opened an account with either XXXX XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX, nor have I had any financial transactions or agreements with these institutions. The reporting of these accounts is false, unverifiable, and a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681. 

As per the FCRA, you are required to ensure all information on my credit report is accurate and verifiable. Failure to do so constitutes a direct violation of federal law. These accounts can not be verified because they are fraudulent and do not belong to me. 

Demands : 1. Remove these accounts from my credit report immediately and ensure no further reporting from these institutions regarding these accounts.

2. Provide written confirmation of the removal of these accounts within three ( 3 ) days of receiving this letter. 
3. Cease reporting any negative or unauthorized information about me from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, or any related entities. 

Failure to act within the specified timeframe will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and pursuing legal remedies. 

I have attached a copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed accounts for your reference, along with the required proof of my identity, including a government-issued ID and utility bill. 

Please treat this correspondence as a formal and urgent dispute. I expect a resolution within the next three ( 3 ) business days to avoid further action. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Re : Account # XXXX ( Late Payment ) Dear Sir/Ma'am, I am writing you this letter regarding payments that were marked late by your company for the following accounts on the following date ( XXXX ) : ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) It is my understanding that per 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), my consumer report should not contain information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer ( me ) and the person ( you ) making the report. Payment history and the late payments associated with payment history negatively impacts my consumer report and are considered as part of my transactions and experiences between your company and me.

Furthermore, I am requesting that you provide me with, in writing, the reasonable procedures ( according to 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ) that you have adopted to ensure that each periodic statement is mailed to me ( the consumer ) not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Include also, all the information required by Section 1637 ( b ) of Title 15.

You have 30 days from the date that you receive this letter to provide me with the information that i am requesting. If you do not provide this information in the allotted time given, then it will be assumed that you can not verify the late payments on the dates specified above ( lacking reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of my account ) and I would timefore request that you remove the late payments from my account and consumer report with the following consumer reporting agencies ( XXXX, XXXX XXXX TransUnion or all that apply ) and update the accounts to positive. 
Please forward any changes to my account to the address below. Thank you for your time and consideration in this matter. I look forward to hearing back something positive. 
Regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Texas XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Cc : CFPB FTC XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX I contacted TransUnion via phone to add a identity theft/fraud alert and security freeze to my consumer credit report. After a 35 minute hold time a representative with an extremely heavy accent answered. I verified all of my information and then politely asked to speak with a US fluent English speaking representative. The representative rudely replied You will need to keep calling back until you get one. Of course I was flabbergasted and never spoken to in this manner by any representative from TransUnion in my previous contacts with them. I then advised the rep that thats not how its done and that her level of customer service in the way she speaks to people is extremely rude. The representative rudely replied well thats what were told to tell you. I then said its not what you say its how you say it and Im certain TransUnion didnt hire you to be rude. The representative at that point rudely disconnected the call by hanging up on me therefore preventing me from discussing my issue and further placing the fraud alert on my consumer report. As I sat in my bed on XXXX I began to receive credit file alerts that my credit was being ran at various car dealerships. I did not inquire about purchasing any new vehicle anywhere. There were a total of 16 new inquiries to my knowledge. These inquiries are as follows XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX These inquiries ARE NOT authorized by myself! I will also be reporting this matter to Pennsylvania Attorney General Office.

Late payments Per 15 usc 1681a 2 a ( i ), it is illegal for a consumer reporting agency to report a consumers experiences and transactions ; payment history, these " late payments '' must be removed and this account updated immediately Per 15 usc 1681a 2 a ( I ) XXXX a " consumer reporting Angency '' can not legally report consumer transactions and experiences the late payments on This account must be updated & removed from my consumer report. 15 usc 1681a 2 a ( i ) states that my transactions and experiences should not be a part of my consumer report. This account breaks the law and violates my right legally it must be updated and removed. Immediately 15 usc 1681a 2 a ( i ) 2 ) Exclusions.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( A ) subject to section 1681s3 of this title, any ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; Per 15 USC 1666 ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section XXXX ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. The following accounts have been reflecting late payments onto my consumer report, which is a violation of my consumer rights. No interaction between a creditor and a consumer maybe communicated without my written permission and I do not give the following accounts or companies any permission to report these late payments please update and remove these late payments from my consumer report..

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Failure to Delete Fraudulent Accounts from Credit Report violanting the law FCRA To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against [ Credit Bureau Name ] for their failure to remove fraudulent accounts from my credit report as required by law. 
I recently disputed several accounts on my credit report under the claim of identity theft, pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2. I submitted a Police Report and an FTC identity theft report ( FTC Report Number : XXXX ) as evidence. The credit bureau acknowledged my dispute but has not complied with the requirements set forth by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Despite my initial request for the blocking of these fraudulent items, the following accounts remain on my credit report : XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) - Description of Investigation : Pursuant to the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. 

15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) - Verification Requirement : Per the FCRA, you are required by federal law to verify all accounts and public information through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( s ). Without such verification, there is a risk that erroneous or fraudulent information could be included in credit reports. Given the lack of adequate verification, I request the removal of this unauthorized public record information. 

Accuracy Compliance : Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my credit report. If the information can not be verified, per 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), I request that you delete any unverifiable information. 

Failure to Investigate Accurately ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ) : After submitting a dispute regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, I did not receive a thorough investigation within the mandated 30-day timeframe. The results of the investigation did not adequately address my concerns. 

According to 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, credit reporting agencies are required to block disputed information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days of receiving a valid identity theft report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) and 1681i ( 7 ), any unverifiable or inaccurate information must be removed from my credit report. 
Inadequate Compliance Procedures ( 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) ) : The bureau has not demonstrated that it has implemented reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information provided on my report. I am requesting detailed information on the procedures used during the investigation. 

I demand that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that these fraudulent accounts are deleted from my credit report. I expect a prompt resolution to this issue and would appreciate any guidance you can provide regarding my rights in this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, This is a formal escalation of my ongoing complaint regarding violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by both Equifax Information Services LLC and XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite prior attempts to resolve these issues, both parties have failed to take corrective action, leading to persistent inaccuracies in my credit report. I request the CFPBs immediate intervention to enforce compliance and address these systemic failures.

Key Violations and Issues 1. Equifaxs Failure to Ensure Accuracy ( 1681e ( b ) ) : The FCRA requires credit reporting agencies to ensure the accuracy of information in consumer reports : FCRA 1681e ( b ) : Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
Equifax has failed to meet this standard, as shown by the following inaccuracies in my XXXX XXXX XXXX account : XX/XX/XXXX : Reported alternately as 90 Days Late and Current. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Inconsistently marked as 120 Days Late and Charged Off. 
XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX : Contradictory late statuses such as 30 Days Late, 60 Days Late, and 120 Days Late. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to Furnish Accurate Data ( XXXX ) : As a furnisher of information, XXXX XXXX XXXX is obligated to provide accurate data and investigate disputes : FCRA 1681s-2 ( a ) : A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

FCRA 1681s-2 ( b ) : After receiving notice pursuant to section 611 ( a ) ( 2 ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] of a dispute with regard to the completeness or accuracy of any information provided by a person to a consumer reporting agency, the person shall conduct an investigation with respect to the disputed information. 
XXXX has failed to meet these obligations by furnishing incorrect information and neglecting to verify or correct these inaccuracies after disputes.

3. Failure to Reinvestigate and Correct Errors ( 1681i ) : Both Equifax and XXXX have failed to conduct proper investigations of disputes : FCRA 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer, and the consumer notifies the agency the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate. 
Neither Equifax nor XXXX has adequately reinvestigated my disputes or ensured the permanent correction of errors. 
4. Permissible Purpose ( 1681b ) : The FCRA limits the purposes for which consumer information may be used : FCRA 1681b ( a ) : A consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer ( 3 ) To a person which it has reason to believe intends to use the information in connection with a credit transaction.

The ongoing reporting of erroneous data suggests a misuse of permissible purposes, as the information is inaccurate and harmful rather than reflecting legitimate credit behavior. 
5. Harm Caused by Inaccuracies : The inaccuracies in my credit report have caused significant harm, including : Credit score fluctuations : XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX decrease. 
XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX decrease. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Slight recovery after partial corrections, though unresolved issues persist. 
Financial harm, including higher borrowing costs and denied credit opportunities. 
Emotional distress caused by prolonged uncertainty about my financial standing. 

Legal Precedents Supporting My Claims XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ) : Established that inaccurate credit reporting causing tangible harm, such as financial loss or emotional distress, constitutes actionable FCRA violations. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Confirmed that CRAs must conduct independent and reasonable investigations into disputes and can not blindly rely on furnishers data. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Affirmed that furnishers like XXXX XXXX XXXX must conduct a reasonable investigation and correct errors when notified of disputes.

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it XXXX concern : I am a XXXX XXXX  law abiding citizen. I am XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX held to highest degree and regard of moral, civil, and ethical duties and dealings. I am gainfully employed and do not engage in low vibrational and distasteful acts such as what is being described below. 
Unsure of exact initial dates, but on or about XX/XX/year> I was contacted by an Arvest bank fraud department representative regarding " potential fraudulent activities '' that had taken place on my fathers bank account in which I am a co op due to him developing XXXX XXXX. I was informed that there were several checks that were deposited into his primary account ( which is where he received his SSI checks every month ) and the bank cleared but returned back as " bad checks ''. This was my first time learning of these circumstances and I explained to the representative that the checks in fact had to be fraudulent because I did not recognize the names of the individuals that appeared on them. I also explained that I was only on the account because of my fathers failing cognition and just in case we ever ran into problems such as him losing his card or inability to access his account, that my being on there would streamline this process of getting these issues situated, yet I've never as much passed a check through his account nor do I receive monetary gains through this account. The representative asked me to get in contact with my father because they were having no success at getting ahold of him because of phone connectivity issues. She did inform me at this time that they would proceed to close the account the first week of XXXX if there was no resolve. I would end up having the same issues with phone connectivity with my father as well and was unsuccessful at verifying things until the account was " closed '' with Arvest Bank. Once I was able to get to my father, he did inform me that his wallet was stolen ( which because of his XXXX XXXX he kept his PIN number to his ATM card taped to the back of his card ). 
On or around XXXX, XXXX, I was attempting to be placed on my Husbands bank account with XXXX XXXX  when I was informed by the XXXX representative who ran a consumer banking report that I would not be able to be placed on his account due to me being flagged by " XXXX '' for " fraudulent check activity ''. I immediately requested my XXXX file and received my consumer report in the mail late XX/XX/year> which did state that I was reported for " Suspected fraudulent activity '' involving an unpaid balance of {$2300.00}, owed to XXXX XXXX. After becoming aware of this, I made a trip up to XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, Kansas where I was able to speak to a management team member by the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX did provide me a copy of the bank statements showing that there had been a total of 3 checks that were apparently deposited at the ATM into my fathers account. I asked XXXX were any camera 's used to attempt to catch those responsible for the fraudulent activities to which her response was " no ''. I asked XXXX if they tried to validate who wrote out the checks because the handwriting was not mines nor my fathers, to which XXXX responded " no ''. Thirdly, I asked to see who endorsed the checks to check the signature and to my surprise, none of the three checks were ever endorsed. I asked XXXX why did the bank not take responsibility for allowing the checks to completely clear without an endorsement on the back to which her response was " we were using the " good faith '' rule to allow them to clear, as we have never had any issues with your fathers account in the past ''. XXXX refused to reverse their decision to " hold me responsible '' for their bank allowing unendorsed, fraudulent checks to clear with every indication that these checks were not legit. 
Unfortunately, I have been denied access to being added to my husbands bank account with XXXX XXXX  due to me being added to XXXX, I have been denied an auto loan with my own XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and most recently learned that the fraudulent checks have been passed to a third party who have now flogged me that much more by adding a " collections account '' to my credit report, which has lowered my score more than XXXX XXXX. Not to mention my aging father has suffered all the same. 
Please see all exhibits attached below including the checks deposited with no endorsement, my fathers one page bank statement showing the banks allowed the cashing of the fraudulent checks, and my personal XXXX XXXX file showing the suspicious activity alert and amount owed to XXXX XXXX ( as well as the many credit pulls I had attempting to gain access to a new auto loan for which I was denied, this includes my personal credit union who I've been in excellent standing with for more than 13 years ). After all, my bank would never cash an unendorsed check, not even a legitimate one.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to you regarding a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights, protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) ). Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I have identified the following accounts that have breached these legal provisions : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts have accessed my credit information without my explicit authorization, which constitutes a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights. Additionally, some of these accounts contain obsolete information that should be excluded from my credit report as stipulated in 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ). 

According to 15 USC 1681, Section 602 ( A ), I have the right to privacy. Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681, Section 604 ( A ), Section 2, a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. Also, 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include any adverse item of information that is more than XXXX years old, other than records of convictions of crimes. 

Finally, under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), no person shall furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Additionally, according to 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), a person shall not furnish information if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( XXXX ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. 

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX TransUnion LLC Consumer Dispute Center XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  RE : Fraudulent Accounts and Inquiries Immediate Action Required ( XXXX : XXXX ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to demand the immediate and permanent deletion of fraudulent accounts and inquiries that have been unlawfully reported on my consumer file as a result of identity theft. This information must be removed without delay and must never be reinserted into my file under any circumstances. Any failure to comply with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) will not be tolerated. 

Legal Framework Violated : 1. 15 USC 1681b ( c ) Furnishing Reports Without Consumer Authorization As per the statute, consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from furnishing records of inquiries connected to credit or insurance transactions that I, the consumer, did not initiate. The following inquiries must be permanently removed from my report without delay. 
XXXX. 18 U.S.C. 1028A Aggravated Identity Theft I am a victim of identity theft. Under this law, any fraudulent use of my identity is a federal crime punishable by an additional term of XXXX years imprisonment for the offenders. Your negligence in verifying this information perpetuates the criminal activity and further damages my financial standing. 
XXXX. 15 USC 1681c2 Block of Fraudulent Information Pursuant to this law, you are required to block all fraudulent information related to identity theft within XXXX business days of receiving a valid identity theft report. Additionally, you are legally barred from reinserting this information unless thorough and verifiable documentation is provided and I am notified in writing, as required by the FCRA. 

Fraudulent Accounts : XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX Balance : {$2300.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX Balance : {$1400.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : **** Balance : {$6300.00} XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX Balance : {$2000.00} These accounts were not authorized by me and must be removed from my report immediately. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information dispute by a consumer, an team of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, base on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( 1 ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. U.S Code 1681a-Definitions ; rules of construction, ( 1 ) In General-The terms consumer report Means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; ( B ) employment purposes ; or ( C ) any other purpose authorized under section 1681b of this title Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting for Account # XXXX Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment reporting on my credit report for the above-referenced account. After reviewing my credit report, I identified a 30-day late payment erroneously reported for XX/XX/XXXX on my XXXX XXXX account. This late payment is inaccurate, as I have always made timely payments on this account. 
Account Details Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$32000.00} Last Verified : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Last Activity : XX/XX/XXXX Date Reported : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$0.00} Closed Date : XX/XX/XXXX Account Rating : Closed Account Description : Joint account Dispute Status : Account not disputed Creditor Type : Finance, personal Account Status : Closed Payment Status : 30 days past due Payment Amount : {$0.00} Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX Term Length : 75 months Past Due Amount : {$0.00} Account Type : Installment account Payment Frequency : Monthly Credit Limit : {$0.00} Discrepancies in Payment History According to the TransUnion-reported payment history, a 30-day late payment is listed for XX/XX/XXXX. This late payment is inaccurate, as my payment records indicate that all payments were made on time. 

Reference to Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are obligated to ensure the information they report is accurate and verifiable. Specifically : 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) : My consumer report should not contain inaccurate or unverifiable information related to transactions or experiences between me and the creditor.

15 USC 1666 ( b ) : Creditors must adopt reasonable procedures to ensure timely mailing of statements and accurate reporting of payments.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) : All periodic statements must contain complete and accurate information about payment due dates and amounts.

Requested Action I kindly request that TransUnion : Conduct a thorough investigation into the accuracy of the reported late payment.

Provide a detailed description of the investigation process per 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ). 
Update the payment status for XX/XX/XXXX to reflect " Paid As Agreed, Never Late. '' If you are unable to provide verifiable proof of the late payment, correct the reporting immediately to align with my accurate payment history. 
Supporting Evidence I have attached the following documents to support my dispute : A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry. 
Personal identification documents for verification purposes. 

Response Timeline Under the FCRA, you are required to complete your investigation and provide a written response within 30 days from the receipt of this dispute. If you can not verify the accuracy of the reported late payment, I expect it to be corrected promptly. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your resolution and response within the time frame required by law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I write to address multiple discrepancies on my credit report and to bring to your attention the various violations made by your organization in accordance with United States Code Laws.

1. Personal Information Challenge : I challenge the following personal information : As per 15 U.S Code 1681 a ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy, I regard my hard inquiry and account information as private. Your reporting of accounts that are not mine is a breach of my privacy rights.

2. FDCPA 807 - Misleading False Reporting : The information you have reported wrongly suggests to future creditors that I initiated all these inquiries and accounts. In reality, these were actions of a scammer. This misrepresentation on your part violates the FCRA laws for fairness.

3. 15 USC 1681n Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : You've accepted and reported credit information about me without proper verification, making you potentially liable for up to {$1000.00} per violation.

4. 18 U.S. Code 1028A - Aggravated Identity Theft : Sharing my information without my prior consent makes you criminally liable for aggravated identity theft, punishable for up to 2 years.

5. 15 U.S. Code 6802 ( b ) 1 ( ) ( a ) ( A ) ( B ) ( C ) Obligations for Personal Information Disclosure : Your failure to disclose my right to opt out of information sharing is deceptive. My consumer rights have been violated due to your omission.

6. FDCPA 8012 - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : You reported inquiries and accounts without proper validation, contravening the GAAP requirements.

7. Reporting Discrepancies : Your reporting indicates I owe a debt without displaying any negative balance. This is misleading.

8. 15 U.S. Code 1692f Unfair Practices : Your conduct suggests several violations, including unauthorized collection of amounts and the use of misleading symbols on mailed communication.

9. 15 U.S. Code 1602 - Definitions and Rules of Construction : The information you provided relating to me is inaccurate, violating 15 USC 1681s-2.

10. Claims of Harassment and Abuse : Per FDCPA 806, I feel harassed and abused due to the continuous reporting of inaccurate items and unwarranted communications from creditors.

11. Identity Theft and Unauthorized Sharing : My information was illegally shared and used without my genuine consent, resulting in a case of identity theft as defined by Section 1581a ( 3 ).

12. Reporting Inaccuracies : Your reporting of late payments without clear definitions in TILA, FCRA, and FDCPA is deceptive and violates FCRA laws.

13. 15 U.S. Code 1692j Furnishing Certain Deceptive Forms : Any contract signed without my participation in the debt collection violates 15 USC 1692j.

14. Requests Pertaining to Debts : I am the original creditor, and only I can validate any debts. The debts reported by you are unvalidated and must be removed.

15. 15 U.S. Code 1681b Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports : You have acted without my written consent, which equates to identity theft. 

I, XXXX XXXX did not consent to, authorize, or benefit from any of the reported inquiries or accounts. These are inaccurate, and I demand their removal. I've attached an FTC report # XXXX confirming identity theft incidents in my name. You are required by 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 to complete this reinvestigation and block or update all information resulting from identity theft within 4 days of receiving this letter.

THAT IS AGAINST THE LAW. You will be criminally and civilly liable for all the fees listed in my invoice attached. Please remove all fraudulent accounts as I have no knowledge of any of these accounts due to the XXXX XXXX XXXX data breach/identity theft. All is being investigated by the FTC and CFPB. According to FCRA 605B, this information must be blocked immediately until the investigation is over.

Also, 15 USC 1681n defines Civil liability for willful noncompliance : in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. I will accept payment in the form of a check. Please compensate me within 24 hours of receiving this dispute letter.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681g, I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of the request concerning the accounts that you are reporting on my credit report.

****IMPORTANT **** PLEASE don't respond to my request by saying that these accounts have been verified by the information provider. SEND ME COPIES OF THE DOCUMENTS THAT YOU HAVE RETAINED IN YOUR FILES THAT YOUR COMPANY USED TO VERIFY THE ACCURACY OF THESE DISPUTED ACCOUNTS. I demand that the following account be verified or removed immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Reason : According to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the agent is in breach of 15 U.S.C. 1692e, which prevents the dissemination of false or misleading information, and 15 U.S.C. 1692j, which bars the provision of deceptive forms. Furthermore, as stipulated by 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I should have received a written notification regarding this issue at least five days prior, but this was not done. Being the only original creditor, I hold the sole right to authenticate this debt. Therefore, I HEREBY DECLARE THAT I DO NOT RECOGNIZE THIS DEBT.

Dispute Instruction : According to the provisions of 15 USC 1692g, 15 USC 1681b, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have not granted any permission for your agency to list this public record on my credit report. For all accounts mentioned above, I require verification and validation of every detail including notations, dates, and balances, irrespective of their reported status. I also request evidence of your verification method, and the specific details that correspond with mine. Absent precise matches, the account must be removed immediately in accordance with the FCRA. Pertaining to 15 USC 1605, 15 USC 1666b, 15 USC 1681a, and 15 USC 1681i ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), any reported late payments on this account must be promptly removed. This account has always been current, and proof should be available demonstrating that any statements were mailed to me at least 21 days prior to any due payment. As per FCRA Sections 605, 609, and 623, I request this evidence. Additionally, as this is listed as a collection account, the collecting party must authenticate the survivability of this debt, their ownership of the debt, their collection rights, and that all their details align with the original creditor. Without such proof, the entry must be deleted. Finally, as outlined in 15 USC 1681b related to the permissible purposes of consumer reports : it is expressly articulated that a consumer reporting agency may provide a report in line with the written instructions of the associated consumer. The record of this account is erroneous ; I have never defaulted on my payments.

Kindly update the status to reflect accurate, timely payments.

I know that as the consumer, I HOLD ALL THE POWER. As a ( MO ) 281 SW715, 719, I presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact, exists. As a consumer XXXX XXXX and the one with ALL THE POWER, these inaccurate accounts on this letter must be deleted immediately AS IN ASAP, or I will seek monetary damages in small claims court in my city and state. Since I attached my form of ID, PROOF OF ADDRESS, & SOCIAL SECURITY CARD, this complaint lists someone that your company should recognize as their customer or their customers authorized representative.

This reporting may also violate the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), as it misrepresents my payment obligations.

Account Information Account Type : Auto Lease Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$21000.00} Date Reported : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Status : Open and Current Monthly Payment : {$580.00} Payment History : Incorrectly shows a XXXX late payment in XX/XX/XXXX. 
Requested Resolution I request that TransUnion conduct a thorough investigation and remove the inaccurate late payment from XX/XX/XXXX. I also request confirmation of the corrected information in writing within 30 days of receiving this dispute. 
Attached, you will find supporting documentation demonstrating timely payments, including bank statements and autopay confirmations. 
Thank you for addressing this matter promptly. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX XXXX After I received correspondence from your agency, it stated that the accounts I disputed were verified by your agency. Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) 1 ( a ), I am demanding that your agency perform a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the status of the disputed information. 
Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) please complete this inaccurate account or delete it from my consumer reports.

The Law Cleary States : ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller. 

I DO NOT consent to any E-OSCAR verification as this method is not reliable or lawful, according to the standards set for by the FCRA. 

I am requesting that you validate the following items non-electronically, by performing a reasonable and FAIR re-investigation : Please provide the following details of the methods by which you verified these accounts : a. Identity and position of the representative contacted? 
b. Date, duration, and substance of the conversation?

c. Contact details utilized?

d. Identity, position, and tenure of your company 's employees involved?

e. Details of formal training imparted to said employee?

f. Copies of all written correspondence?

Your agency also seems to be in violation of non-compliance and negligent non-compliance with being in direct violation or the following laws : 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court.

( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

These are now multiple attempts to handle this matter privately. If these accounts keep getting verified by a faulty e-Oscar system when I know these accounts are erroneous and destroying my credit worthiness, I will in fact sue your agency for the maximum monetary damages that the FCRA allows.

Your agency has less than 30 days to respond with a fair reasonable re-investigation or I will have no choice but to seek legal action. This investigation must be validated by the information that I have listed above. If the information is not validated, then it must be deleted immediately from my consumer report!

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting for Account # XXXX Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment reporting on my credit report for the above-referenced account. After reviewing my credit report, I identified a 30-day late payment erroneously reported for XX/XX/XXXX on my XXXX XXXX XXXXccount. This late payment is inaccurate, as I have always made timely payments on this account. 
Account Details Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$32000.00} Last Verified : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Last Activity : XX/XX/XXXX Date Reported : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$0.00} Closed Date : XX/XX/XXXX Account Rating : Closed Account Description : Joint account Dispute Status : Account not disputed Creditor Type : Finance, personal Account Status : Closed Payment Status : 30 days past due Payment Amount : {$0.00} Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX Term Length : 75 months Past Due Amount : {$0.00} Account Type : Installment account Payment Frequency : Monthly Credit Limit : {$0.00} Discrepancies in Payment History According to the TransUnion-reported payment history, a 30-day late payment is listed for XX/XX/XXXX. This late payment is inaccurate, as my payment records indicate that all payments were made on time. 

Reference to Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are obligated to ensure the information they report is accurate and verifiable. Specifically : 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) : My consumer report should not contain inaccurate or unverifiable information related to transactions or experiences between me and the creditor.

15 USC 1666 ( b ) : Creditors must adopt reasonable procedures to ensure timely mailing of statements and accurate reporting of payments.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) : All periodic statements must contain complete and accurate information about payment due dates and amounts. 
Requested Action I kindly request that TransUnion : Conduct a thorough investigation into the accuracy of the reported late payment.

Provide a detailed description of the investigation process per 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( XXXX ). 
Update the payment status for XX/XX/XXXX to reflect " Paid As Agreed, Never Late. '' If you are unable to provide verifiable proof of the late payment, correct the reporting immediately to align with my accurate payment history. 
Supporting Evidence I have attached the following documents to support my dispute : A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry. 
Personal identification documents for verification purposes. 

Response Timeline Under the FCRA, you are required to complete your investigation and provide a written response within 30 days from the receipt of this dispute. If you can not verify the accuracy of the reported late payment, I expect it to be corrected promptly. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your resolution and response within the time frame required by law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: RE : XXXX XXXX XXXX It is crucial that consumer reporting agencies uphold their grave responsibilities when it comes to the handling of consumers personal credit files. After performing a re-investigation upon my credit file for accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX pursuant to 15 USC 1681ia1a, your company failed to follow proper procedures in regard to correspondence to me the consumer, in the handling of the reinvestigation. As clearly outlined within, 15 USC 1681i ( 7 ) ; 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy Subchapter 7 states the following ; ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a detailed description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. Further outlined within 15 USC ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) ; ( 6 ) Notice of results of reinvestigation ( A ) In general A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than 5 business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency. ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. The correspondence mentioned above was NEVER made to me and therefore, your company is in direct violation of the FCRA and is now liable for monetary damages detailed within 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o. Not only was a proper reinvestigation not performed as the derogatory account mentioned is erroneous to begin with, your agency failed to follow the FCRAs clear rules in the handling of correspondence to me in association with the account in question. Please delete this erroneous account as I have sought legal counsel in this matter and intend on seeking damages associated with this complaint if this issue is not resolved. Thank you for your time.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX SS # : XXXX TransUnion LLC Consumer Dispute Center XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Dispute Authorization and Multiple Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act I, XXXX XXXX, hereby authorize this dispute. It is important to note that this dispute was not sent by an unauthorized third party or \ '' XXXX XXXX '' I am writing to address the ongoing violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have yet to be resolved, despite my previous dispute letters. The violations are as follows : FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You continue to report fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, thereby infringing upon my privacy rights. As I have reiterated multiple times, I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. It is imperative that you cease sharing my hard inquiries and account information on my credit report.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : Despite my previous disputes, you persist in reporting false information that suggests I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts. These actions were the result of a scammer\ 's actions, and your continued unverified reporting is a direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and its fairness requirements.

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Your failure to verify the accuracy of the credit information you have accepted demonstrates willful noncompliance. I remind you that such noncompliance is subject to civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation.

FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : Continuing to share my personal information with numerous creditors without obtaining my consent is a criminal act of aggravated identity theft. I reiterate that this offense carries a penalty of up to 2 years of imprisonment.

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You have yet to fulfill your obligation to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission is deceptive and a direct violation of my consumer rights.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : Despite my previous dispute efforts, you persist in furnishing inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, potentially violating Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ).

Reporting such deceptive information is unacceptable.

In addition to the aforementioned violations, I remind you of the previous violations outlined in my earlier dispute letters, including the violation of Debt Collection Practices Act, Identity Theft Laws, Acquiring Location Information Regulations, Timely Payments Regulations, Finance Charge Determination, and Credit Report Permissible Purposes. These violations require your immediate attention and resolution.

I want to inform you that I have retained the services of a consumer rights attorney to assist me in addressing these violations. I have also lodged complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and the Attorney General\ 's Office regarding your noncompliance with the FCRA XXXX I am actively pursuing all available avenues to ensure my rights are protected. 
Once again, I demand that you take immediate action to address these violations and fulfill the following requests : XXXX XXXX - XXXX - Under 15 USC 1666b, this late payment entry is a violation. I have been incorrectly billed. - Please update the status of this account to " paid on time. '' XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX inquiry. - DELETE!!! 

XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX inquiry. - DELETE!!! 

XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX inquiry. - DELETE!!! 

XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX inquiry. - DELETE!!! 

XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX inquiry. - DELETE!!! 

XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX inquiry. - DELETE!!! 


Remove all fraudulent and inaccurate accounts from my credit report. 
Block any information resulting from identity theft, as required by the FCRA. 
I can not stress enough the urgency of this matter. Your persistent noncompliance with my requests and failure to rectify these violations leave me with no choice but to pursue the legal remedies available under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

I expect a prompt response outlining a definitive plan of action from you. Your cooperation in rectifying these issues is imperative and greatly appreciated. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
