XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX SS # : XXXX TransUnion XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Dispute Authorization and Multiple Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act I, XXXX XXXX, hereby authorize this XXXX XXXX It is important to note that this dispute was not sent by an unauthorized third party or \ '' XXXX XXXX '' I am writing to address several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have occurred, which require your immediate attention and resolution. The violations are as follows : FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( XXXX ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are reporting fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, thus infringing upon my privacy rights. I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( XXXX ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you are reporting falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer\ 's actions. Such false reporting misleads future creditors. By reporting these unverified items, you violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and fail to comply with its fairness requirements. 

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : You accepted credit information about me without verifying its accuracy firsthand. This willful noncompliance is punishable by civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation. 
FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : You shared my personal information with numerous creditors without obtaining my consent, making you criminally liable for aggravated identity theft, which carries a penalty of up to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( XXXX ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You failed to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission was deceptive and a violation of my consumer rights. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( XXXX ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : You furnished inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, potentially violating Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such inaccurate information is deceptive. 

Violation of Debt Collection Practices Act : You engaged in unfair practices and harassment by reporting inaccurate debts and accounts without my consent, causing me distress and unnecessary contact from creditors. 

Violation of Identity Theft Laws : Creditors obtained my information without my true consent and used it to obtain credit from other financial institutions, constituting identity theft. 
Violation of Acquiring Location Information Regulations : Debt collectors contacted third-party credit reporting agencies with my information, stating that I owed a \ '' XXXX '' This is a clear violation of regulations that prohibit disclosing debt information to third parties. 

Violation of Timely Payments Regulations : You reported \ '' late payments\ '' on my credit report without defining what constitutes a late payment, which is deceptive and inaccurate. 
Violation of XXXX XXXX Determination : You failed to accurately determine finance charges, which is your responsibility as a credit reporting agency. 
Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes : You reported information on my credit report without obtaining my written consent, which is a violation of the permissible purposes outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

I, XXXX XXXX, demand that you take immediate action to address these violations. I request the following actions : XXXX XXXX XXXX - Under 15 USC 1666b , this late payment entry is a violation. I have been incorrectly billed. - Please update the status of this account to " paid on time. '' XXXX - XXXX - Under 15 USC 1666b , this late payment entry is a violation. - Please update the status of this account to " paid on time. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - This account needs to be validated. - Remove on my report immediately! 



Remove all fraudulent and inaccurate accounts from my credit report. 
XXXX any information resulting from identity theft, as required by FCRA. 
I expect a prompt response and resolution to this matter. Failure to comply will leave me with no choice but to pursue legal remedies available under the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Consumer complaint narrative: My accounts was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with XXXX XXXX and all payments were placed on XXXX. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule XXXX and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Consumer complaint narrative:
am writing to express my concern regarding a potential violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) related to the reinsertion of previously deleted information in my credit report. Section 611 ( B ) of the FCRA clearly outlines the procedures and requirements for reinserting any deleted information. 

Background On [ XX/XX/year> ], the following information was removed from my credit report : Creditor 's Name : [ XXXX ] Account Number : XXXX Date of Deletion : [ XX/XX/year> ] Recently, upon reviewing my updated credit report, I noticed that the previously deleted information has been reinserted without prior notification or proper justification. 

Specific Violations According to Section 611 ( B ) of the FCRA, any reinsertion of deleted information must be accompanied by : 1. Written notification to the consumer within five business days of the reinsertion.

2. Certification from the information providerindicating that the information is complete and accurate.

In my case, I did not receive any notification or corresponding certification, which constitutes a direct violation of the FCRA.

Request for Immediate Action I kindly request that you : 1. Immediately remove the reinserted information from my credit report.

2. Provide a detailed explanation of how and why the information was reinserted without following the stipulated procedures.

3. Take necessary measures to prevent future improper reinsertions.

IN THE attached below I show the proof of the day that this account was deleted Contact Information Please contact me at your earliest convenience to confirm receipt of this letter and provide an update on the steps being taken to resolve this matter. 
Name : [ XXXX XXXX XXXX ] Address : [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX fl XXXX ] Email : [ XXXX ] Thank you in advance for your prompt attention to this critical matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: To whom it may concern : I am contesting any information on my credit report that is not true or documented. This includes any claims that have not been proven to be correct. I am doing this in accordance with the FCRA and the accepted STANDARD of metro 2 data field reporting.I can not recognize or accept the allegation of delinquency and derogatoriness without factual document proof. I challenge the reportability of these allegations because it is unsubstantiated. According to federal and state law, you must report any allegation accurately and completely.It is wrong to report any claims that you know or should know are against the law or regulations. I'm writing to inform you that you need to make sure all your claims are factual and reported correctly. This is required by the Metro 2 reporting standard. I request that you provide physical verifiable evidence to support the existence of the account and evidence that the account was used for a permissible purpose. I am giving you 30 days to investigate this issue and determine whether it is still being reported accurately and in compliance with the law. Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting for Account # XXXX Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment reporting on my credit report for the above-referenced account. After reviewing my credit report, I identified a 30-day late payment erroneously reported for XX/XX/XXXX on my ALLY FINCL account. This late payment is inaccurate, as I have always made timely payments on this account. 
Account Details Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$32000.00} Last Verified : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Last Activity : XX/XX/XXXX Date Reported : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$0.00} Closed Date : XX/XX/XXXX Account Rating : Closed Account Description : Joint account Dispute Status : Account not disputed Creditor Type : Finance, personal Account Status : Closed Payment Status : 30 days past due Payment Amount : {$0.00} Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX Term Length : 75 months Past Due Amount : {$0.00} Account Type : Installment account Payment Frequency : Monthly Credit Limit : {$0.00} Discrepancies in Payment History According to the TransUnion-reported payment history, a 30-day late payment is listed for XX/XX/XXXX. This late payment is inaccurate, as my payment records indicate that all payments were made on time. 

Reference to Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies are obligated to ensure the information they report is accurate and verifiable. Specifically : 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) : My consumer report should not contain inaccurate or unverifiable information related to transactions or experiences between me and the creditor.

15 USC 1666 ( b ) : Creditors must adopt reasonable procedures to ensure timely mailing of statements and accurate reporting of payments.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) : All periodic statements must contain complete and accurate information about payment due dates and amounts.

Requested Action I kindly request that TransUnion : Conduct a thorough investigation into the accuracy of the reported late payment.

Provide a detailed description of the investigation process per 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ).

Update the payment status for July 2019 to reflect " Paid As Agreed, Never Late. '' If you are unable to provide verifiable proof of the late payment, correct the reporting immediately to align with my accurate payment history.

Supporting Evidence I have attached the following documents to support my dispute : A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry.

Personal identification documents for verification purposes.

Response Timeline Under the FCRA, you are required to complete your investigation and provide a written response within 30 days from the receipt of this dispute. If you can not verify the accuracy of the reported late payment, I expect it to be corrected promptly.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your resolution and response within the time frame required by law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency generates a consumer report, it must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information related to the individual to whom the report pertains.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, following a reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any disputed information by a consumer, an item is determined to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable, the consumer reporting agency must ( i ) promptly delete the disputed item from the consumer 's file, or appropriately modify the information based on the reinvestigation results; and ( ii ) promptly inform the furnisher of the information that the item has been modified or deleted from the consumer 's file.

Consumer complaint narrative: To whom it may concern : According to the FCRA Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( l ) and the accepted STANDARD of metro 2 data field reporting, I have the right to dispute any information on my credit report that I believe is not correct.I can not recognize or accept the allegation of delinquency without factual proof. According to federal and state law, you must report any allegations with the greatest compliance and accuracy possible.You should not report any claims that you know or should know are not in compliance with regulations and the law. I am writing to inform you that you need to make sure all your claims are factual and certified before reporting them. This is required by the Metro 2 reporting standard. I request that you provide evidence to support the existence of the account and evidence that the account was used for a permissible purpose. I am giving you 30 days to investigate the matter and determine whether it is still being reported accurately and in compliance with regulations. If it is not, I want it removed from the report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, This is my second formal dispute regarding inaccurate and fraudulent information on my credit report resulting from identity theft. Despite my previous effortsincluding submitting an FTC Identity Theft Report, a police report, and placing fraud alertsthe disputed accounts remain on my report. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to have any unverifiable or inaccurate information removed. The accounts in question, listed below, were fraudulently opened and do not belong to me : XXXX  XXXX  - XX/XX/XXXX {$440.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX {$88.00} DEPT OF ED / XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX {$1000.00} DEPT OF ED / XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX {$1800.00} DEPT OF ED / XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX {$2200.00} DEPT OF ED / XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX {$3700.00} I have already contacted the credit reporting agencies and the collection agencies involved, but the issue remains unresolved. I am requesting your assistance to ensure these accounts are properly investigated and removed from my credit report if they can not be verified. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is in regard to complaint XXXX. I am submitting this as a follow-up to my previous complaint filed on XX/XX/XXXX, which was closed on XX/XX/XXXX with a response from Sallie Mae . I respectfully disagree with the response they provided.

Their response states : " Our records reflect that we reviewed and addressed substantially identical concerns via the CFPB. Please reference CFPB case numbers XXXX and XXXX for our previous responses. As your most recent complaint provides no new or additional information, our position remains unchanged, and we consider this matter to be closed. If you need further assistance, please call our Customer Service Contact Center at XXXX. '' While they acknowledge addressing my concerns in previous complaints, they claim that my most recent complaint provides no new or additional information. I believe this statement overlooks critical updates I provided. Specifically, in my most recent complaint, I included the following information : " Since XX/XX/XXXX, I have been actively working with XXXX representatives to pursue assistance. My XXXX  doctor initially assured me that my condition would qualify me for XXXX. I have since submitted all requested documentation, and most recently met with a XXXX  as directed by the XXXX office. While this XXXX  confirmed that my diagnoses align with XXXX requirements, he informed me that, due to my age, it would likely be challenging to secure approvala policy that I believe is discriminatory. My age should not hinder access to XXXX support when my health conditions, including XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ), have rendered me unable to work. '' This is new and relevant information that Sallie Mae was not aware of during the previous complaints. For context, I did not receive my diagnoses of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX until XX/XX/XXXX, a month after I filed my second complaint. Furthermore, I was not even aware of my appointment with the XXXX  when I filed my second complaint on XX/XX/XXXX. Thus, I find it concerning that Sallie Mae dismissed this most recent complaint as containing no new information. This response indicates that my complaint was not given the appropriate consideration, especially regarding the addition of these important details. 

For reference, the previous complaint timelines are as follows : XXXX filed on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX filed on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX ( most recent ) filed on XX/XX/XXXX Timeline of relevant medical events : XX/XX/XXXX : First appointment with a XXXX  in XXXX, AR XX/XX/XXXX : Underwent additional testing for XXXX  XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX : Received diagnoses of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX board request, confirming that my conditions qualify for XXXX but that my age could pose a challenge to approval Given this timeline, I am perplexed by Sallie Maes assertion that no new information was provided. The diagnoses and the XXXX  evaluation were not available at the time of the prior complaints, and I had not yet shared that I was in contact with the XXXX board and had met with a XXXX. 

I have been trying to resolve this loan issue since XX/XX/XXXX. I took out the loan based on misleading information provided by the course instructor of the " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  '' program, XXXX XXXX. She led me to believe that the course could be completed within XXXX months, without informing me that it required XXXX  XXXX  and was a two-year program. This was not feasible for me due to my cognitive limitations caused by XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). Had I known the true nature of the course, I would not have taken out the loan. 

Sallie Mae has stated they are willing to assist. During an earlier conversation with a representative, I was encouraged to fill out their total XXXX form, with the understanding that my case would likely be resolved favorably. However, despite submitting the form twice with the required documentation, no meaningful resolution has been reached. Sallie Mae is fully aware of my financial and medical situationsince XX/XX/XXXX ( when I was fired from my last job ), I have been unable to work due to my health and have no source of income, aside from the limited financial assistance I receive from my retired parents ( {$500.00} every XXXX months ). 

It is increasingly difficult to rely on my parents, as they are already stretched thin with their own retirement and social security. It is not fair to expect them to contribute further to my loan repayment when the money they provide is intended solely for basic living expenses. 

Despite my efforts for years to find work-from-home opportunities, I believed I had finally found a viable option in the Court Reporting and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. However, the course was misrepresented, and I soon realized it was not a feasible path for me due to its demands. Since then, I have continued my search for suitable work-from-home positions, but I have not had any success. 

I have absolutely no way to pay off this loan. I am unable to apply for repayment programs, and I have no support from friends or family to help with the payments. Despite my best efforts to resolve this situation, Sallie Mae seems uninterested in addressing my needs or offering the assistance I require. This lack of concern for my position only adds to the difficulty of my situation, as I continue to face overwhelming financial and health challenges. 

I respectfully ask that Sallie Mae revisit this issue with a greater level of attention to the new information I have provided, and that they reconsider their position given the serious medical, financial, and personal challenges I am currently facing. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

I purchased a smoker from Lowe 's online Sunday XXXX for {$200.00}. On Monday morning XXXX at XXXX I checked to see when it would be delivered. The delivery address and phone number had changed from when I placed the order, and was now a four year old address and a phone number that was no longer in service. I am sure I did not provide that old address and phone number when I placed the order. ( Which also did not match my current information on the Lowe 's credit card used ) I immediately called the local Lowe 's in XXXX XXXX, FL and was told to call the Lowe 's Corporate office. I called the Corporate Office and they told me to call XXXX  XXXX. I called XXXX  XXXX and they told me there was nothing they could do. 
I did not receive the smoker and have filed multiple disputes with the credit card. 
I believe that Lowe 's antiquated computer system somehow changed the delivery address and phone number to a very old one. 
I have no way of knowing if the smoker was actually delivered, but I know it wasn't delivered to me. I do not feel I should pay for an item I did not receive.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Nationstar/Mr. Cooper was my new mortgage lender transferred from XXXX during an active home modification process. They change the offer terms of the loan by nearly 75 % and falsified our house hold income thereby limiting more desirable loss mitigation program options. We wanted to keep our home. 

While on the phone with Nationstar research department, the operator XXXX, told me the loan was paid {$160000.00} and current balance XXXX. I've made multiple request to get the closing/settlement documents via online, fax and via phone. To my dismay they refuse to release any documents. 

Now they are double dipping. Suing me for a $ XXXX deficit. The appraised value of the house was mid- {$100000.00} and XXXX transfer document show time of transfer at {$150000.00}. This is outrageous! 

I seek relief and justice through CFPB and its affiliates from Nationstar/Mr. Cooper 's harmful tactics, falsified court confirmed served summons, and everything adversity they has caused to me and my family financially and lost of homestead.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative: About XXXX XXXX my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  was stolen and was used for over {$8000.00}. Few days later the automatic service from double cash called me informing me that they see suspicious purchases. The same day I called customer service and reported that the purchases weren't mine and that they should close the card and send me another one.The representative didn't close it. Weeks later I noticed a lot of purchases on my statement. Again, I called back double cash credit card to inform them that the purchases weren't mine. I also called XXXX and reported the stolen items on my credit card statement. The thief was arrested and charged for credit card fraud. He plead guilty. Over and over a again, I reported that to the credit card company. I constantly call them about my case, and they told me that my case is under investigation. That is whenever I do get someone. Sometimes they transfered me to all these different numbers, and no one answered. Sometime I would be on the phone for avery a long time holding on, but no one answered, or the machine cut me off. Now they messed up my credit by sending me to collection. About XXXX or XXXX I spoke with a customer service from the credit card company. I told customer service that the auto pay is taking money from my checking account, even though, my card is on dispute. The representative took off the auto pay for me. Now they put my credit card into collection and mess up my credit. Furthermore, all the money that the auto pay took from my account for over a year should be refund back to me. It is over a year now, and up to this date my credit card account has not been resolve. As a matter of fact, I have not used XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, since early XX/XX/year> because of the fraud on my account. Please look into this matter for me. Thanks.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I AM WRITING THIS PRE-ARBITRATION DEMAND IN CONTINUATION OF MY PREVIOUS NOTICE OF DISPUTE REGARDING THE INACCURATE INFORMATION ON MY CREDIT REPORT ACCOUNT ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) WHICH IS REPORRING AS A PAID CHARGEOFF BUT NEVER WENT INTO CHARGEOFF STATUS BEFORE BEING PAID IN FULL XXXXDESPITE MY INITIAL COMMUNICATION AND YOUR ACKNOWLEDGMENT OF THE DISPUTE, THE DISPUTED ITEMS HAVE NOT BEEN ADEQUATELY RESOLVED. THEREFORE, I AM COMPELLED TO ESCALATE THE MATTER AND REQUEST A RESOLUTION THROUGH ARBITRATION, AS PROVIDED FOR IN EQUIFAX 'S ARBITRATION AGREEMENT. 
I AM AWARE THAT UNDER EQUIFAX ARBITRATION AGREEMENT, EQUIFAX IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PAYING HALF OF THE ARBITRATION FEE. HOWEVER, CONSIDERING THE SUBSTANTIAL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE ARBITRATION PROCESS, I AM PROVIDING XXXX WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO AVOID THESE EXPENSES ALTOGETHER. 
IN ADDITION TO THE REQUEST FOR A COMPREHENSIVE INVESTIGATION AND RESOLUTION OF THE DISPUTED ITEMS, I PROPOSE THE FOLLOWING SETTLEMENT OFFER : 1. PAY ME THE FULL ARBITRATION INITIATION FEE : THE INITIATION FEE FOR ARBITRATION ( FOR THE CORPORATION ), AS OUTLINED BY THE XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) GUIDELINES, TYPICALLY EXCEEDS {$3000.00}. TO SETTLE THIS MATTER EXPEDITIOUSLY AND AVOID THE SIGNIFICANT COSTS AND TIME INVOLVED IN FORMAL ARBITRATION PROCEEDINGS, I REQUEST THAT EQUIFAX PAY ME THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE ARBITRATION INITIATION FEE. 
I BELIEVE THAT THIS SETTLEMENT OFFER REFLECTS A FAIR AND REASONABLE RESOLUTION, TAKING INTO ACCOUNT THE COSTS EQUIFAX WOULD OTHERWISE INCUR DURING THE ARBITRATION PROCESS. ACCEPTING THIS OFFER WOULD SPARE BOTH PARTIES THE FINANCIAL BURDEN AND EXTENSIVE TIME COMMITMENT ASSOCIATED WITH FORMAL ARBITRATION. 
FURTHERMORE, IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT SHOULD XXXX DECLINE THIS SETTLEMENT OFFER, I WILL PURSUE THE ARBITRATION PROCESS AS PROVIDED FOR IN EQUIFAXARBITRATION AGREEMENT. IN THAT EVENT, I WILL SEEK APPROPRIATE REMEDIES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO COMPENSATORY DAMAGES FOR FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, EMOTIONAL DISTRESS, AND ANY OTHER DAMAGES RESULTING FROM THE INACCURACIES ON MY CREDIT REPORT. 
I KINDLY REQUEST THAT YOU PROVIDE A WRITTEN RESPONSE WITHIN 15 DAYS OF RECEIVING THIS PRE-ARBITRATION DEMAND AND MONETARY SETTLEMENT OFFER. YOUR RESPONSE SHOULD INCLUDE YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THE SETTLEMENT OFFER, ALONG WITH THE ACTIONS TAKEN TO INVESTIGATE AND RESOLVE THE DISPUTED ITEMS. FAILURE TO RESPOND OR DECLINE THIS OFFER WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIMEFRAME WILL INDICATE YOUR UNWILLINGNESS TO RESOLVE THE MATTER AMICABLY, AND I WILL PROCEED ACCORDINGLY. 
PLEASE ACKNOWLEDGE RECEIPT OF THIS LETTER WITHIN 10 DAYS. 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR ATTENTION TO THIS MATTER. I HOPE THAT WE CAN REACH A FAIR AND MUTUALLY AGREEABLE RESOLUTION WITHOUT RESORTING TO FORMAL ARBITRATION OR FURTHER LEGAL ACTION. YOUR PROMPT RESPONSE AND WILLINGNESS TO RESOLVE THIS MATTER IN A TIMELY MANNER WILL BE GREATLY APPRECIATED.

Also, other violations such as : 15 USC 1681 Section 602 A, The Frank-Dodd Act, 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), 15 USC 1681c ( A ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), 15 USC 6802, The FACT Act section 623 ( a ) ( 7 ). Also, violation of due process, trespass & defamation of character. 
Emotional distress and discriminatory denial of credit causing irreparable harm and hardship. 
They denied my request. 
I invoiced them for {$10000.00} for their violations and causing injury to me. My request was ignored.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, has violated my rights.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

IN ADDITION TO THE REQUEST FOR A COMPREHENSIVE INVESTIGATION AND RESOLUTION OF THE DISPUTED ITEMS, I PROPOSE THE FOLLOWING SETTLEMENT OFFER : 1. PAY ME THE FULL ARBITRATION INITIATION FEE : THE INITIATION FEE FOR ARBITRATION ( FOR THE CORPORATION ), AS OUTLINED BY THE AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION ( AAA ) GUIDELINES, TYPICALLY EXCEEDS {$3000.00}. TO SETTLE THIS MATTER EXPEDITIOUSLY AND AVOID THE SIGNIFICANT COSTS AND TIME INVOLVED IN FORMAL ARBITRATION PROCEEDINGS, I REQUEST THAT EQUIFAX PAY ME THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE ARBITRATION INITIATION FEE. 
I BELIEVE THAT THIS SETTLEMENT OFFER REFLECTS A FAIR AND REASONABLE RESOLUTION, TAKING INTO ACCOUNT THE COSTS EQUIFAX WOULD OTHERWISE INCUR DURING THE ARBITRATION PROCESS. ACCEPTING THIS OFFER WOULD SPARE BOTH PARTIES THE FINANCIAL BURDEN AND EXTENSIVE TIME COMMITMENT ASSOCIATED WITH FORMAL ARBITRATION. 
FURTHERMORE, IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT SHOULD XXXX DECLINE THIS SETTLEMENT OFFER, I WILL PURSUE THE ARBITRATION PROCESS AS PROVIDED FOR IN EQUIFAXARBITRATION AGREEMENT. IN THAT EVENT, I WILL SEEK APPROPRIATE REMEDIES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO COMPENSATORY DAMAGES FOR FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, EMOTIONAL DISTRESS, AND ANY OTHER DAMAGES RESULTING FROM THE INACCURACIES ON MY CREDIT REPORT. 
I KINDLY REQUEST THAT YOU PROVIDE A WRITTEN RESPONSE WITHIN 15 DAYS OF RECEIVING THIS PRE-ARBITRATION DEMAND AND MONETARY SETTLEMENT OFFER. YOUR RESPONSE SHOULD INCLUDE YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THE SETTLEMENT OFFER, ALONG WITH THE ACTIONS TAKEN TO INVESTIGATE AND RESOLVE THE DISPUTED ITEMS. FAILURE TO RESPOND OR DECLINE THIS OFFER WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIMEFRAME WILL INDICATE YOUR UNWILLINGNESS TO RESOLVE THE MATTER AMICABLY, AND I WILL PROCEED ACCORDINGLY. 
PLEASE ACKNOWLEDGE RECEIPT OF THIS LETTER WITHIN 10 DAYS. 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR ATTENTION TO THIS MATTER. I HOPE THAT WE CAN REACH A FAIR AND MUTUALLY AGREEABLE RESOLUTION WITHOUT RESORTING TO FORMAL ARBITRATION OR FURTHER LEGAL ACTION. YOUR PROMPT RESPONSE AND WILLINGNESS TO RESOLVE THIS MATTER IN A TIMELY MANNER WILL BE GREATLY APPRECIATED.

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: RE : XXXX XXXX XXXX It is crucial that consumer reporting agencies uphold their grave responsibilities when it comes to the handling of consumers personal credit files. After performing a re-investigation upon my credit file for accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX pursuant to 15 USC 1681ia1a, your company failed to follow proper procedures in regard to correspondence to me the consumer, in the handling of the reinvestigation. As clearly outlined within, 15 USC 1681i ( 7 ) ; 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy Subchapter 7 states the following ; ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a detailed description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. Further outlined within 15 USC ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) ; ( 6 ) Notice of results of reinvestigation ( A ) In general A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than XXXX business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency. ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. The correspondence mentioned above was NEVER made to me and therefore, your company is in direct violation of the FCRA and is now liable for monetary damages detailed within 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o. Not only was a proper reinvestigation not performed as the derogatory account mentioned is erroneous to begin with, your agency failed to follow the FCRAs clear rules in the handling of correspondence to me in association with the account in question. Please delete this erroneous account as I have sought legal counsel in this matter and intend on seeking damages associated with this complaint if this issue is not resolved. Thank you for your time.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative: What happened : Consumer Name : ( XXXX XXXX ), Consumer Social Security Number : ( XXXX ), Consumer Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX ), Contents of Complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the Equifax credit reporting agency , block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of a personal car loan account opened at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( XXXX ). Credit accounts such as XX/XX/XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( XXXX ). These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding XXXX XXXX and their mishandling of the reporting on my account ( Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). XXXX XXXX claims that I missed a payment in XXXX of 2022, an allegation I firmly dispute, as I have maintained consistent and on-time payments throughout my relationship with them. Despite my efforts over the course of several years to dispute this inaccuracy, each investigation conducted by the credit bureaus has concluded that the reported late payment is " verified, '' yet no tangible proof has ever been provided to substantiate this claim. 

Credit reporting agencies are obligated to ensure that all reported information is accurate and substantiated. This repeated failure to provide proof of the alleged late payment is a violation of my rights under the FCRA. XXXX XXXX has not been able to supply the necessary documentation to prove that a missed payment occurred, despite my numerous requests for verification, including the original statement and payment records from that time. 

This willful non-compliance by XXXX XXXX and the subsequent failure of the credit bureaus to address the issue properly have caused significant harm to my credit profile. As a result, I have been unjustly penalized for something that is not only incorrect but unverified. Such negligence has gone on for far too long and is a clear and blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. 

The continued reporting of this erroneous late payment without adequate proof is unacceptable and warrants immediate correction. If the disputed late payment can not be verified with concrete evidence, by law, it must be removed from my credit report. Should this matter not be rectified promptly, other avenues will have to be explored.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am formally disputing the inaccurate and unverified entries on my credit report, which have significantly impacted my ability to obtain a mortgage to buy a home for my family. I have spent over five months attempting to resolve these discrepancies with the credit bureaus without success. Despite my numerous disputes, the credit reporting agencies have failed to verify these debts, provide documentation, or correct the errors, in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other relevant laws. 

The following accounts are under dispute due to inaccuracies, missing or unverified documentation, and failure to correct or remove erroneous information : XXXX - FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ), which requires that a consumer can request the full details and verification of any debt reported. This account has not been validated by the creditor after multiple requests, violating my right to have accurate and verifiable information reported. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX FCRA Section 1681i, which mandates that if a consumer disputes an item, the credit reporting agency must investigate the dispute within a reasonable time. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  failure to provide validation of the debt within the 30-day window violates this law. 
XXXX - FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) obligates the reporting agencies to maintain accurate and up-to-date records. The inaccurate reporting of this account continues despite my multiple attempts to request supporting documentation, leading to a violation of my right to fair and accurate credit reporting. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) - FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) requires that any information provided must be thoroughly investigated and corrected if inaccurate. XXXX has not provided any adequate verification, and the account continues to be incorrectly reported. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX FCRA Section 1681s-2 ( b ) outlines the responsibilities of furnishers of information to ensure accurate reporting. XXXX has not met these responsibilities, leaving inaccurate information on my report without verification. 
XXXX XXXX - Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Section 1692g requires validation of debts when disputed. I have not received adequate proof of the debt 's validity, and the reporting remains inaccurate across multiple bureaus. 
XXXX XXXX ( second listing ) - The repeated inaccurate reporting of this account violates both the FCRA and the FDCPA, as the account has not been properly validated or corrected after my disputes. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX -FCRA Section 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies must investigate and resolve disputes in a timely manner. XXXX XXXX failure to provide verification of the debt or correct the report after multiple disputes constitutes a violation of this law. 
The presence of these inaccuracies is preventing me from obtaining a mortgage, which has a direct and negative impact on my ability to purchase a home for my family. I have made every effort to correct the errors, but the credit bureaus have failed to act within the parameters of the law, causing ongoing financial harm. 

Despite my repeated requests for validation and documentation, I have yet to receive any proof of these debts or their accurate reporting. As a result, the credit bureaus are violating my rights under the FCRA, FDCPA, and other consumer protection laws that ensure I have access to accurate credit information.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( XXXX ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. 

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX I was charged a total of {$10000.00} by a company that I had taken classes from about 9 months prior. This amount was an amount that I have not received a receipt for nor authorized for. This amount was an unauthorized charge on my Apple Card. I created a dispute with Goldman and Sachs Co for this since I never approached that amount and didnt make the payment. 

The first time I created the dispute I provided them the past payments I made to the company showing them that the receipts I had were matching the prior payments. However, the recent payments totaling to {$10000.00} was never something I authorized and didnt have a receipt for. Yet my dispute was denied and the merchant was found in the right. 

I disputed again and asked them how can they find the merchant in the right, they dont even have a receipt for this transaction, it is fraudulent. They said that there was no response from the merchant so they sided with the merchant even though I provided them again a proof of trying to reach out to the merchant and asking them why I was charged those amounts and responding to the bank. They never responses to the bank and the bank still sided with them. 

I did a third dispute and it was still denied and I called them again asking why it keeps getting denied and that I literally have no idea how I can prove them that I didnt authorize something and that they keep siding with the merchant even though they dont even get any response from them. 

I asked them to dispute again, for the forth time, and asked them to request from the fraud department for a reason why the disputes are being denied. What proof do they have from the merchant to deny my dispute because I am so sure they had no contact from the merchant. And of course I never received anything upon this request. In fact, this time around, they closed my account with no good explanation. The dispute is still open and I have no idea if it will be in my favor or not. 

Every time I asked the representative for a contact to reach out to their fraud department and every time I was told that the fraud department has no internal number to reach out to that even they can not get in touch with them. Not to mention that the last representative I talked to was super rude, how would the fraud department not have a contact number internally in the company??

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
ACCOUNTS : XXXX  XXXX XXXX After I received correspondence from your agency, it stated that the accounts I disputed were verified by your agency. Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) 1 ( a ), I am demanding that your agency perform a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the status of the disputed information.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) please complete this inaccurate account or delete it from my consumer reports.

The Law Cleary States : ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

I DO NOT consent to any E-OSCAR verification as this method is not reliable or lawful, according to the standards set for by the FCRA.

I am requesting that you validate the following items non-electronically, by performing a reasonable and FAIR re-investigation : Please provide the following details of the methods by which you verified these accounts : a. Identity and position of the representative contacted?

b. Date, duration, and substance of the conversation?

c. Contact details utilized?

d. Identity, position, and tenure of your company 's employees involved?

e. Details of formal training imparted to said employee?

f. Copies of all written correspondence?

( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

These inquiries were made without my explicit consent or permissible purpose under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, and their presence on my report is a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX conducted an unauthorized inquiry. Additionally, on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX via XXXX  made inquiries that I did not authorize. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, an inquiry was made by XXXX XXXX XXXX, which was done without my knowledge or approval. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, multiple inquiries were performed without my consent, including by XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX. Similarly, on XX/XX/XXXX, unauthorized inquiries were conducted by XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX via XXXX. 

Additional unauthorized inquiries include those by XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, as well as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, all on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Lastly, on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX via XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX conducted inquiries without permissible purpose. 

These inquiries are negatively impacting my creditworthiness and were performed in direct violation of federal law. I respectfully request that these inquiries be removed immediately to ensure compliance with my rights as a consumer. 



I am submitting this formal complaint regarding the unauthorized and inaccurate information being reported on my consumer credit report by XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX. Specifically, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number XXXX ) is unlawfully reporting an account that I did not authorize or consent to, and no debt validation has been provided. 

Additionally, I must highlight that only my legal name, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, should be reported. Any variations, inaccuracies, or unauthorized aliases are a misrepresentation of my identity and must be removed immediately. 

Violations of Federal Law 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Under FCRA Section 605B, unauthorized accounts must be blocked within XXXX business days of receiving appropriate documentation. I have submitted my FTC Identity Theft Report, government-issued identification, proof of address, and SSN, which legally suffice. 
XXXX. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX  has failed to validate the alleged debt. Continuing to report an unverified debt violates federal law and my rights as a consumer. 
XXXX. Unfair and Deceptive Practices ( FTC Act, Section 5 ( a ) ) : By retaining and reporting unauthorized information, the credit bureaus are engaging in deceptive practices that harm my creditworthiness. 
XXXX. Consumer Privacy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : The agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy. Reporting incorrect names and unauthorized accounts contravenes this obligation. 

My Demands XXXX. Immediate Removal : The account with XXXX XXXX XXXX and any unauthorized aliases or addresses must be removed from my report within XXXX ( XXXX ) business days. 
XXXX. Correction of Personal Information : Only my legal name, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and my correct address, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX, should be reported. 
XXXX. Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation that the unauthorized account and incorrect information have been removed and will not appear again. 

Consequences of Noncompliance Failure to act promptly will result in escalation, including filing further complaints with regulatory authorities and pursuing all legal remedies. This includes : Statutory damages of {$1000.00} per violation under FCRA. 
Punitive damages for willful violations of federal law. 
Liability under 18 U.S.C. 894 for extortionate collection practices if applicable. 

Thank you for addressing this matter promptly. I expect full compliance within the stated timeframe.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
You Violated the United States Code Law NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability.

Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 
YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified.

Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors i see you are disregarding it so heres my breakdown.

1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves.

2. What is a FCRA violation?

Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you.

Reporting agencies mixing up one person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes.

3. My rights under the fair credit reporting act Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes.

Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions.

Disputeand have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable.

Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ).

I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate and they are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied i am in distress because of your mistakes. 
The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 


Accounts Affected by the Crime FTC Report Number : XXXX First Name : XXXX Last Name : XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, OH XXXX XXXX Phone : XXXX Email : XXXX I AM A VICTIM OF IDENTITY THEFT AND EQUIFAX DATA BREACH. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX INQUIRIES : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Credit Card Opened by the Thief Company or Organization : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Credit Card Opened by the Thief Company or Organization : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Credit Card Opened by the Thief Company or Organization : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit Card Opened by the Thief Company or Organization XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Fraudulent Personal or Business Loan Company or XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ohio XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX INQUIRIES : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information.

in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4.

business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer.

( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report.

( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft.

( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed.

( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block.

( c ) Authority to decline or rescind.

( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error, or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions.

( 2 ) Notification to consumers. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer.

shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i.

( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title.

( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew.

or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block.

( d ) Exception for resellers.

( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller.

( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft.

( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information.

( 3 ) Notice In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting.

agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale.

( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section.

1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft.

( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter.

( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX RE : Fraudulent Accounts and Inquiries Immediate Action Required ( XXXX : XXXX ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to demand the immediate and permanent deletion of fraudulent accounts and inquiries that have been unlawfully reported on my consumer file as a result of identity theft. This information must be removed without delay and must never be reinserted into my file under any circumstances. Any failure to comply with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) will not be tolerated. 

Legal Framework Violated : 1. 15 USC 1681b ( c ) Furnishing Reports Without Consumer Authorization As per the statute, consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from furnishing records of inquiries connected to credit or insurance transactions that I, the consumer, did not initiate. The following inquiries must be permanently removed from my report without delay. 
XXXX. 18 U.S.C. 1028A Aggravated Identity Theft I am a victim of identity theft. Under this law, any fraudulent use of my identity is a federal crime punishable by an additional term of XXXX years imprisonment for the offenders. Your negligence in verifying this information perpetuates the criminal activity and further damages my financial standing. 
XXXX. 15 USC 1681c2 Block of Fraudulent Information Pursuant to this law, you are required to block all fraudulent information related to identity theft within XXXX business days of receiving a valid identity theft report. Additionally, you are legally barred from reinserting this information unless thorough and verifiable documentation is provided and I am notified in writing, as required by the FCRA. 

Fraudulent Accounts : XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX Balance : {$2300.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX Balance : {$1400.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : **** Balance : {$6300.00} XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX Balance : {$2000.00} These accounts were not authorized by me and must be removed from my report immediately. Furthermore, I demand confirmation in writing that this information has been deleted and will not be reinserted into my credit file in the future. 

Failure to Act : If these fraudulent accounts and inquiries are not permanently deleted and an updated consumer report is not sent to me promptly, as mandated under 15 USC 1681c-1 ( XXXX ), I will escalate this matter to the following entities : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB ) Federal Trade Commission XXXX FTC ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX State Attorney General Offices, both in your jurisdiction and mine Non-compliance will lead to formal legal action, including seeking damages for the harm caused by your continued violation of my rights. 

Enclosures : Copy of my government-issued ID Proof of address ( vehicle registration ) Copy of my Social Security XXXX FTC Identity Theft Report I expect immediate and decisive action. I also remind you of your obligations under the FCRA to ensure that once fraudulent information is deleted, it is not reinserted without following the strict legal guidelines for doing so. Failure to comply will result in further legal action and formal complaints to federal and state agencies. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello. My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Here I want to provide an explanation about the things happened as I open up a new case against Robinhood.

I recently opened a new account at Robinhood ( https : //robinhood.com/ ) because I was considering starting investment for the first time. I transferred the fund from my 2 bank accounts, but soon encountered with a serious problem. Let me explain what happened in chronological order. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated transfer of {$3000.00} from my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  of XXXX XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated transfer of {$1.00} from my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  of XXXX XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated transfer of {$46000.00} from my XXXX savings account ending XXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated transfer of additional {$2000.00} from my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  of XXXX XXXX. ( This one is still pending as of XX/XX/XXXX, even though XXXX  XXXX is saying it already went through on their end ) As of XX/XX/XXXX, total of {$49000.00} of fund was transferred to my Robinhood account from my two bank accounts. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, transfer process of the first three ( XXXX + XXXX + XXXX ) was completed and the money came into my Robinhood account. Upon confirmation, I initiated transfer of this fund back to my bank accounts, but Robinhood system did not let this request go through despite of several attempts. The reason why I initiated transfer of fund back to my bank accounts was because while waiting for the completion of the transfer to Robinhood, which is between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, I changed my mind and decided to not go ahead with investment at Robinhood. I did try to cancel transfer process but it did not let me, so I had to wait until XX/XX/XXXX. 

When the transfer process was completed on XX/XX/XXXX, Robinhood system clearly stated that the money was now in my cash account in Robinhood and is ready to be used for investment and also that the transfer back to the bank account was possible. Subsequently I tried to transfer the balance back to my bank accounts from which I originally transferred the fund, but it continuously showed an error message saying that the request was denied because the money has to be transferred to the original bank account from which the fund was deposited and that it was not possible to transfer the fund to another bank.

This message did not make sense at all because all of the bank statements that were listed on my Robinhood account to which I tried to transfer the money back were exactly the same bank accounts I deposited the money from in the first place on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX. I was very shocked looking at this happening, so I went to the Robinhood support chat ( which is the only means to communicate with Robinhood as the phone number they had did not reach to any real support despite of several call attempts ( XXXX ) ) to ask about what is the reason for repeated denial of transfer. The chat responded to try transferring to other account instead of XXXX savings account, which was the XXXX  XXXX account. I tried that, and when this also did not work, I tried with lesser amount, as well as with exact amount such as {$46000.00} back to the XXXX  account from which it originally came, but none of these attempts was successful.

A little bit after several failed attempts to place
transfer of money request, Robinhood suddenly placed a restriction on my account. When I clicked on the restriction detail on Robinhood website, it showed steps to take, including present XX/XX/XXXX bank statement of XXXX. I downloaded the statement from XXXX XXXX  site to upload the statement Robinhood was requesting, but there was nowhere I could upload, neither a link was there. All I could do was to continue the page by clicking the continue button ( I do not quite remember what was it actually called, but this was the only thing I could do ). After clicking the button, it showed the following message : " Your accounts are restricted until we finish our review.

Your account security is imperative to us, and as a precaution, you won't be able to open new positions or transfer funds on any of your Robinhood accounts while restricted. '' At this point I have no access to my money and all I got is the above message. Robinhood did not let me transfer my money back to my bank accounts, and it is now blocking me from accessing to my money for no appropriate reason and no explanation whatsoever, which is the same as freezing my fund by illegal means. I feel like this is even a criminal act Robinhood allegedly did against a powerless customer like me. I do not owe anything to Robinhood, nor I invested or made any purchases on their platform. All I did was to transfer money from my bank accounts to my account on Robinhood, and then tried to transfer that money back to my bank accounts.

I tried to reach out to Robinhood on XX/XX/XXXX all day using every possible means including sending chat messages and placing phone call request, but no response came so far. 
As of XX/XX/XXXX, Robinhood suddenly decided to close my account for no reason as it is now saying the following message : " Were closing your Robinhood account due to recent account activity. Well notify you once were done. '' I can not reach out to them despite of many attempts via chat and request for call ( no real agent answered despite of calling their main number ), and I have no way to get my money back. Robinhood still holds my money as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
Hence, I am filing a formal complaint against Robinhood and I humbly ask you to intervene on this matter ASAP and let me have my money back from Robinhood that is currently illegally and unfairly withheld while having my account closed for no reason.

Thank you.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : I am a XXXXXXXX XXXX  law abiding citizen. I am XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX held to highest degree and regard of moral, civil, and ethical duties and dealings. I am gainfully employed and do not engage in low vibrational and distasteful acts such as what is being described below. 
Unsure of exact initial dates, but on or about XX/XX/year> I was contacted by an XXXX XXXX  fraud department representative regarding " potential fraudulent activities '' that had taken place on my fathers bank account in which I am a co op due to him developing XXXX XXXX. I was informed that there were several checks that were deposited into his primary account ( which is where he received his SSI checks every month ) and the bank cleared but returned back as " bad checks ''. This was my first time learning of these circumstances and I explained to the representative that the checks in fact had to be fraudulent because I did not recognize the names of the individuals that appeared on them. I also explained that I was only on the account because of my fathers failing cognition and just in case we ever ran into problems such as him losing his card or inability to access his account, that my being on there would streamline this process of getting these issues situated, yet I've never as much passed a check through his account nor do I receive monetary gains through this account. The representative asked me to get in contact with my father because they were having no success at getting ahold of him because of phone connectivity issues. She did inform me at this time that they would proceed to close the account the first week of XXXX if there was no resolve. I would end up having the same issues with phone connectivity with my father as well and was unsuccessful at verifying things until the account was " closed '' with XXXX XXXX. Once I was able to get to my father, he did inform me that his wallet was stolen ( which because of his XXXX XXXX, he kept his PIN number to his ATM card taped to the back of his card ). 
On or around XXXX, XXXX, I was attempting to be placed on my Husbands bank account with XXXX XXXX  when I was informed by the XXXX representative who ran a consumer banking report that I would not be able to be placed on his account due to me being flagged by " XXXX '' for " fraudulent check activity ''. I immediately requested my XXXX file and received my consumer report in the mail late XX/XX/year> which did state that I was reported for " Suspected fraudulent activity '' involving an unpaid balance of {$2300.00}, owed to XXXX XXXX. After becoming aware of this, I made a trip up to XXXX XXXX  XXXX in XXXX, Kansas where I was able to speak to a management team member by the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX did provide me a copy of the bank statements showing that there had been a total of 3 checks that were apparently deposited at the ATM into my fathers account. I asked XXXX were any camera 's used to attempt to catch those responsible for the fraudulent activities to which her response was " no ''. I asked XXXX if they tried to validate who wrote out the checks because the handwriting was not mines nor my fathers, to which XXXX responded " no ''. Thirdly, I asked to see who endorsed the checks to check the signature and to my surprise, none of the three checks were ever endorsed. I asked XXXX why did the bank not take responsibility for allowing the checks to completely clear without an endorsement on the back to which her response was " we were using the " good faith '' rule to allow them to clear, as we have never had any issues with your fathers account in the past ''. XXXX refused to reverse their decision to " hold me responsible '' for their bank allowing unendorsed, fraudulent checks to clear with every indication that these checks were not legit. 
Unfortunately, I have been denied access to being added to my husbands bank account with XXXX XXXX  due to me being added to XXXX, I have been denied an auto loan with my own XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and most recently learned that the fraudulent checks have been passed to a third party who have now flogged me that much more by adding a " collections account '' to my credit report, which has lowered my score more than XXXX points. Not to mention my aging father has suffered all the same. 
Please see all exhibits attached below including the checks deposited with no endorsement, my fathers one page bank statement showing the banks allowed the cashing of the fraudulent checks, and my personal XXXX XXXX file showing the suspicious activity alert and amount owed to XXXX XXXX  ( as well as the many credit pulls I had attempting to gain access to a new auto loan for which I was denied, this includes my personal credit union who I've been in excellent standing with for more than 13 years ). After all, my bank would never cash an unendorsed check, not even a legitimate one.
