Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am concerned about the validity and accuracy of your recent investigation of these accounts that are reporting on my credit report. Last month I requested an investigation because I felt the item was not being reported legally. Couple of days ago I received a letter stating that you have ceased investigation of my credit reports because, in your opinion, you believe that I have used a third-party credit repair agency. Not only do I believe this to be a stall tactic on your part to grant you an additional 30 days to comply with my original request, but I believe it to be a blatant violation of the FCRA. 
I have attached a copy of my government issued ID as well as mail showing proof of address. So, there shouldnt be no confusion or stall tactics on your end. I have maintained a careful record of my communications with you for the purpose of filing a complaint with the FTC should you continue in your non-compliance. 
I request this under 15 U.S. Code 1692g - Validation of debts. If information is not provided or the false reporting isnt removed ; as in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX XXXX  XXXX ), you may be liable for your willful non-compliance. Credit reporting laws ensure that bureaus report only 100 % accurate credit information. Every step must be taken to assure the information reported is completely accurate and correct. The following information therefore needs to be reinvestigated. 


1.Please explain to me what your representatives uncovered to lead them to believe that you are reporting this item as it legally should be reported? 
2.What certified documents were reviewed to conclude your investigation? 
3.Please provide a complete copy of all of the information that was transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation. 
4.What did it cost your company to obtain the documents needed to complete your investigation? 
5.Please provide proof of your timely procurement of certified documents. 
6.Did you speak directly to any agent of the company that was reporting the information to confirm the accuracy of what you are reporting? 
7.If yes to above : a.Who did you speak to? 
b.On what date? 
c.How long was the conversation? 
d.What was their position? 
e.What telephone number did you call? 
f. What is the name of the employee of your company that spoke directly to the above party? 
g.What is the position of the employee of your company that spoke directly to the above party? 
h.How long has that employee been employed by your company? 
i.What formal training was provided to this employee to investigate items of this kind? 
j.Was there any email or written communication between members of your company and the above party? 
8.If so, please provide copies of all correspondence ; supply copies of any and all conclusive documentation to prove that you have in fact conducted a reasonable investigation of the account in question. 
9.Provide the date of the commencement of delinquency 10.Provide the SPECIFIC date reporting that these items will cease Enclosed with your response to the above questions I respectfully request a notarized affidavit confirming the information that is provided is true and correct as per my civil rights granted under several federal laws. This information should not come as a form letter response. 

My initial dispute was detailed and directly related to the account in question. A template response will not be an acceptable response. If you can not supply ALL of the above information in a timely manner as detailed in several laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I must immediately demand the permanent removal of this item from my credit report. 

This erroneous entry is detrimental to my overall credit rating and has caused me severe financial and emotional distress. If you choose not to provide the above requested deletion or requested/required documentation of your investigation, I will pursue the enforcements of my constitutional rights via federal court proceedings. As you are well aware this information will come out through my formal discovery process, and necessary depositions. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to formally address the willful and persistent violations committed by XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax regarding fraudulent accounts and unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. Despite three previous attempts to resolve these issues and over 90 days passing since my initial disputewell beyond the legally mandated 30-day period under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) these inaccuracies remain unresolved. The credit bureaus have not complied with federal and state laws requiring the removal and blocking of fraudulent accounts and inquiries. The following violations have been committed : Failure to Investigate and Resolve Disputes : FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) mandates that credit bureaus investigate and resolve disputes within 30 days. More than 90 days have elapsed since my initial dispute without resolution.

Failure to Notify of Negative Information : Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, creditors are required to notify consumers within five days of reporting a debt. I was never notified of these fraudulent accounts and inquiries. 
Failure to Ensure Maximum Accuracy : FCRA 607 ( b ) requires credit bureaus to ensure the maximum accuracy of the information they report. Discrepancies in balances, credit limits, and reporting dates indicate noncompliance. 
Failure to Remove and Block Fraudulent Accounts : Under FCRA 605B, upon receipt of evidence of identity theft, credit bureaus are required to remove and block fraudulent accounts and inquiries from credit reports. Despite providing substantial evidence, this has not occurred.

Failure to Protect Consumer Data : Under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6801-6809 ), financial institutions and credit bureaus are required to safeguard consumer information. The presence of these fraudulent accounts demonstrates a failure to protect my data. 
Identity Theft Protections Ignored : The Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ) criminalizes the unauthorized use of personal information. The fraudulent accounts and inaction by the bureaus violate my rights under this statute.

State Law Violations : Under Florida Statute 817.568, identity theft is addressed as a criminal offense. The credit bureaus failure to act constitutes a violation of state protections. 
Fraudulent Accounts and XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) ** : Reporting discrepancies in balances and dates, and balances exceeding credit limits. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) ** : Reporting discrepancies in balances, credit limits, and unresolved dispute comments. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) ** : Incorrect delinquency reporting and credit limit inaccuracies. 
XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ID unavailable ) : Unauthorized inquiry recorded without my knowledge or consent. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) : Fraudulent account added without consent, failed to report for three months, and I was not notified XXXX days prior to reporting, violating 15 U.S.C. 1692g. 
Additional XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX These accounts are fraudulent and were added to my credit report without my consent. I was not notified within five days of their reporting as required by 15 U.S.C. 1692g. Additionally, these accounts show discrepancies and lack proper validation.

Requested Resolution Under FCRA 605B, I demand the immediate removal and permanent blocking of these accounts and inquiries from my credit report. Additionally, I request : A thorough investigation into the reporting failures and evidence of identity theft. 
Written confirmation of the removal and blocking of these accounts and inquiries. 
Implementation of fraud alerts and compliance with federal and state identity theft protections. 
The continued presence of these fraudulent accounts on my credit report has caused significant financial harm and emotional distress. If these issues are not resolved promptly, I will pursue legal action to protect my rights and escalate this matter to other regulatory authorities.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt - XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX ) XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. I am writing in response to an alleged debt. I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g. I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : XXXX. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. XXXX. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. XXXX. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. XXXX. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. XXXX. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. XXXX. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, Equifax removed this account XXXX  days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within XXXX  days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within XXXX  days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of an auto repossession on my credit report under account XXXX XXXX. This account was previously removed from my XXXX credit file, which demonstrates that the information is either inaccurate, unverifiable, or incomplete. Also, this account is being inaccurately reported for the full loan amount instead of reflecting the proper deficiency balance after the vehicle was sold at auction, as required by law. Furthermore, I was not provided with a required notice detailing the auction results and the remaining balance, which further invalidates the accuracy of this reporting. Therefore, I am requesting that you immediately investigate and remove this account from my credit file as required by federal law. 

Under 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and consistent records. Disparities in reporting across the XXXX major bureaus call into question the accuracy of the information being furnished and your adherence to your duty under the FCRA to ensure maximum accuracy in consumer credit reports ( 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ). Credit bureaus must report only accurate, complete, and verifiable information. Reporting the full loan amount after a repossession and sale violates this standard of accuracy.

UCC 9-611 and 9-616 ( Uniform Commercial Code ) : Creditors are required to notify the borrower in writing of the time and place of the auction or sale of repossessed collateral ( 9-611 ). Additionally, after the sale, the creditor must provide an explanation of how the proceeds were applied, including the deficiency balance ( 9-616 ). Failure to provide this notice invalidates the debt or the claimed deficiency amount.

Additionally, the failure to verify the accuracy of this account may also constitute a violation of 15 USC 1681i, which requires prompt reinvestigation when a consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of an item. Given that XXXX has already removed this account, I believe the same standard of accuracy should apply to your records. 

If the furnisher of this information ( XXXX BANK ) is unable to provide documentation verifying its accuracy and compliance with those applicable laws I stated, you must remove the account immediately. Reporting unverifiable or incomplete information violates 15 USC 1681s-2 ( b ), which prohibits furnishers from knowingly reporting inaccurate data.

I am also concerned that continuing to report this repossession despite its removal from another bureau may lead to harm under 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which provide for remedies in cases of willful or negligent noncompliance with the FCRA. 

Reasons for Dispute : XXXX. Failure to Provide Required Notices : I did not receive a pre-sale notice or post-sale explanation of the proceeds and deficiency balance, as required by UCC 9-611 and 9-616. Without these notices, the creditor is in violation of its legal obligations, and the reporting of the debt is invalid. 

XXXX. Incorrect Amount Reported : If the repossessed vehicle was sold, only the deficiency balance ( remaining amount after the sale proceeds were applied ) can be reported, not the full loan amount. Reporting the full balance is a clear violation of 15 USC 1681e ( b ), requiring accuracy in credit reporting. 


Requested actions : I respectfully request that you XXXX. Reinvestigate the Account : I request that you reinvestigate this account and verify its accuracy with the furnisher of the information and require the furnisher to provide COMPLETE documentation verifying its accuracy. 

XXXX. Obtain Proof of Notices and Accuracy : Require the furnisher to provide documentation of the auction results, the pre-sale and post-sale notices, and the calculation of the deficiency balance. If they can not provide this information, the account must be removed from my report. 

XXXX. Correct or Remove the Account : If the information can not be verified or is found to be incomplete or inaccurate, this account must be corrected or removed from my credit file as required under 15 USC 1681i. 

XXXX. Provide me with a written response within XXXX  days, as required by the FCRA, detailing the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 


Please note that I am prepared to escalate this dispute to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), or other appropriate authorities if necessary. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your written response.

All numbers were entered correctly each time. Intentions make no difference when entering card numbers. 

Customer service said they'll send an unblocked card link in XXXX min. 

It has been over XXXX hrs and no unblocked card link, nor is it in my junk mail folder. 

My friend who has a Equifax Data Breach Settlement Additional XXXX XXXX XXXX card also has their card denied.

Therefore, I respectfully request that you conduct your own investigation into these accounts and delete them from my credit report as well, in accordance with the findings by XXXX.

Under FCRA Section 1681p, I have the right to seek damages for any violations, including the right to sue for failure to remove inaccurate or unverifiable information. 

I expect to receive written confirmation that the accounts in question have been removed from my credit file within the legally required XXXX period. Should the accounts not be deleted, I will pursue all legal remedies available to me, including filing a lawsuit.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute fraudulent accounts on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent, and their reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXXXXXX XXXX ( XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX XXXX Account Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, I have the right to block and demand removal of information resulting from identity theft. Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that these accounts were created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting.

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure these accounts are removed from my credit reports immediately.

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address these violations promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

Thank you for your urgent attention to this matter.

The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX I looked at my credit report and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to XXXX5 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681i 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are supposed to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
- I opened a HEILOC and a checking account with Citizen Bank on XX/XX/year>. 
- I transfered XXXX from HEILOC to checking account. 
- From checking account I tried to transfer the XXXX to business account which triggered some checks on Citizens 's side. 
- Citizen then blocked the checking account. I could not access the account, statements, or funds. 
- We called them multiple times to understand what happened and when will my funds be released and have received very limited information. They charged me to get the statements for my checking account and sent a statement but no other information. 
- Since then we closed our HEILOC and paid the XXXX from a new HEILOC from another company - The checking account is still blocked. It has {$10000.00} in funds. We can not access it or the funds and the bank is charging monthly checking and other fees. 
- We have received no communication on when the funds will be released. 
- We would like to get our funds back and close the account. 
- We also feel it is unfair that the bank is charging us fees for an account we can not even access for months now.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington, DC XXXX Subject : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act by Equifax Dear CFPB Team, I am writing to formally report a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by Equifax regarding my ongoing disputes about inaccurate information on my credit report, specifically concerning an account listed as XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Since XX/XX/year>, I have been mailing dispute letters to Equifax regarding this inaccurate account. As of XX/XX/year>, it has been over five months without resolution, despite the FCRA stipulating that credit bureaus must conduct an investigation within 30 days. Equifax has continued to stall my requests by sending me delay letters, which is unacceptable. 

Furthermore, I would like to draw attention to Section 2 of the FCRA, which states that a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. Both the financial institution involved and Equifax do not have my consent to furnish this information, nor do they possess any written consent from me. This lack of authorization raises serious concerns about the legality of the information being reported. 

I urge the CFPB to investigate this matter and hold Equifax accountable for their actions. I appreciate your attention to this serious issue and look forward to your prompt response. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute fraudulent accounts on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent, and their reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Equifax ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, I have the right to block and demand removal of information resulting from identity theft. Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that these accounts were created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting.

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure these accounts are removed from my credit reports immediately.

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address these violations promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

Thank you for your urgent attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I discovered multiple late payment entries associated with my account that were inaccurately reported. As you are aware, Consumer Reporting Agencies bear a significant responsibility to ensure that all consumer information is reported with maximum accuracy. It is essential that the information reflected on my credit profile is both accurate and truthful. 

Specifically, I have never been late with any payments for my BMW Financial account ( Account # XXXX ). I respectfully request a thorough investigation into these erroneous late payment entries and demand that you provide verifiable proof, including statements, that demonstrate these payments were indeed late. To assist in this process, I can provide supporting documentation, including bank statements, payment notifications, timestamps from the BMW payment app, and screenshots. 

Additionally, it is important to note that there have been substantial testimonies and reviews from numerous BMW customers who have experienced similar issues regarding premature reporting of late payments. These reports indicate a pattern of errors where late payment flags are applied prematurely, negatively impacting credit scores. This further highlights the possibility of an internal issue with BMW Financials reporting practices, which needs immediate investigation. 

If sufficient proof can not be provided to substantiate these late payments, I demand the immediate removal of the derogatory marks and request that the account status be corrected to reflect " on time, never late, '' as this accurately represents the history of my payments. 

I have previously submitted multiple requests to the credit bureaus to address this issue, but to no avail. I am now seeking your assistance to rectify this error and ensure that my credit profile accurately reflects my payment history. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: The credit bureaus Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are reporting bankruptcies on my credit report, attributing the information to the US Bankruptcy Court. I have attached a letter from the US Bankruptcy Court verifying that they do not furnish information to credit bureaus or any credit monitoring service, nor do they verify or validate any information concerning bankruptcies. Equifax, XXXX and XXXX is falsely reporting this information on my credit report and has not yet removed it. The United States Bankruptcy Court does not have authority over credit reporting agencies and does not report to any of them. Bankruptcy petitions and case dockets are considered public records. The Fair Credit Reporting Act, specifically Section 605, governs credit reporting agencies. According to this law, credit reporting agencies are prohibited from reporting bankruptcy cases on an individual 's credit report. 15 U.S Code 1681 a ( 4 ) Consumer Right to privacy. Consumer Right to privacy this Bankruptcy shouldn't be on my credit report, you shared my personal Information without my consent. this is identity theft ; you are criminally and CIVILLY LIABLE.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: It is crucial that consumer reporting agencies uphold their grave responsibilities when it comes to the handling of consumers personal credit files. After performing a re-investigation upon my credit file for accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX pursuant to 15 USC 1681ia1a, your company failed to follow proper procedures in regard to correspondence to me the consumer, in the handling of the reinvestigation. As clearly outlined within, 15 USC 1681i ( 7 ) ; 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy Subchapter 7 states the following ; ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a detailed description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description. Further outlined within 15 USC ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) ; ( 6 ) Notice of results of reinvestigation ( A ) In general A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than XXXX business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency. ( iii ) a notice that, if requested by the consumer, a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. The correspondence mentioned above was NEVER made to me and therefore, your company is in direct violation of the FCRA and is now liable for monetary damages detailed within 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o. Not only was a proper reinvestigation not performed as the derogatory account mentioned is erroneous to begin with, your agency failed to follow the FCRAs clear rules in the handling of correspondence to me in association with the account in question. Please delete this erroneous account as I have sought legal counsel in this matter and intend on seeking damages associated with this complaint if this issue is not resolved. Thank you for your time.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on My Credit Report under FCRA 1681 ( c ) ( 2 ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information that appears on my credit report. This dispute is filed under the protections afforded by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 1681 ( c ) ( 2 ), which outlines my rights as a consumer to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information directly with the furnisher of the information and ensures that such disputes are properly investigated. Additionally, I am invoking my rights under the following laws that further protect consumers from inaccurate credit reporting : 1. FCRA 1681 ( i ) : This section requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputed information within 30 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. 2. FCRA 1681 ( e ) : This section mandates that information reported about a consumer must be accurate and complete. 3. FCRA 1681 ( s ) : This section provides additional protections against identity theft, ensuring fraudulent accounts are removed promptly after proper verification. 4. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : This act prohibits debt collectors from reporting false or misleading information to credit reporting agencies. Disputed Item Details : * Creditor/Furnisher Name : XXXX XXXX * Account Number : XXXX * Date of Reported Issue : XX/XX/year> The following information is incorrect or incomplete for the following reasons : 1- accounts number shows incomplete 2-date reported do not match in the 3 credit bareus 3- the account has been marked as charged off repeatedly that is illegal I have attached the following documents as evidence to support my dispute : 1. A copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed item ( s ) 2. [ Other supporting documents, such as proof of wrong information reported in my credit report Pursuant to the FCRA and the above-mentioned laws, I respectfully request the following actions : 1. Investigate the disputed information with the furnisher of the data. 2. Correct or delete the inaccurate information if the investigation confirms its inaccuracy. 3. Provide me with the results of the investigation and a corrected copy of my credit report. 4. If applicable, provide me with the name, address, and telephone number of the furnisher contacted during the investigation. Please be advised that the FCRA mandates credit reporting agencies to complete investigations within 30 days of receiving a dispute. I expect a timely resolution to this matter.

Issue: Problem with fraud alerts or security freezes
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to file a formal complaint against Equifax regarding the handling of a fraud alert on my credit report. This situation has caused me significant frustration and has negatively impacted my ability to secure a mortgage for a home. 

Despite numerous calls to Equifaxs customer service number, I have been unable to resolve this issue. I have been repeatedly instructed to send documentation to have the fraud alert removed, which I have done. I provided a copy of my ID and a W-2 as requested. Despite this, I continue to be informed by Equifax representatives that : There is no fraud alert on my report, even though my lender has confirmed its existence. 
The fraud alert remains, which prevents my lender from accessing my credit report. 
I have been given conflicting information, and the lack of resolution has been beyond frustrating. To make matters worse, the Equifax phone line frequently disconnects or directs me to representatives who offer no actionable assistance, leaving me feeling as though I am being given the runaround. 

This issue has reached a critical point. I am in the process of purchasing a home, and the unresolved fraud alert is jeopardizing my ability to proceed. I am at my wits end trying to navigate Equifaxs unhelpful system. 

I request your assistance in addressing the following : Immediate removal of the fraud alert from my credit report. 
A thorough investigation into Equifaxs handling of my case and their failure to resolve this issue despite my compliance with their instructions. 
Improved customer service processes to prevent similar issues from happening to others in the future. 
Please let me know if any additional documentation is required to expedite the resolution of this matter. I appreciate your prompt attention to this issue and look forward to your assistance in achieving a resolution.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Dispute of Fraudulent Accounts and Hard Inquiry on Credit Report Dear [ XXXX ], I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information and fraudulent accounts that are being reported on my credit file. Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and applicable laws, I request an immediate investigation and removal of the following items : Equifax Disputes : 1. Hard Inquiry from XXXX XXXX  : I did not authorize this inquiry, nor do I have any accounts or interactions with XXXX XXXX. Please remove this unauthorized inquiry promptly. 2. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : This account is fraudulent and does not belong to me. Kindly investigate and remove it from my credit report. XXXX  Disputes : XXXX. XXXX  XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX  XXXX These accounts are also fraudulent and inaccurately reported. I request an immediate investigation and removal of these accounts. This inaccurate and fraudulent reporting is significantly impacting my ability to obtain essential financial opportunities and is causing unnecessary harm to my credit standing. In accordance with FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ), I request that you : Investigate these items thoroughly. Remove any unverifiable, inaccurate, or fraudulent information. Provide me with an updated copy of my credit report after corrections are made. I have attached a copy of my government-issued ID, proof of address, and a copy of my credit report with the disputed items highlighted for your convenience. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and provide updates on the investigation and resolution in writing. You may contact me at the information listed above if further documentation is needed. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: The credit bureaus Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are reporting bankruptcies on my credit report, attributing the information to the US Bankruptcy Court. I have attached a letter from the US Bankruptcy Court verifying that they do not furnish information to credit bureaus or any credit monitoring service, nor do they verify or validate any information concerning bankruptcies. Equifax, XXXX and XXXX is falsely reporting this information on my credit report and has not yet removed it. The United States Bankruptcy Court does not have authority over credit reporting agencies and does not report to any of them. Bankruptcy petitions and case dockets are considered public records. The Fair Credit Reporting Act, specifically Section 605, governs credit reporting agencies. According to this law, credit reporting agencies are prohibited from reporting bankruptcy cases on an individual 's credit report. 15 U.S Code 1681 a ( 4 ) Consumer Right to privacy. Consumer Right to privacy this Bankruptcy shouldn't be on my credit report, you shared my personal Information without my consent. this is identity theft ; you are criminally and CIVILLY LIABLE.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been disputing inaccuracies on my credit reports with the three credit bureaus since XX/XX/year> without resolution. These errors are severely impacting my ability to secure a mortgage for my family. The following accounts contain specific inaccuracies and violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and I request immediate investigation and correction : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : This account is listed as a collection/charge-off with a past due amount of {$1000.00}. 
The last payment was made on XX/XX/year>, and the account was closed on XX/XX/year>. 
Payment history inconsistencies are noted between XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax, with XXXX reporting " NONE REPORTED '' while XXXX and Equifax show derogatory statuses. 
Requested Action : Due to these reporting discrepancies and unresolved dispute status, I request this account be deleted from all three credit bureaus. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : This account is open and reported as current, but there are late payments reported in XXXX and XX/XX/year>. 
XXXX and XXXX show 30- and 60-day late payments, while Equifax shows consistent reporting errors.Dispute remarks indicate prior disputes, but the errors remain unresolved. FCRA Violation : Inaccurate reporting despite previous disputes violates 611 of the FCRA. Requested Action : Update the account to reflect no late payments and accurate payment history across all bureaus. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXnaccuracies : The account is reported as open, but payment history shows multiple late payments ( 30, 60, 90, 120 days ) starting in XXXX XXXX and Equifax show discrepancies in the timeline of these late payments. FCRA Violation : Reporting inconsistent and inaccurate late payments despite current account status. Requested Action : Update the account to reflect no late payments and correct reporting. 
XXXX. XXXX ( Account # XXXX ) Inaccuracies : This account is listed as a collection/charge-off with a balance of {$510.00}. Payment history is " NONE REPORTED '' across all three bureaus. FCRA Violation : Failure to verify and accurately report account details violates 623 of the FCRA. Requested Action : Request this account be deleted due to unverifiable information and reporting inaccuracies. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) Inaccuracies : Listed as a collection/charge-off with a balance of {$710.00}. Payment history is " NONE REPORTED '' across all bureaus. 
FCRA Violation : Inaccurate reporting of a collection account without verifiable payment history. Requested Action : Request this account be deleted due to lack of verification and inaccurate reporting. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) Inaccuracies : Account reported as a collection/charge-off with a balance of $ XXXX reporting between XXXX and Equifax, with XXXX showing no reported history. FCRA Violation : Failure to ensure maximum accuracy under 607 ( b ) of the FCRA.

Requested Action : Request this account be deleted due to inaccurate and incomplete reporting. 
Summary of Violations Failure to Correct Inaccuracies ( 611 FCRA ).

Reporting Inaccurate Information ( 623 FCRA ).

Lack of Proper Verification ( 607 ( b ) FCRA ).

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear [ Equifax/XXXX XXXX  I am writing to formally dispute the inclusion of multiple inaccurate and unauthorized accounts on my credit report. Specifically : 1. An account reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) regarding a vehicle loan. 
2. An account reported by XXXX XXXX, which I have never had any dealings with. 

I have never opened an account with either XXXX XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX, nor have I had any financial transactions or agreements with these institutions. The reporting of these accounts is false, unverifiable, and a violation of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681.

As per the FCRA, you are required to ensure all information on my credit report is accurate and verifiable. Failure to do so constitutes a direct violation of federal law. These accounts can not be verified because they are fraudulent and do not belong to me.

Demands : 1. Remove these accounts from my credit report immediately and ensure no further reporting from these institutions regarding these accounts.

2. Provide written confirmation of the removal of these accounts within three ( 3 ) days of receiving this letter.

3. Cease reporting any negative or unauthorized information about me from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, or any related entities. 

Failure to act within the specified timeframe will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and pursuing legal remedies. 

I have attached a copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed accounts for your reference, along with the required proof of my identity, including a government-issued ID and utility bill.

Provide a detailed explanation of the methods used to verify these disputed items.Notice of Intent to EscalateShould you fail to comply within the statutory 30-day timeframe outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), I will escalate this matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney Generals office. Additionally, I reserve the right to seek legal action under the FCRA to protect my rights.Please treat this letter as a formal notice of dispute. I expect an acknowledgment of receipt within five business days and resolution within the timeline required by law.

May I kindly request that you desist from reporting any detrimental aspects of the allegations pertaining to the account details mentioned below. There is a possibility that XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX may have been reported unfairly, without proper certification or in violation of the law. Consequently, I respectfully demand that you promptly remove any item that contains derogatory-conditioned late payments, as required by law. 

I would like to bring to your attention the matter of my rights being violated. Enclosed within this document are the concerns I have outlined regarding your reporting practices. It is evident that the information provided is incomplete and fails to meet the standards I expect. I must emphasize that according to the law, it is imperative for you to certify all aspects of required XXXX XXXX XXXX in a truthful, accurate, timely, and comprehensive manner. Failure to do so may necessitate the escalation of these issues to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state 's Attorney General for further investigation and resolution. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting for Account # XXXX Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment reporting on my credit report for the above-referenced account. After reviewing my credit report, I identified a late payment erroneously reported for XX/XX/XXXX. The account in question is with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and is reflected in your records with the following details : Account Details Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$8200.00} Last Verified : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Last Activity : XX/XX/XXXX Date Reported : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$6100.00} Closed Date : N/A Account Rating : Open Account Description : Individual Account Dispute Status : Not Disputed Creditor Type : All Banks Account Status : Open Payment Status : Pays Account as Agreed Creditor Remarks : None Payment Amount : {$130.00} Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX Term Length : N/A Past Due Amount : {$0.00} Account Type : Revolving Payment Frequency : Monthly Credit Limit : {$8000.00} Discrepancies in Payment History According to the Equifax-reported payment history, a XXXX late payment is listed for XX/XX/XXXX. This late payment is inaccurate, as I have consistently paid this account on time. I have attached supporting documentation, including my credit report highlighting this inaccurate entry and personal identification documents to validate my dispute. 
Reference to Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies must ensure that all information reported is accurate and verifiable. Specifically : 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) : My consumer report should not contain information solely as to transactions or experiences between me and the creditor without proper verification.

15 USC 1666 ( b ) : Reasonable procedures must ensure that each periodic statement is mailed to me not later than XXXX  days before the due date.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) : Accurate and complete information must be disclosed in periodic statements, including the payment due date.

Requested Action I kindly request that Equifax : Conduct a thorough investigation into the accuracy of the reported late payment.

Provide a detailed description of the investigation process per 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ). 
Update the payment status for XX/XX/XXXX to reflect " Paid As Agreed, Never Late. '' If you are unable to provide verifiable proof of the late payment, correct the reporting immediately to align with the accurate payment history. 
Supporting Evidence I have attached the following documents to support my dispute : A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry. 
Personal identification documents for verification purposes. 
Response Timeline Under the FCRA, you are required to complete your investigation and provide a written response within XXXX  days from the receipt of this dispute. If you can not verify the accuracy of the reported late payment, I expect it to be corrected promptly. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your resolution and response within the time frame required by law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( XXXX ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. 

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting for Account # XXXX Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment reporting on my credit report for the above-referenced account. After reviewing my credit report, I identified a late payment erroneously reported for XX/XX/XXXX. The account in question is with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and is reflected in your records with the following details : Account Details Account Number : XXXX High Balance : {$8200.00} Last Verified : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Last Activity : XX/XX/XXXX Date Reported : XX/XX/XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Owed : {$6100.00} Closed Date : N/A Account Rating : Open Account Description : Individual Account Dispute Status : Not Disputed Creditor Type : All Banks Account Status : Open Payment Status : Pays Account as Agreed Creditor Remarks : None Payment Amount : {$130.00} Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX Term Length : N/A Past Due Amount : {$0.00} Account Type : Revolving Payment Frequency : Monthly Credit Limit : {$8000.00} Discrepancies in Payment History According to the Equifax-reported payment history, a XXXX late payment is listed for XX/XX/XXXX. This late payment is inaccurate, as I have consistently paid this account on time. I have attached supporting documentation, including my credit report highlighting this inaccurate entry and personal identification documents to validate my dispute. 
Reference to Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), credit reporting agencies must ensure that all information reported is accurate and verifiable. Specifically : 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) : My consumer report should not contain information solely as to transactions or experiences between me and the creditor without proper verification.

15 USC 1666 ( b ) : Reasonable procedures must ensure that each periodic statement is mailed to me not later than 21 days before the due date.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) : Accurate and complete information must be disclosed in periodic statements, including the payment due date. 
Requested Action I kindly request that Equifax : Conduct a thorough investigation into the accuracy of the reported late payment. 
Provide a detailed description of the investigation process per 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 7 ). 
Update the payment status for XX/XX/XXXX to reflect " Paid As Agreed, Never XXXX. '' If you are unable to provide verifiable proof of the late payment, correct the reporting immediately to align with the accurate payment history. 
Supporting Evidence I have attached the following documents to support my dispute : A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry. 
Personal identification documents for verification purposes. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX the FCRA, you are required to complete your investigation and provide a written response within 30 days from the receipt of this dispute. If you can not verify the accuracy of the reported late payment, I expect it to be corrected promptly. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your resolution and response within the time frame required by law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I demand that these accounts be investigated promptly and corrected as necessary. Please provide me with a written statement of the results of your investigation and a copy of my updated credit report. 
I have enclosed copies of relevant documents supporting my position, including [ list any documents such as account statements, letters from creditors, etc. ]. Please review these documents as part of your investigation. If the investigation finds that the information is indeed inaccurate, I request that these errors be rectified immediately and that all necessary parties be informed of the corrections. As stipulated by the FCRA, I am entitled to recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees if I suffer damages as a result of a violation. Therefore, I expect this matter to be handled with the utmost urgency and accuracy to avoid further complications. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your swift response and resolution.

There is information on my consumer report that I did not provide written permission, instructions, or consent to be reported on my consumer report as a result of identity theft. Therefore, I am formally requesting that the reporting of this inaccurate and fraudulent information be blocked and deleted.

My request for the blockage and deletion of this data is not a mistake, nor is it founded on any misrepresentation of facts on my part. I am committed to ensuring the accuracy and integrity of my credit report, and as such, I am rightfully seeking the removal of these wrongfully attributed transactions. It is crucial to clarify that the transactions identified in my report are in no way associated with any of my legitimate financial activities. As the victim of identity theft, these transactions do not represent any transaction undertaken by me as the rightful consumer.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am entitled to a fair and accurate representation of my credit history. I kindly ask that you investigate this situation promptly and take the necessary steps to remove the fraudulent accounts from my credit report. I understand the importance of a correct credit profile and its implications for my financial well-being.

Enclosed with this letter are copies of documents substantiating my identity and the fraudulent nature of the reported transactions and trust that these documents will provide the evidence required to facilitate a swift resolution of this issue. I kindly request a written confirmation once the fraudulent accounts have been removed from my credit report.

The identified transactions are not information related to any transaction by me as the consumer and must be deleted and removed from reporting on my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Inquiry XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX In accordance with the regulations stipulated in 15 U.S. Code 1681b, governing the permissible purposes of consumer reports, I hereby demand the immediate removal of all inquiries not initiated by myself from my credit reports. Specifically, the following inquiries are unauthorized and must be promptly deleted : You are required to do what I am asking and block these transactions from being reported to my consumer report within 4 days from the date of the receipt of this notice. I look forward to your response. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to you regarding a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights, protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) ). Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I have identified the following accounts that have breached these legal provisions : XXXX XXXX  XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts have accessed my credit information without my explicit authorization, which constitutes a violation of my privacy and confidentiality rights. Additionally, some of these accounts contain obsolete information that should be excluded from my credit report as stipulated in 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ).

According to 15 USC 1681, Section 602 ( A ), I have the right to privacy. Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681, Section 604 ( A ), Section 2, a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. Also, 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) states that no consumer reporting agency may include any adverse item of information that is more than seven years old, other than records of convictions of crimes.

Finally, under 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), no person shall furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Additionally, according to 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), a person shall not furnish information if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative: Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information dispute by a consumer, an team of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, base on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( 1 ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. U.S Code 1681a-Definitions ; rules of construction, ( 1 ) In General-The terms consumer report Means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; ( B ) employment purposes ; or ( C ) any other purpose authorized under section 1681b of this title Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. XXXX XXXX XXXX on my report is inaccurate, I reached out to the lender directly on XX/XX/year> and spoke with a supervisor Agent No # XXXX since this account has been closed and paid as to the terms and agreement they are unable to send me any information on this account I had mentioned the late payments on my report that are not accurate and they have no idea why and can not send me any verification to clarify this on my report, I ask that this be reverse to paid as agree remove the late payment since my account has never been late and is paid in full.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: To whom it may concern : I am contesting the information on my credit report that I believe is not correct. In accordance with the FCRA Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( l ) and in accordance with the accepted STANDARD of metro 2 data field reporting. The information has not been proven to be true, correct, or verified.I can't recognize any allegations of wrongdoing without any factual proof. I challenge the reportability of any such claims. According to the federal and state laws that apply to me, you are required to report information accurately and completely.You should not keep or report anything that you know is not in compliance with the law or regulations.I am writing to let you know that you need to make sure everything in my credit report is accurate. This includes making sure that you adhere to all FCRA and METRO 2 format reporting standards.For every account that youre reporting, I need evidence ( physically verifiable ) that you verified the information to be accurate and compliant. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ** Dear Equifax Customer Service XXXX I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Equifax regarding your violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX, and I have experienced multiple instances of mishandling of my personal information and disputes following the compromise of my credit file over the past four months. 

In [ XXXX ], I initiated an FTC fraud report which was placed on all of my credit files due to the compromise. Following this, I began disputing several inaccurate and fraudulent items listed on my credit report, as is my right under the FCRA. 

However, from the very onset of my disputes, Equifax has been non-compliant and infringed upon my rights. Instead of conducting a thorough investigation, Equifax has verified and updated accounts currently in dispute without providing me with substantial proof or documentation regarding these trade lines. When I requested verification of these accounts, my requests were disregarded. 

Additionally, I must supplement this complaint to highlight further violations and injuries. Each time within the last two months that Ive disputed or requested verification and the method of verification, Equifax has further injured me by actively reopening the closed account with XXXX XXXX XXXX and reporting it as being late, indicating I am missing payments in arrearage of currently XXXX payments, with the first being over XXXX. I have directly communicated with representatives from XXXX, who assured me that these changes and inaccurate reporting were not initiated by them but rather resulted from actions taken by Equifax. 

Each time this inaccurate reporting occurs, I instantly lose XXXX points on my credit score. Furthermore, regarding the XXXX account, in the last XXXX instances that Ive asked for verification and the method of verification, Equifax has re-reported the statement in collections as if it is new or has been removed from my report. However, this is not the case ; the derogatory account has never left my report. The resubmission of this collections statement has caused significant harm to my credit report, presenting the information as if it is being reported for the first time. This misrepresentation has negatively impacted my credit standing, and I seek to address this issue promptly. 

Despite my numerous complaints, disputes, and requests for verification regarding the reporting of these trade lines, I took the additional step of reaching out to the agency responsible for the alleged debt with XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. They reported that the alleged collection account has been closed since XXXX. This revelation underscores that Equifax has consistently failed to adhere to FCRA statutes and guidelines, neglecting to fulfill its mandated duty to conduct proper investigations and furnish accurate account information. Such failures only compound the egregious conduct that I have endured. 

To broaden and strengthen my complaint, I would like to specifically cite violations of the FCRA relating to Section 617 [ 15 U.S.C 1681o ]. These include the allowance of facially false information, such as inflated original and charge-off amounts, the reporting of accounts with delinquent or late payments when, in fact, no delinquency is present according to payment history ( 30, 60, 90 days, etc. ), and inconsistencies in consumer account information that clearly indicate that at least one piece of information must be inaccurate.

For example, if every other tradeline indicates ongoing payment activity while one tradeline contains a " deceased '' indicator, reasonable policies and procedures should identify this inconsistency, and the consumer reporting agency should prevent the inclusion of the inaccurate information in consumer reports it generates. As stipulated in Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. The Bureau has interpreted this requirement to necessitate that consumer reporting agencies implement and maintain reasonable screening procedures designed to identify and prevent the inclusion of facially false data, including logical inconsistencies in consumer or account information.

I would also like to draw your attention to Sections 616 and 617 of the FCRA. Section 616 states that " any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this title with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to '' actual or statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, along with punitive damages that the court allows, and costs and reasonable attorney 's fees. A violation is considered willful when it is inconsistent with " authoritative guidance '' from relevant agencies. Such guidance includes that issued by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), as consumer reporting agencies face significant liability risks under Section 616 if they violate the FCRA.

In addition, Section 617 emphasizes that " any person who is negligent in failing to comply with any requirement imposed under this title with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to '' the consumer 's actual damages, along with costs and reasonable attorney 's fees. Given the negligence evidenced in Equifax 's handling of my disputes and the clear violations of the FCRA, I believe I am entitled to compensation.

In support of these allegations, I would like to reference case law, including **Bryant v. TRW, Inc.**, where the court rejected a consumer reporting agency 's assertion that it had " no obligation '' to compare facially inconsistent information contained in different consumer reports. Furthermore, in **Davis v. Equifax , Inc.** , the court ruled that the presence of erroneous data on a consumer report can demonstrate the unreasonableness of reporting agency procedures. This aligns with **Hammer v. Sams East , Inc.**, where the court acknowledged that consumer reporting agencies might be liable for damages due to negligence in maintaining accurate records.

Equifaxs continued failure to adhere to these legal standards has resulted in the ongoing reporting of inaccurate information, causing me substantial financial harm and stress. In an effort to resolve these issues, I escalated matters by submitting complaints to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). Unfortunately, each complaint resulted in further demands for identity verification, including requests for lease agreements, XXXX change of address verification, XXXX forms, my Georgia ID , and long and short form birth certificates. I submitted all of these requested documents without any resolution or changes to my personal information, including my name ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), job history ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ), and current address ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  ). 

This continuous process has not only caused considerable inconvenience but has also been met with what I can only interpret as malicious intent to delay the resolution of my disputes. 

As per the FCRA, I am entitled to request compensation for damages caused by these violations. Therefore, I am formally demanding compensation for the undue stress and inconvenience suffered due to the mishandling of my credit information, as well as reimbursement for any costs incurred as a result of this situation. 

I expect to hear from you within 30 days of this letter regarding the actions you plan to take. Should I not receive a satisfactory response, I will consider escalating my complaint to the relevant authorities, including legal counsel. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX [ Your Signature, if sending a hard copy ] ---

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I write to address multiple discrepancies on my credit report and to bring to your attention the various violations made by your organization in accordance with United States Code Laws.

1. Personal Information Challenge : I challenge the following personal information : As per 15 U.S Code 1681 a ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy, I regard my hard inquiry and account information as private. Your reporting of accounts that are not mine is a breach of my privacy rights.

2. FDCPA 807 - Misleading False Reporting : The information you have reported wrongly suggests to future creditors that I initiated all these inquiries and accounts. In reality, these were actions of a scammer. This misrepresentation on your part violates the FCRA laws for fairness.

3. 15 USC 1681n Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : You've accepted and reported credit information about me without proper verification, making you potentially liable for up to {$1000.00} per violation.

4. 18 U.S. Code 1028A - Aggravated Identity Theft : Sharing my information without my prior consent makes you criminally liable for aggravated identity theft, punishable for up to 2 years.

5. 15 U.S. Code 6802 ( b ) 1 ( ) ( a ) ( A ) ( B ) ( C ) Obligations for Personal Information Disclosure : Your failure to disclose my right to opt out of information sharing is deceptive. My consumer rights have been violated due to your omission.

6. FDCPA 8012 - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : You reported inquiries and accounts without proper validation, contravening the GAAP requirements.

7. Reporting Discrepancies : Your reporting indicates I owe a debt without displaying any negative balance. This is misleading.

8. 15 U.S. Code 1692f Unfair Practices : Your conduct suggests several violations, including unauthorized collection of amounts and the use of misleading symbols on mailed communication.

9. 15 U.S. Code 1602 - Definitions and Rules of Construction : The information you provided relating to me is inaccurate, violating 15 USC 1681s-2.

10. Claims of Harassment and Abuse : Per FDCPA 806, I feel harassed and abused due to the continuous reporting of inaccurate items and unwarranted communications from creditors.

11. Identity Theft and Unauthorized Sharing : My information was illegally shared and used without my genuine consent, resulting in a case of identity theft as defined by Section 1581a ( 3 ).

12. Reporting Inaccuracies : Your reporting of late payments without clear definitions in TILA, FCRA, and FDCPA is deceptive and violates FCRA laws.

13. 15 U.S. Code 1692j Furnishing Certain Deceptive Forms : Any contract signed without my participation in the debt collection violates 15 USC 1692j.

14. Requests Pertaining to Debts : I am the original creditor, and only I can validate any debts. The debts reported by you are unvalidated and must be removed.

15. 15 U.S. Code 1681b Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports : You have acted without my written consent, which equates to identity theft. 

I, XXXX XXXX did not consent to, authorize, or benefit from any of the reported inquiries or accounts. These are inaccurate, and I demand their removal. I've attached an FTC report # XXXX confirming identity theft incidents in my name. You are required by 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 to complete this reinvestigation and block or update all information resulting from identity theft within 4 days of receiving this letter.

THAT IS AGAINST THE LAW. You will be criminally and civilly liable for all the fees listed in my invoice attached. Please remove all fraudulent accounts as I have no knowledge of any of these accounts due to the Equifax XXXX XXXX data breach/identity theft. All is being investigated by the FTC and CFPB. According to FCRA 605B, this information must be blocked immediately until the investigation is over.

Also, 15 USC 1681n defines Civil liability for willful noncompliance : in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. I will accept payment in the form of a check. Please compensate me within 24 hours of receiving this dispute letter.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681g, I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of the request concerning the accounts that you are reporting on my credit report.

****IMPORTANT **** PLEASE don't respond to my request by saying that these accounts have been verified by the information provider. SEND ME COPIES OF THE DOCUMENTS THAT YOU HAVE RETAINED IN YOUR FILES THAT YOUR COMPANY USED TO VERIFY THE ACCURACY OF THESE DISPUTED ACCOUNTS. I demand that the following account be verified or removed immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Reason : According to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), the agent is in breach of 15 U.S.C. 1692e, which prevents the dissemination of false or misleading information, and 15 U.S.C. 1692j, which bars the provision of deceptive forms. Furthermore, as stipulated by 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I should have received a written notification regarding this issue at least five days prior, but this was not done. Being the only original creditor, I hold the sole right to authenticate this debt. Therefore, I HEREBY DECLARE THAT I DO NOT RECOGNIZE THIS DEBT.

Dispute Instruction : According to the provisions of 15 USC 1692g, 15 USC 1681b, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have not granted any permission for your agency to list this public record on my credit report. For all accounts mentioned above, I require verification and validation of every detail including notations, dates, and balances, irrespective of their reported status. I also request evidence of your verification method, and the specific details that correspond with mine. Absent precise matches, the account must be removed immediately in accordance with the FCRA. Pertaining to 15 USC 1605, 15 USC 1666b, 15 USC 1681a, and 15 USC 1681i ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), any reported late payments on this account must be promptly removed. This account has always been current, and proof should be available demonstrating that any statements were mailed to me at least 21 days prior to any due payment. As per FCRA Sections 605, 609, and 623, I request this evidence. Additionally, as this is listed as a collection account, the collecting party must authenticate the survivability of this debt, their ownership of the debt, their collection rights, and that all their details align with the original creditor. Without such proof, the entry must be deleted. Finally, as outlined in 15 USC 1681b related to the permissible purposes of consumer reports : it is expressly articulated that a consumer reporting agency may provide a report in line with the written instructions of the associated consumer. The record of this account is erroneous ; I have never defaulted on my payments.

Kindly update the status to reflect accurate, timely payments.

I know that as the consumer, I HOLD ALL THE POWER. As a ( MO ) 281 SW715, 719, I presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact, exists. As a consumer XXXX XXXX and the one with ALL THE POWER, these inaccurate accounts on this letter must be deleted immediately AS IN ASAP, or I will seek monetary damages in small claims court in my city and state. Since I attached my form of ID, PROOF OF ADDRESS, & SOCIAL SECURITY CARD, this complaint lists someone that your company should recognize as their customer or their customers authorized representative. 

We have also involved and sent this letter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Attorney Generals Office, Better Business Bureau, and Federal Trade Commission. Erroneous RESULT OF the Equifax XXXX XXXX Breach Direct Violation 15 USC 1681 Reporting incorrectly. THESE INQUIRIES & ACCOUNTS ARE inaccurate across all 3 Bureaus : XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax. 

Furthermore, I certify that this request to block was made NOT in error, and My request to block information was NOT based on a material misrepresentation. I DID NOT knowingly obtain or should have known that I obtained possession of goods, services, or monies as a result of one or more of the transactions that I am seeking to block. If I received goods and services, then please have a senior executive certify under the penalty of perjury that I, in fact, received goods and services as a result of this transaction in writing under 15 USC 1681B ( a ) ( 2 ). Additionally, I request that you send me a validation of all debts according to GAAP. If you can not do that, then you must remove them.
