This change occurred after I paid off one of my credit cards with a different company. I was unaware of a {$16.00} interest charge from that company, as they did not contact me by phone or mail. Unfortunately, this led to my account becoming 30 days past due. 

I only discovered this situation when I received a credit alert indicating that I had a past-due account. As a result, my credit score dropped from XXXX to XXXX, which has been a significant setback for me. 

I have been a loyal customer of Synchrony Bank/PayPal and have never missed a payment in the history of my account. I have always made timely payments, and I do not believe my credit limit should have been decreased without considering my overall payment history. 

Therefore, I am requesting that Synchrony Bank/PayPal review my account and reinstate my credit limit to the previous amount of {$13000.00}. I have worked hard to establish my credit line, and I believe this situation is unjust. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Johnson Mark LLC has summoned me to court illegally I disputed this complaint with all XXXX asking for validation of this account on XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>,. I am submitting this complaint against for their attempt to collect a debt they are not legally authorized to collect. Their actions are in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and applicable Credit Reporting ( CR ) rules outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Details of the Complaint : XXXX. Failure to Validate the Debt : Upon initial contact by [ Debt Collectors Name ], I requested validation of the alleged debt in writing, as allowed under the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ). Despite my request, the company has failed to provide proper validation, including proof that the debt is valid, that they own the debt or have the right to collect it, and a full accounting of the amount owed. 

XXXX. Debt Not Collectible Under CR Rules : It is my understanding that under federal law, debts sold to collection agencies may not be collectible unless the agency can legally demonstrate ownership and compliance with XXXX rules. Specifically : Credit Reporting Rules ( FCRA ) : Debts sold to collection agencies must include complete and accurate information about the debt, including its origin, the amount, and whether the statute of limitations has expired. Agencies must also notify credit bureaus if a debt is disputed. 

Debt Ownership : If the original creditor sold the debt, the collector must provide a clear chain of title proving their legal right to collect the debt. [ Debt Collectors Name ] has not provided this. 

XXXX. Violation of My Rights : The debt in question appears to be unverified, unenforceable, and possibly past the statute of limitations for collection under [ applicable state law ]. Attempting to collect this debt without validation is a violation of my consumer rights under the FDCPA and FCRA.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative: Last XXXX my wife and I were vacationing in XXXX. For most of our charges we used a XXXX Credit card issued to us by TD Bank. When we returned home we reviewed our statement and saw that on XX/XX/year> a charge for {$960.00} was made that was not authorized by us. The vendor name was listed as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. We did not do business with this vendor. The charge was fraudulent. I personally researched the company and found that they were going under the cover of being a " consulting company '' that seems to have gone out of business and moved their address several times. This was confirmed by an employee at the XXXX that we stayed at. I wrote and called numerous times to TD Bank and they said they would not honor this as fraud because it was made at a terminal and charges were made before and after this charge. I explained that many XXXX restaurants and clubs hold your card while you are in the establishment so you do not leave without paying, and any digital pirate could have ripped down the information on the card and made the charge. They ignored this and kept sending me the same form letter. I wrote to the head of fraud for TD Bank and my letter was returned without explanation. In my last attempt to deal with them I asked for this simple information : a ) where and exactly when was the charge made ... full address and time of day, b ) what exactly was purchased, c ) proactive contact to the vendor to verify their legitimacy. They completely ignored this request and kept sending me the exact same form letter saying they were not going to pursue because the card was in my possession ( which many times, as explained above and to them, it was not ) and charges were made before and after the alleged fraud. The situation remains unresolved.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Account Name : SEZZLE INC Date Opened : XX/XX/year> Issue : This account has been charged-off with {$1700.00} written off. It continues to appear as an active debt, despite it being written off and reported to the IRS as gross income, violating 15 USC 1681s-2 ( b ) and FDCPA 1692e. I WANT THIS ACCOUNT TO BE DELETE IMMEDIATELY NO CONSENT WAS GIVEN TO REPORT SUCH INFORMATION. I want to OPT-OUT OF SHARING. REMOVE ACCOUNT. Under IRS guidelines, once a debt has been charged off and reported on a 1099-C as gross income, it is no longer legally considered a collectible debt. Continuing to report such an account as charged-off or written-off, when the IRS has acknowledged it as income, violates 15 USC 1681s-2 ( b ) and constitutes false representation, as defined in XXXX 's XXXX XXXX. Furthermore, under Bankruptcy law, the debtors obligations are considered XXXX, and the debt should not be misrepresented as due or owing. 


- FCRA ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ) 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Prohibits reporting information that is known to be inaccurate or misleading. Reporting a charged-off account as an active debt violates this provision.

15 USC 1681e ( b ) Mandates credit reporting agencies to ensure maximum possible accuracy in consumer reports, which includes accurately reflecting a charged-off debt status.

15 USC 1681i ( a ) Requires proper investigation of disputed information and timely correction if inaccuracies are found.

FDCPA ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ) 15 USC 1692e ( 2 ) ( A ) Prohibits false representation of the character, amount, or legal status of any debt. Listing a charged-off account as active violates this clause.

15 USC 1692f Prohibits unfair or unconscionable means to collect or report a debt. Reporting a written-off debt as active is deceptive and harmful.

IRS Reporting Violations 26 USC 61 ( a ) ( 12 ) A charged-off amount reported to the IRS as gross income ( Form 1099-C ) indicates the debt has been forgiven. Continuing to report this as an active debt misrepresents the legal status of the account.

Key Points to Dispute Once a debt is charged off and reported to the IRS as gross income, the creditor acknowledges it as uncollectible. It can not legally remain an " active '' debt on the credit report.

Reporting this incorrectly inflates liabilities and damages the consumers creditworthiness, constituting unfair reporting practices.

UCC 9-210 Request for Accounting : This section requires the creditor to provide an accurate accounting of the debt. If the account is charged off, any discrepancies or incomplete information about its status can support its removal.

UCC 1-304 Obligation of Good Faith : Creditors and furnishers must act in good faith. Reporting a charged-off account as active violates this obligation, as it misrepresents the true status of the account.

UCC 2-615 Unconscionability : Continuing to report a charged-off account as active, especially after being reported to the IRS, can be argued as an unconscionable act that harms the consumer.

USC ( United States Code ) Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) Duty to Update Information : Creditors must promptly update and correct any inaccurate information. A charged-off account should not remain as active.

15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) Obsolete Information : Charged-off debts must not remain on a credit report beyond seven years from the date of delinquency.

Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 USC 1692e ( 10 ) False or Deceptive Practices : Reporting a charged-off account inaccurately can be classified as a deceptive practice.

15 USC 1692e ( 8 ) Failure to Communicate Dispute : If the account is disputed, the creditor must note this status in credit reports. Failing to do so violates this provision.

IRS Reporting Codes 26 USC 6050P Debt Discharge Reporting : Once a debt is discharged and reported on Form 1099-C to the IRS, it is considered forgiven. Reporting this as active debt on a credit report misrepresents its legal status.

Unfair Practices and Contractual Law 15 USC 45 ( a ) Unfair Trade Practices : Reporting false information about a charged-off account constitutes an unfair trade practice under the Federal Trade Commission Act.

15 USC 1637 ( b ) Billing Error Correction : Failure to correct inaccuracies related to charge-offs may be a billing violation.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX CAF XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation which is binding on me to pay this debt. I request that you provide legal validation of such debt, and the requirements are as follows. : Complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established via XXXX v XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ; XXXX XXXX. App. XXXX XXXX. Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein I agreed to pay the original creditor. Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company. ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Services, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) - Information relating to the purchase of a bad debt is not proprietary or burdensome. Debtor must phrase their request clearly to obtain : The source of a debt and the amount a bad debt buyer paid for plaintiff 's debt, how amount sought was calculated, where in issue a list of reports to credit bureaus, and documents conferring authority on defendant to collect debt. Intimate knowledge of the creation of the debt by you, the collection agency. As I am sure you are well aware, under FDCPA Section 809 ( b ), you are not allowed to pursue collection activity until the debt is validated. You should be made aware that in XXXX XXXX, Plaintiff, vs. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF ARIZONA, XXXX, the courts ruled that reporting a collection account indeed is considered collection activity. While I prefer not to litigate, I will use the courts as needed to enforce my rights under the FDCPA. I look forward to a speedy resolution of this matter. 
Yours Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting a formal complaint against Goldman Sachs and Apple Card regarding what I believe are unfair and abusive business practices, particularly concerning their failure to provide proper billing statements and account notifications, which has negatively affected my credit standing. 

Background : Fraudulent Charge and Account Lock : On XXXX XXXX XXXX I discovered a fraudulent charge of {$24.00} on my Apple Card when I payed my XXXX bill, and immediately contacted Apple via their support chat to report the issue. Apple acknowledged the fraudulent charge and reversed it on XX/XX/XXXX. However, without my knowledge, my Apple Card account was locked due to the fraudulent charge and the fact that the chat session with Apple support ended unexpectedly due to connectivity. I believed the issue had been resolved at that time. 


Failure to Provide Billing Statements : After my account was locked, I did not receive any billing statements from Goldman Sachs/Apple Card via email ( XXXX ), which was my primary form of communication. The last email to me on XX/XX/2024, ( see attached ) was regarding the fraudulent charge reverse and the next email, XX/XX/XXXX, was after I had discovered the account lock and paid my outstanding bill. Additionally, I had recently moved, and all my mail was being forwarded to my new address, including Apple card statements. However, I never received any paper bills after the lock from Goldman Sachs/Apple Card , despite the fact that my mail forwarding was properly set up. 


Discovery of the Issue : I only became aware that my account had been locked and that payments were overdue in midXXXX XXXX, when I checked my credit report and saw late payment entries. Prior to this, I had not received any notifications or bills, either by email, phone or postal mail, informing me of the locked account or outstanding balances. The lack of communication left me unaware of any issues with my account until the damage to my credit score had already occurred. Up until this point, I have had nearly perfect credit for decades.

Impact on My Credit : Due to the failure of Goldman Sachs/Apple Card to send billing statements or communicate that my account was locked, I unknowingly incurred late payments, which have been reported to the credit bureaus and have negatively impacted my credit score. Additionally, this has prevented me from refinancing my home mortgage resulting in the loss of XXXX of dollars, as long as my credit is impacted. I believe this situation could have been avoided had Goldman Sachs/Apple Card fulfilled their obligations to provide proper notifications and statements. When I contacted Goldman Sachs about this via phone multiple times in XXXX and XXXX, my claim review was denied as they stated it was " fair and accurate reporting, '' to credit bureaus. 


Request for CFPB Intervention : I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter and determine whether Goldman Sachs and Apple Card have engaged in unfair and abusive business practices by : Failing to send me periodic billing statements or any form of notification ( email or mail ) informing me of my account status. 
Locking my account without proper email or mail communication following the fraudulent charge and support chat issue.

Reporting late payments to the credit bureaus, despite my lack of knowledge of the account lock and overdue payments.

Please find attached relevant documentation, including details of my communication with Apple/Goldman Sachs and any related correspondence.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX on behalf of Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC has filed a court civil suit against me on a debt that has not been validated. I am submitting this complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX on behalf of Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC for their attempt to collect a debt they are not legally authorized to collect. Their actions are in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and applicable Credit Reporting ( CR ) rules outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Details of the Complaint : 1.Failure to Validate the Debt : This debt is required to be validated under the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C.1692g ). the company has failed to provide proper validation, including proof that the debt is valid, that they own the debt or have the right to collect it, and a full accounting of the amount owed. 2. Debt Not Collectible Under CR Rules : Under federal law, debts sold to collection agencies may not be collectible unless the agency can legally demonstrate ownership and compliance with CR rules. Specifically : Credit Reporting Rules ( FCRA ) : Debts sold to collection agencies must include complete and accurate information about the debt, including its origin, the amount, and whether the statute of limitations has expired. Agencies must also notify credit bureaus if a debt is disputed. Debt Ownership : If the original creditor sold the debt, the collector must provide a clear chain of title proving their legal right to collect the debt. XXXX XXXX XXXX on behalf of Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC has not provided this. 3. Violation of My Rights : The debt in question appears to be unverified, unenforceable, and under applicable state law Attempting to collect this debt without validation is a violation of my consumer rights under the FDCPA and FCRA.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX filed an identity theft report through the FTC, ( XXXX ) I also included a police report ( XXXX ) cover letter of dispute. Copy of identification, validation documentation of my legal address and a lease agreement without signatures per leesee request. 

I sent these documents through US mail to all 3 major credit bereaus, I also uploaded the documentation, police report and FTC report to all 3 bereaus. 

I've actually uploaded the supporting documentation multiple times to all of the Bereaus, Equifax, XXXX and XXXX throughout the month of XXXX. 

Since uploading the original documentation plus a dispute letter outlining my rights through the resource pages on the FTC website I have uploaded additional documentation validating my residence outside of the US from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. 

The accts that were not blocked or deleted were disputed originally and again on XX/XX/XXXX when I uploaded the lease agreement to all 3 bereaus. 

Equifax and XXXX have platforms that provide multiple ways of disputing accts on my credit report and XXXX website is set up to navigate the user through a sales funnel for the paid membership that they offer users that require frequent credit reports and scores. 
Since beginning the repair journey I've logged over 26hours online and on chat plus phone calls to agents at XXXX. 
Nothing in that entire time has provided online access to my credit report. 
They continual share the same troubleshooting data that they have in script and that I have followed multiple times to get a copy of my report. 

I recently filed a dispute about the issues with XXXX  timeliness and less than attentive concern to address the inquiries and fraudulent accts that are still on my credit report. My request was to get results or answers to my original dispute and identity theft case filed early XXXX. 
XXXX has told me that the platform they use has technical issues and that they will be resolved within XXXX to 3 days of time however this is not true, I can not access my credit report through the XXXX platform. 

My request is that XXXX remove the hard inquiries from my credit report as they are fraudulent and numerous, I also request that they block the additional accts that I disputed with documentation on XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX with validating documentation that I included with all of my disputes. 

The complaint that I filed prevuousky through CFPB about XXXX barely touches the issues, delays and absence of action that XXXX has exampled throughout my effort to restore my good credit standing. The process has not been as stated in the Fair Credit Reporting Act and I want the hard inquiries and fraudulent accts blocked from my profile, and from potential credit opportunities. 
The response that I received after using this platform to express the problems that have been encountered do not hold this company accountable for the lack of action and the lack of progress despite following the FTC guidelines to restore my credit rating to pre identity theft condition. 
By allowing XXXX additional time after 30 days has passed is not providing me the consumer with anything that I wasn't already experiencing before addressing my issues to the CFPB. 

PLEASE make XXXX address the identity theft accts on my report, remove all of the fraudulent inquiries so I can begin to build a healthy FICO score. The opportunity that having good credit provides has been stolen from me and time is of the essence. I own a company and can not provide the basics of ownership to the people that XXXX employee. Getting funding of any amount to grow the company in order to hire more people is passing me by and the time, effort and energy that I have applied to just getting back to XXXX has been mountainous by any standard. 

My request is to not give this company any more of the most valuable commodity we have as humans, TIME. 
Please make this company do the right thing and remove the negative and fraudulent inquiries that plaque my credit profile immediately. 

Thank you so very much! 

With respect, consideration. 

Kindly XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am disputing a debt that was transferred and is being collected by NCB Management Services. I initially entered into a contract with XXXX, and my original account was under their terms and conditions. However, I have discovered that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is now listed as the entity involved in my account, but XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was never a part of my original agreement with XXXX.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent another request for verification, and again received a response, but without the requested proof.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I do not have the original dates of this debacle, but I am certain Portfolio Recovery Associates , LLC can provide an accurate timeline and related materials. 

My XXXX account was apparently hacked and charges were added to my account unknown to me. The hacker changed my contact address to another location that was nonexistent. When confronted with the newly added debt, I denied it as mine, but after months of contesting the ownership of this debt, it was taken over by XXXX XXXX and the war started all over again. I appealed the action, but was unsuccessful in my attempts to have this debt removed. 

I entered into a payment plan with XXXX XXXX and dutifully paid every month without any issues until this month when I was contacted via telephone by a person identifying themselves as a representative of XXXX XXXX. The representative informed me that the debit card I had provided them for the monthly charges had been denied in XXXX. I told the representative that she once again had incorrect information in reference to me. I use that debit card regularly and have not personally experienced any rejections. 

I told her I would not conduct any further communication with them other than through the post office, because I do have their address in XXXX, VA where I have mailed additional payments via checks to hasten the payoff on this sham action. She told me that because my card was rejected, she had no information on the account after that date. She requested another debit card and I refused. The last check I mailed them on XX/XX/XXXX has not been processed. That is very suspicious to me. 


I have requested all future correspondence be through the post office. I will not give them another debit card to enable them to falsely contact me. I would prefer they just erase the small balance that remains and leave me alone.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC has filed a court civil suit against me on a debt that has not been validated. I am submitting this complaint against Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC for their attempt to collect a debt they are not legally authorized to collect. Their actions are in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and applicable Credit Reporting ( CR ) rules outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Details of the Complaint : 1.Failure to Validate the Debt : This debt is required to be validated under the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ). the company has failed to provide proper validation, including proof that the debt is valid, that they own the debt or have the right to collect it, and a full accounting of the amount owed. 2. Debt Not Collectible Under CR Rules : Under federal law, debts sold to collection agencies may not be collectible unless the agency can legally demonstrate ownership and compliance with CR rules. Specifically : Credit Reporting Rules ( FCRA ) : Debts sold to collection agencies must include complete and accurate information about the debt, including its origin, the amount, and whether the statute of limitations has expired. Agencies must also notify credit bureaus if a debt is disputed. Debt Ownership : If the original creditor sold the debt, the collector must provide a clear chain of title proving their legal right to collect the debt. Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC has not provided this. 3. Violation of My Rights : The debt in question appears to be unverified, unenforceable, and possibly under applicable state law Attempting to collect this debt without validation is a violation of my consumer rights under the FDCPA and FCRA.

Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to urgently express my deep concern and frustration regarding a severe issue with my Robinhood account, which has been restricted for the past ten days. This situation is not just inconvenient ; it is causing me significant financial distress.

The company 's total lack of communication is alarming and has left me feeling trapped and powerless. I am in a perilous situation where I can not reach my own money, which is exacerbating my financial stress and uncertainty. 

Moreover, it appears that I am not alone in this plight. Many others are voicing similar complaints on social media, highlighting a concerning trend of inadequate customer support from Robinhood. This lack of accountability and transparency is completely unacceptable, and it raises questions about the companys practices and commitment to its customers. 

I urgently seek your assistance in this matter. My financial well-being is at stake, and I feel that immediate action is necessary to resolve my account restriction and address the troubling customer service issues prevalent at Robinhood. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this pressing issue. I sincerely hope to hear from you soon regarding the next steps in this process.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  MIDLAND CREDIT MANAG XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX Subject : Debt Validation Request To whom it may concern, I am writing in response to a communication I received regarding an alleged debt you claim I owe. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am requesting that you provide validation of this debt. Please provide the following information : The amount of the alleged debt. 
The name of the creditor to whom the debt is allegedly owed. 
A copy of the original signed contract or agreement that shows I am legally obligated to pay this debt. 
A detailed statement of the account, including a breakdown of the amount owed, interest, fees, and any other charges. 
Proof of your authorization to collect on this debt. 
I request that you provide the above documentation before any further action is taken on this matter. Please note that until you provide sufficient validation of this debt, I will not acknowledge its validity or make any payments. 
Additionally, please be advised that under the FDCPA, you are required to cease all collection efforts until you have provided the requested verification. If you are unable to provide proper documentation, I will expect that the debt be removed from my credit report and that no further collection activity takes place. 
Please send all correspondence regarding this matter to my address listed above. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Midland credit Managment account number : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Cease and Desist Request Alleged Debt Dear Midland Credit Managment , I, XXXX XXXX , am requesting that you cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt, pursuant to theFair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) ). Please confirm receipt of this letter and compliance within15 business days to avoid pre abirritation. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Can't use card to make purchases
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been an Amex Platinum cardholder since XXXX. During this time, I have maintained accounts with XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX, all of which I have used to make payments. I have consistently made various purchases and payments, keeping my account well. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I paid off my Amex card with an electronic payment of {$5400.00} from my XXXX ( also known as XXXX ) account. On the same day, I made a purchase of {$2900.00} at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for a bathroom vanity. Additionally, I made another payment of {$2500.00} from my XXXX account that day. I then attempted to use my card again for a {$1800.00} purchase at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, but my account was suspended. 
Concerned, I called Amex to find out why I could not use my account. An Amex representative informed me that the funds needed to be verified. I authorized a conference call with my bank, XXXX, but unfortunately, the call was disconnected, forcing me to use another credit card to complete my purchase at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to use my Amex card again, but it was declined. I made another attempt on XX/XX/XXXX, and once again, the card was declined. I then noticed on my mobile Amex app that my charging privileges were suspended and I was directed to call XXXX. 
During that call, a representative explained that my charging privileges were suspended because I needed to verify my demographics and the ownership of the account from which I made the payments. I asked for clarification and requested written policy on this requirement, but I was advised to refer to my membership agreement. When I inquired about the reason for this request and what prompted it, I was informed that it was due to the suspicious nature of the recent amounts paid to my account. 
I explained that the accounts from which I made the payments are mine and have been linked to my Amex card since I opened it. The representative informed me that I would need to provide certain information, including my demographics and bank statements, and that my bank would need to be contacted again to verify the {$2500.00} payment made. 
I requested to speak with a supervisor. After three unsuccessful attempts to reach a supervisor named XXXX ( XXXX ), I finally spoke with XXXX, an American Express Financial Review Supervisor, on XX/XX/XXXX. I explained the situation and again requested the policy information. XXXX reiterated that I needed to verify my information by providing bank statements, pay stubs, and that my bank would need to be contacted to verify the {$2500.00} payment. When I asked why this was necessary, she stated that some customers in the past had reported unauthorized payments made by a third party, and there were recent unusual charging patterns on my account. I clarified that I had made the payments and authorized the charge to XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  as well as the attempted charge of {$1800.00} at XXXX XXXX XXXX, which was declined without notice. I inquired whether there had been any history of fraud or suspicious activity on my account in the past. XXXX confirmed that my payments and charges had shown a great history since I opened the account and that there were no previous issues. 
Despite this, she explained that the review process required me to provide the requested documentation by XX/XX/XXXX, or my account would be canceled. I explained to her that I did not agree with it and it appears that I am being discriminated against and targeted since I paid the account off and made payments of over XXXX XXXX I asked XXXX had Amex had difficulty receiving the funds from that account in the past or currently. She stated no the funds were received and cleared.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing in response to your recent attempts to collect on an alleged debt. To date, the only documents I have received are billing statements, which do not provide sufficient proof that I owe this debt. You have not provided a valid, signed purchase agreement or original creditor documentation that establishes my legal responsibility for this account. 

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am formally requesting validation of this debt, which should include the following : 1. A copy of the original contract or purchase agreement with my signature that demonstrates I am legally obligated to repay this debt.

2. A full accounting of the debt, including how the amount claimed was calculated, itemized statements, and any interest or fees that have been applied to the account.

3. A detailed record of all payments, charges, and adjustments made to the account, including the original balance and the breakdown of how the current balance was reached.

4. Proof that your company has the legal right to collect on this debt, including all assignment or sale agreements that show the chain of ownership from the original creditor to your company. 

Additionally, I have reason to believe that this debt may have been charged off by the original creditor. Under IRS guidelines, canceled debts over {$600.00} require a 1099-C form to be issued. To date, I have not received this form, which raises questions about whether this debt has already been forgiven or canceled. Please provide confirmation of whether the original creditor has charged off this debt, and why I have not been issued a 1099-C form. 

Furthermore, I would like clarification regarding the statute of limitations for this debt. Please confirm that this debt is still within the legal statute of limitations for collection in my state. If the statute of limitations has expired, I request that all collection efforts cease immediately and that any reporting of this debt to the credit bureaus be removed. 

I also want to highlight the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which governs the accuracy of information reported to credit bureaus. If you are reporting this debt to any credit reporting agencies without providing proper validation, it constitutes a violation of the FCRA. Therefore, if you are unable to provide the requested validation of this debt, I demand that all references to this account be removed from my credit report immediately. 

If you are unable to provide sufficient validation as outlined in this letter, I request the following actions : 1. Cease all collection activities related to this account. 
2. Remove any references to this debt from my credit report with the major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). 
3. Provide written confirmation that this debt has been resolved and is no longer being pursued.

Failure to comply with these requests may result in my filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state attorney generals office, as well as pursuing other legal remedies available to me. 

Please respond within 30 days of receipt of this letter with full validation of the debt or confirmation that the debt has been canceled and removed from my credit reports.

Furthermore, I am disputing this debt and formally requesting a complete method of verification for this account. I am deeply concerned about the validity and accuracy of the information being reported. Specifically, I demand answers to the following : Details of Investigation : What evidence did your representatives uncover that led them to conclude this account is being reported accurately and legally? 
Certified Documents Reviewed : What certified documents were obtained to validate this account? Please provide copies.

Investigation Communication : Provide a complete copy of all information transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation.

Verification Costs : What were the costs incurred by your company to obtain documents necessary for this investigation?

Communication with Data Furnisher : Did your representatives directly communicate with the party reporting this information? If yes : a. Who was contacted? 
b. What was their role? 
c. When was the contact made? 
d. What was the nature and duration of the conversation?

Employee Competency : Provide details about the employee ( s ) involved in the investigation : a. Name and position. 
b. Length of employment with your company.

c. Training provided to them for handling disputes of this nature.

Documentation : Copies of all correspondence, emails, or communication related to the investigation.

Proof of the timely procurement of all required certified documents.

Delinquency Details : Provide the specific date the delinquency commenced and the expected date of cessation of reporting for this account. 
I also request that your response include a notarized affidavit attesting to the accuracy and completeness of the information provided. Note that any form-letter or template response will be deemed unacceptable, as my dispute is specific and demands a case-by-case review. 
If you can not provide ALL of the above information in a timely and complete manner as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related consumer protection laws, I demand the immediate permanent removal of this account from all records. 

Case Law Supporting This Dispute XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Established that debt collectors must adhere strictly to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), including rules around permissible communication and disputes. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Emphasizes the importance of accuracy and completeness in consumer reporting and the need for thorough investigation and validation when a consumer disputes information. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : Held that debt collectors must conduct meaningful investigations when disputes are raised, and failure to do so can result in liability under the FCRA. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ) : Affirmed the right of consumers to hold furnishers liable for failing to investigate disputes accurately and properly. 

Failure to comply with this notice will result in further action, including complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and potential legal action to enforce my rights under federal law. 
I trust you will handle this matter promptly and in compliance with the law.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On the morning of XX/XX/year>, my Bank of America credit card was stolen from my purse, probably when I was visiting with some friends at XXXX in XXXX, Maryland. I did not realize that my card had been stolen, until later in the day, when I checked my phone voice messages, and there was a message from Bank of America. Thinking it might be a scam ( it wasn't ) I looked up the phone number of B of A on my latest bill, and called that number. I learned from that call, that, unknown to me, my credit card had been used at a XXXX. I then checked my purse, and realized that my B of A credit card had, in fact, been stolen. 

Bank of America agreed to send me a new card, with a new account number, and I was left with the understanding that the {$100.00} charged on my stolen card, would be removed. But yesterday, I received a letter in the mail from Bank of America saying that B of A was " unable to approve '' my " recent claim. '' In other words, that {$100.00} charge will remain on my account. 

Once I had learned that my card was stolen, I alerted management at the XXXX where the theft of my card had occurred. I also alerted the XXXX XXXX Police Department, by filing a report, through their non-emergency phone number. 

I have no other problem with Bank of America. They were prompt in sending me the new card. But I want the {$100.00} charge that was incurred after my credit card was stolen, removed from my bill. I always pay my balance in full, but I am not willing to pay for a purchase made with my credit card, after it was stolen. 

I think that the fact that Bank of America called me after the purchase was made at Target, shows that B of A in fact had reason to believe that the purchase made was not by me, but rather on a card that had been stolen from me. I don't know what that reason might have been, but somehow they must have known that this was not a purchase by me, but rather by someone else with my stolen card.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to report a fraudulent scam involving an individual impersonating a representative from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Below are the details of the incident, the vulnerabilities I observed in XXXX XXXX and Cash Apps systems, and the efforts I made to resolve this matter with both companies. 

Incident Details : In early XXXX, I received a phone call from someone claiming to be from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. They informed me of suspicious transactions from Florida on my checking account and asked me to confirm my location. They also referenced my account balance, leading me to believe they had access to my sensitive banking information. 

The caller claimed my debit card was compromised and would be frozen but provided a temporary replacement debit card number. They instructed me to transfer {$1000.00} from my account to my Cash App and then to this new debit card to avoid disruption to my finances and pay my bills. Unfortunately, after completing the transfer, I realized I had been defrauded when the scammers hung up. 

Vulnerabilities Identified : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : The scammers knowledge of my account balance and transaction history indicates a potential breach or successful phishing scheme targeting XXXX XXXX customers. 
The caller convincingly posed as a XXXX XXXX representative, highlighting flaws in the verification process for customer interactions. 
Cash Apps Lack of Safeguards : The transfer of funds through Cash App to fraudulent recipients underscores a lack of robust security mechanisms to flag suspicious activity. 
Once the transfer was completed, I found limited options for recourse or recovery of the funds, leaving victims without adequate protection. 
Efforts Made to Resolve the Issue : Following the incident, I promptly filed an investigation with both XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Cash App. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX informed me they have XXXX liability for actions taken by account holders, even in cases of social engineering scams. They disregarded the fraudulent context and did not acknowledge the role of potential vulnerabilities in their systems. 
Cash App Response : I filed a report with Cash App seeking assistance in recovering the transferred funds. However, the platforms limited options for investigating fraud left me without resolution or recourse. 
Request for Investigation and Support : This fraudulent activity has caused financial and emotional hardship, and I am concerned about the systemic vulnerabilities in both XXXX XXXX and Cash App that facilitated this scam. I respectfully request the FTC investigate these issues and take steps to ensure these companies improve their security measures and customer protections. 

Additionally, I would appreciate any guidance on recovering my lost funds and protecting myself from similar scams in the future. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I am available to provide further details or documentation as needed. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> at XXXX XXXX, using Coinbase, I sold all of the shares of the cryptocurrency XXXX  by XXXX  ( Transaction reference code XXXX ). The subtotal for what I received for selling my XXXX  was {$360.00}, with an actual total of {$350.00}, and it was transferred out of XXXX  and to my Coinbase account. 

My Coinbase account was set up with a previous phone number of mine that I no longer have access to, and in order to withdraw the {$350.00} from my Coinbase account and put it into my XXXX XXXX  account, I have to verify my identity with an SMS verification code that can only be sent to this old phone number. I reached out to customer support to verify my identity with pictures of my drivers license and pictures of my face. I was told that it would take only XXXX minutes to verify, and that I would receive an email with the verification results. As of XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>, I have not yet received an email to continue the verification process. Online, Coinbase claims a wait time of up to 24 hours ; yet I still have no response. No human can be reached, nothing has been done to help my case no matter how many times I reach out for help, and I can not get my money from them because they will not help me.

I have reached out to customer service, and keep getting put in an endless loop of a robot telling me to wait for a representative, and then the cycle repeating OR they drop my case when the estimated wait time runs out. There is no way I can call a human agent through this service because of the old phone number linked to my account, and the automated service is not handling my case. The conversation below was with their customer service AI. After reading about this exact same issue and mistreatment from numerous other Coinbase users, I decided to file a complaint with the CFPB in order to get Coinbase to handle my case, and allow me to retrieve the money from my account. Included are photos of my drivers license and face in order to prove my identity and ownership of the account.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing in response to your recent attempts to collect on an alleged debt. To date, the only documents I have received are billing statements, which do not provide sufficient proof that I owe this debt. You have not provided a valid, signed purchase agreement or original creditor documentation that establishes my legal responsibility for this account. 

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am formally requesting validation of this debt, which should include the following : 1. A copy of the original contract or purchase agreement with my signature that demonstrates I am legally obligated to repay this debt.

2. A full accounting of the debt, including how the amount claimed was calculated, itemized statements, and any interest or fees that have been applied to the account.

3. A detailed record of all payments, charges, and adjustments made to the account, including the original balance and the breakdown of how the current balance was reached.

4. Proof that your company has the legal right to collect on this debt, including all assignment or sale agreements that show the chain of ownership from the original creditor to your company. 

Additionally, I have reason to believe that this debt may have been charged off by the original creditor. Under IRS guidelines, canceled debts over {$600.00} require a 1099-C form to be issued. To date, I have not received this form, which raises questions about whether this debt has already been forgiven or canceled. Please provide confirmation of whether the original creditor has charged off this debt, and why I have not been issued a 1099-C form. 

Furthermore, I would like clarification regarding the statute of limitations for this debt. Please confirm that this debt is still within the legal statute of limitations for collection in my state. If the statute of limitations has expired, I request that all collection efforts cease immediately and that any reporting of this debt to the credit bureaus be removed. 

I also want to highlight the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which governs the accuracy of information reported to credit bureaus. If you are reporting this debt to any credit reporting agencies without providing proper validation, it constitutes a violation of the FCRA. Therefore, if you are unable to provide the requested validation of this debt, I demand that all references to this account be removed from my credit report immediately. 

If you are unable to provide sufficient validation as outlined in this letter, I request the following actions : 1. Cease all collection activities related to this account.

2. Remove any references to this debt from my credit report with the major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). 
3. Provide written confirmation that this debt has been resolved and is no longer being pursued.

Failure to comply with these requests may result in my filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state attorney generals office, as well as pursuing other legal remedies available to me. 

Please respond within 30 days of receipt of this letter with full validation of the debt or confirmation that the debt has been canceled and removed from my credit reports.

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : A Warning Regarding My Experience with NVR Mortgage and XXXX XXXX I want to share an experience I had with NVR Mortgage, which is associated with XXXX XXXX, to provide insight for anyone considering working with them. 

Recently, while pursuing the purchase of a home in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC, I encountered a concerning situation. The lending XXXX assigned to my case, XXXX, expressed interest in purchasing a home in the same community. This led to significant delays in my application process, ultimately leaving me feeling disregarded as a prospective buyer. 

Timeline of Events : Initial Visit to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX : My family and I visited the XXXX XXXX community to view the XXXX and XXXX models. We decided to pursue the XXXX home, with a completion date set for XX/XX/XXXX. During our meeting with XXXX, the on-site agent, she mentioned that XXXX, the XXXX lending officer, had expressed interest in the community and had recently ( same day as our meeting ) been in contact with her. Although this raised initial concerns, I was assured by XXXX. of XXXX professionalism. 

Delayed Communication : After reconnecting with XXXX. in XX/XX/XXXX to express interest in the XXXX XXXX XXXX, I experienced multiple delays in communication. My initial email was not acknowledged until five days later, at which point I was provided the wrong application link. Even after submitting the correct application, follow-ups with A.R. were sporadic. 

Concerns About Conflict of Interest : During a conversation to discuss numbers ( rate, mortgage, etc. ) with XXXX, he disclosed that he was personally interested in a home within XXXX XXXX, though he assured me it was not the XXXX model I was pursuing. Despite this reassurance, the process became increasingly opaque. 

Unanswered Questions and XXXX XXXX : Communication with both XXXX. and XXXX. abruptly ceased on XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed on the XXXX XXXX website that the XXXX home was no longer available and that the community had been closed. Neither A.R. nor XXXX. provided any update or explanation. 

Reflection on the Process : As a first-time homebuyer, this experience has been deeply frustrating and disappointing. The lack of transparency, professionalism, and accountability, combined with the potential conflict of interest, has left me questioning the integrity of NVR Mortgage and their affiliated agents. 

Why XXXX Sharing This : This account is not only a reflection of my personal experience but also a warning for others considering NVR Mortgage or XXXX XXXX. I urge potential buyers to approach with caution, ask thorough questions, and ensure that conflicts of interest are addressed upfront. 

While I am considering reporting this matter to the appropriate licensing authorities, I also hope that NVR Mortgage and XXXX XXXX take steps to ensure more ethical practices moving forward. First-time homebuyers deserve respect, transparency, and fairness throughout the process. 

Sincerely, V

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Debt Validation Letter Collection Agency Name Address City, State Zip To Whom It May Concern : Debt Validation Pursuant to 12 CFR 1006.34C This notice is to inform you that you have unlawfully reported an alleged debt to my consumer report. Under the New Rule REGULATION F which took effect XX/XX/year>, You { XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Put correct name here } You have violated the FDCPA 1006.30a and its new rule by parking this alleged debt on my consumer reports. Cease and Desist the reporting of this alleged Debt immediately or I will escalate this matter to taking legal action.

I have not given you written permission to put anything on my credit profile 15 USC 1681b2. 

You have no permissible purpose by law to contact third parties with my private or personal information. Your offenses amount to Aggravated Identity Theft pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1028A. You have knowingly transferred, possessed, or used, without lawful authority, a means of identification of me, which is a felony punishable with up to 2 years of imprisonment, in addition to civil liability.

I AM A LITIGIOUS CONSUMER I WILL NOT HESITATE TO TAKE LEGAL ACTION AGAINST { XXXX XXXX Put name of collections company here } 15 USC 1692c ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt. 

I refuse to pay this alleged debt. Cease and desist all collections activity regarding this alleged debt and PROMPTLY Delete it from all consumer reporting agencies that you have reported this inaccurate, incomplete, erroneous and misleading information to at once. 
The reporting of such inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, my reputation, my general mode of living and my ability to obtain credit for personal and house purposes. 
You and your inaccurate reporting have damaged my livelihood. 

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) Prohibition ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. 
Prohibition : a law or regulation forbidding something 15 USC 1681 s-2 Says you { XXXX XXXX  XXXX } are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency. 
You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information 15 USC 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) Prohibition ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

In conclusion I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. The information is, in fact, inaccurate.

The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of the Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information.

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is a final opportunity to Cure and DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report. 

YOU HAVE 10 Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS! or I will take legal action for consumer law violation under 15 USC 1681 n, 15 USC 1681 o and 15 USC 1692k. 
DELETE THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT/S FROM YOUR RECORDS AND ALL CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCIES. 
Account name Acct # : ( List accounts here ) Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above referenced account, and send out a free copy of my report after the changes have been made will result in legal actions being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation of Character ( per se ) 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Fair Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC 1692g violations.

4. Fair Credit Reporting Act 15USC 1681 violations for willful noncompliance - 616. Civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] Thank you,

Consumer complaint narrative:
The complainant ( XXXX ) drafted a Billing Error Notices Pursuant to Account XXXX to Kia Finance America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX in which was delivered on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, additionally, XXXX also provided within the referenced separate billing error notices, Notices of Defaults, in which included the necessary data of notice and discovery of which Kia Finance America would have knowledge or come to discover that XXXX XXXX a tender of payment before Kia Finance America indenture trustee XXXX XXXX XXXX including the date such payment was delivered associated with XXXX 's account with Kia Finance America. Pursuant to 12 CFR 1026.13 - Billing error resolution ( c ) Time for resolution ; general procedures. ( 1 ) The creditor shall mail or deliver written acknowledgment to the consumer within 30 days of receiving a billing error notice, unless the creditor has complied with the appropriate resolution procedures of paragraphs ( e ) ( Procedures if billing error occurred as asserted. If a creditor determines that a billing error occurred as asserted, it shall within the time limits in paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) of this section : ( 1 ) Correct the billing error and credit the consumer 's account with any disputed amount and related finance or other charges, as applicable; and ( 2 ) Mail or deliver a correction notice to the consumer. ). and ( f ) ( Procedures if different billing error or no billing error occurred. If, after conducting a reasonable investigation, a creditor determines that no billing error occurred or that a different billing error occurred from that asserted, the creditor shall within the time limits in paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) of this section : ( 1 ) Mail or deliver to the consumer an explanation that sets forth the reasons for the creditor 's belief that the billing error alleged by the consumer is incorrect in whole or in part ; ( 2 ) Furnish copies of documentary evidence of the consumer 's indebtedness, if the consumer so requests ; and ( 3 ) If a different billing error occurred, correct the billing error and credit the consumer 's account with any disputed amount and related finance or other charges, as applicable. of this section, as applicable, within the 30-day period; and ( 2 ) The creditor shall comply with the appropriate resolution procedures of paragraphs ( e ) and ( f ) of this section, as applicable, within 2 complete billing cycles ( but in no event later than 90 days ) after receiving a billing error notice.

Pursuant to the statute rule 12 CFR 1026.13 ( 3 ) Acceleration of debt and restriction of account prohibited. A creditor shall not accelerate any part of the consumer 's indebtedness or restrict or close a consumer 's account solely because the consumer has exercised in good faith rights provided by this section. A creditor may be subject to the forfeiture penalty under 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( e ) ( Any creditor who fails to comply with the requirements of this section or section 1666a of this title forfeits any right to collect from the obligor the amount indicated by the obligor under paragraph ( 2 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, and any finance charges thereon, except that the amount required to be forfeited under this subsection may not exceed {$50.00}. ) for failure to comply with any of the requirements of this section. A tender of payment was delivered before Kia Finance America indenture trustee for XXXX XXXX. in which was to discharge the debt and to crediting XXXXXXXX XXXX account for past, current and future related payments to her principal account per the expiration of the underlying contract between XXXX and Kia Finance America. see 12 CFR 1026.13 ( 4 ) A reflection on a periodic statement of the creditor 's failure to credit properly a payment or other credit issued to the consumer 's account. The references of Kia Finance America indenture trustee is located on the U.S. Security & Exchange Commission Board XXXX 8k and 10k filings, which also includes the mailing address in which the tender of payment was delivered to be [ ing ] an accurate address in which the billing error notice & notice of default was sent to. After such expiration of dates, Kia Finance America continued to request payments from XXXX and reported such failure of payment before the credit reporting agencies affecting XXXXXXXX XXXX credit score report.

The primary such requirement, at issue in this case, is that if a creditor receives written notice from a consumer that indicates [ his ] belief that [ his ] statement contains a billing error within 60 days after the creditor transmitted that statement, the creditor must comply with two separate obligations. ( citing 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) ). First, within 30 days of receiving that written notice, it must acknowledge receipt to the consumer in writing. 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) ( 3 ) ( A ). Second, within two billing cycles and in no event later than ninety days after the consumer files his written dispute, it must either ( 1 ) make appropriate corrections to the consumers account, including the crediting of any finance charges on amounts erroneously billed, or ( 2 ) conduct [ ] an investigation into the dispute and send a written explanation to the consumer setting forth to the extent applicable the reasons why the creditor believes the account... was correctly shown in the statement. Id. 1666 ( a ) ( 3 ) ( B ) ( i ) ( ii ). The creditor must take these steps before making any attempt to collect the disputed amount. Kia Finance America was given NOTICES and did not comply with such obligations and must be subject to the forfeiture penalty under 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( e ) for failure to comply with any of the requirements of this section.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report regarding an account with XXXX XXXX. This account is improperly reported despite having GAP insurance coverage at the time of the loan termination. Additionally, this account was sold to another party, who is currently contacting me about additional money needed for a car that was totaled and resulted in a fire. This raises questions about the legitimacy of the debt and its continued reporting under applicable laws. 

Under 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information and demand an investigation. The continued reporting of this account, especially in light of the existence of GAP insurance and the sale of the debt, constitutes a violation of my rights under the FCRA. I request a thorough investigation to verify the accuracy of this entry and its compliance with legal standards. 

Furthermore, per 15 USC 1692g ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ), I am requesting validation of this debt, including the original contract, debt to contract request, proof of the amount claimed, and evidence of the debts transfer of ownership. As of now, I believe the reporting of this account violates my rights under the FDCPA. 

Additionally, I want to emphasize that continued attempts to collect on or report this account without proper validation may constitute violations of : 15 USC 1692e, prohibiting false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. 

15 USC 1681s-2, which holds furnishers accountable for reporting only accurate information to credit reporting agencies. 

I am requesting the following actions to be taken immediately : 1. Cease reporting this account on my credit report until the investigation is complete and validation has been provided.

2. Provide me with documentation substantiating the validity and legality of the debt and confirming compliance with GAP insurance coverage.

3. Remove this account from my credit report if it is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable.

4. Remove any late payments this account accused during the insurance cash out process. 

Please note that under the FCRA, you are required to respond to this dispute within 30 days. I expect written confirmation of your findings and any actions taken. If no response is received, or if the information is not properly corrected, I reserve the right to escalate this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and/or pursue legal remedies. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a complaint with Citibank. I have been with Citibank for several years now and have nothing if not outstanding accounts with this bank. I have two credit cards, both with very high limits as earned through loyalty, personal credit, and history with the bank. I always pay my credit cards in-full and on time each month. The checking accounts I had are closed now as you will see below, but they were open and with good standing as well until the past few months due to ongoing disputes with the bank. 

Last XXXX, XXXX, I sought a large personal loan of $ XXXX. As you can imagine, it is not easy to find a lender willing to give this amount of money. Through searching over months, I was able to locate a lender in XXXX. This lender is the XXXX  XXXX XXXX, which is the largest, and basically only bank in XXXX. This lender agreed to lend me the $ XXXX once all due diligences were paid. I first worked with the attorney of this transaction who secured from me roughly {$20000.00}. I then moved to the next step of due diligence on the loan which was roughly {$140000.00}. Ultimately, this turned out to be a scam. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX is very real, but the impersonators offering the loan, unfortunately, are not. 

Before I paid any funds to the scam, I confirmed two things. One, I contacted a due diligence partner in XXXX who confirmed that everything looked legitimate from their offerings. I do not know this company other than they were recommended to me by a partner of mine in the XXXX. The second, and most important thing I did, was contact Citibank. I explained my concerns to them that in the case this is a scam, I need recourse. I suggested making payment through XXXX and let the funds hit my credit card or through my checking account, letting the funds hit my debit card. I was told on the phone, multiple times, that YES, if this funds hit a CARD, regardless which one, this would be traceable and I would be able to dispute the funds should an issue arise and receive full credit with documentation. 

Of course, making roughly {>= $1,000,000} in payments with credit card and debit card limits took several months. I paid the lenders diligently as you will see in the emails attached. Each day they asked me where to send the funds and for what amount as well as confirming the funds were received. Overall, this was over XXXX transactions to get these funds to the lender, but only a few XXXX accounts received the funds, as you will see in the emails attached. 

The moment I realized finally that this was a scam, I contacted Citibank. I filed all disputes on my credit cards online and called in for my checking account and spoke with a representative for almost two hours.

Once the disputes were filed, I sent all required information in. Citibank asked me to send as much documentation showing this was scam. There are roughly XXXX pages attached to this complaint, and all of these were sent to Citibank for all of the associated disputes. To date, I have received some of the funds back, several XXXX. But Citibank refuses to send the remaining amounts. Once I started getting letters on these disputes saying they could not get the funds back, I called Citibank. I was told that what I was missing is a slip saying the XXXX lender owed the funds back. I explained that I have sent the form showing that this lender in XXXX stated if I did not receive my funds, they would refund all of the {$160000.00}. This person was very patient and took time to review the file ( possibly the only person who reviewed the file ) and we found that the refund forms did not come through as they are yellow. So, I copied them on to white, resent, and the representative confirmed they came through. 

At this point, I thought nothing else could stand in the way of getting back the funds I was rightly owed. I received a few more refunds in my favor, was denied others, and others are still open. I called in again, and I was told that the person on the phone can only tell me that the case was denied, and some were approved. Each case has its own reviewer. I dont understand why this is done this way. Why would over XXXX cases have a different reviewer of XXXX pages? This seems like a large and inefficient process when ONE person could review and make a decision. The person on the phone told me that yes, the information I sent worked and I was awarded the funds back. So my question is, how is the information I sent enough for one or several of the disputes to be won in my favor, but not enough on the others? The charges are all the same, each person I was asked to pay is outlined in the emails. So, again, how could it work for one and not all if there is enough information? I do not think the denied cases took time to review my XXXX pages of detailed documentation showing this was a scam. For those who did review, I am appreciative, and again, that should apply to ALL cases. 

I have called Citibank several times to follow up and they tell me a different excuse each time. Either they say I will have an answer in 5 days and nothing comes. Or they say the case was denied and I received a letter which never came. The disputes are still open. I think Citibank is purposefully withholding these funds because of the amount although I confirmed with them that they would be able to get my funds back and you also can see they have allowed some of them back. Again, if they have enough documentation for some, they have enough for all disputes. 

An additional note - These charges were all given back as temporary charges and then removed as I understand how a dispute works. Except in the cases where these disputes were approved, all funds were charged back to me. In one instance, one of the charges caused my checking account to be withdrawn by {$2200.00}. I received a call from Citibank asking for the funds and I explained the full scenario. They were very pleasant on the phone and apologized and noted the file that I was working with the dispute department. About a month later, I started receiving calls again so I called them back. They noted the file again and stated all was well. A couple of days later the accounts were closed. Citibank closed my accounts and charged the accounts off after agreeing that they would not. 

In addition to my funds fully returned. I would like my accounts reinstated. 

Below is the latest email sent to Citi - Amount in Dispute - Total {$160000.00}, each transaction is {$4100.00} or {$3000.00} or {$2900.00} Name of Merchant - There are multiple merchants, including ( and most likely ) but not limited to XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX. 

Please give a detailed explanation of the reason you are disputing this transaction - This information has all been emailed, over XXXX pages. However, I understand there are XXXX pages that can not be read and these are the confirmation pages stating they will refund my full {$160.00}. The first XXXX pages are the first time I asked for a guarantee and that amount was {$120000.00}. Therefore, I continued to send as requested. I once again asked for guarantee which is also attached here of ALL FUNDS paid of {$160000.00}. XXXX introduced me to XXXX XXXX XXXX who was supposedly approving and securing a loan for me through the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX ) and the XXXX  which is XXXX of the largest lenders in XXXX. You will see in the email threads that I was asked to pay over {$160000.00}. I contacted Citi and asked the process for filing disputes against this vendor if needed which is why I chose to pay these through XXXX- to protect myself. In the previously sent documents, you will also see every single XXXX account I was asked to send money to, on which dates, and their confirmation of receiving the funds which correlates with the disputes you have received on these accounts. 

I have attached, again, the confirmation letter stating they would refund the full {$160000.00} to me. And they did not do so. 

Furthermore, please note that XXXX other disputes belonging to this same transaction of {$160000.00} have already been refunded in my favor. This a very large amount of money to be without, so I appreciate your haste and attention!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have nearly PAID OFF a XXXX fixed rate MORTGAGE for a property that I purchased in XXXX. My mortgage is currently serviced by MR COOPER. 

I am XXXX AHEAD of the mortgage payment schedule. It was very important to me to pay off the mortgage EARLY as I am now a XXXX XXXX and this is the only property that I own, and I this is the home where I live. I am the only owner of the property. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I logged on to the Mr Cooper website to make a payment, and the MONTHLY PAYMENT schedule listed the AMOUNT DUE as {$1300.00}. My account overview lists the INTEREST BEARING PRINCIPAL BALANCE as {$1200.00}, less than the monthly loan amount set by Mr Cooper. 

When I tried to make a payment for XX/XX/XXXX, the website instructed me to make the payment for LESS THAN {$1100.00}. I made a " partial payment '' of {$1000.00}. on XXXX. Mr Cooper HAS NOT APPLIED this payment to my mortgage balance, so my principal balance remains the same, and Mr Cooper has not subtracted the partial payment I made of {$1000.00} from my principal balance. 

Furthermore, I was charged a LATE PAYMENT fee of {$24.00}. 

I have repeatedly called Mr Cooper to try to rectify this accounting error, but have only encountered artificial intelligence. Do any HUMAN BEINGS work at Mr Cooper? 

Additionally, I am getting automated phone messages from Mr Cooper telling me that my mortgage payments are overdue ( I am XXXX ahead of schedule! ) and that they are a debt collector. 

A XXXX billing from Mr Cooper has added on an additional month 's payment due, now RAISING the amount they are billing me to {$2500.00}. Their records indicate that my INTEREST BEARING PRINCIPAL BALANCE is still {$1200.00}, as they have not yet applied the partial payment of {$1000.00}. I made on XX/XX/XXXX. 

XXXX. I need Mr Cooper to apply the {$1000.00} payment I made on XXXX, subtracting it from the principal balance. 
XXXX. I refuse to pay a " late payment fee '' of {$24.00}. 
XXXX. I refuse to pay Mr Cooper for amounts beyond the principal balance! 

THANK YOU! 
I appreciate your efforts!
