Product: Credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, Home Depot dispatched its trusted service provider, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, to my residence to provide a quote for the installation of a XXXX privacy fence. During this meeting, XXXX XXXX presented me with an affordable financing option, namely the Home Depot Consumer Credit Card. I applied for and was approved for the credit card the same day, with a credit limit of over {$5000.00}, intending to finance the fence project. At no point during the consultation, nor within the contract I signed, was I informed that a 60 % cancellation fee would apply after the expiration of a three-day grace period. The amount of this fee totals {$3500.00}. 



On XX/XX/year>, I contacted XXXX XXXX of THD XXXX to inquire about the status of the fence permit and was advised that the permit was under review. 



On XX/XX/year>, I sent an email to XXXX, inquiring about the possibility of canceling the installation. 



On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX, Director of Operations at THD XXXX, responded to my inquiry, acknowledging my desire to understand the cancellation process. 



XXXX XXXX explained that cancellation at this stage would incur a fee of {$3500.00}, as certain processes, such as the submission of permit documents, the engagement of a permit runner, and the preparation of surveys and engineered drawings, had already begun. Furthermore, XXXX XXXX informed me that the city does not allow the installation of a privacy fence in the front yard of my property, and only wind-flow fencing no higher than XXXX feet tall would be permitted. She offered to provide a revised quote for this alternative fencing option, and mentioned a promotional 5 % discount. However, she reiterated that cancellation at this stage would result in a {$3500.00} fee, which would be charged under the permitting stage. 



As of XX/XX/year>, the city in which I reside has not granted the permit for the XXXX privacy fence I originally requested, and no materials have been purchased for the installation of the fence. Not even a nail. 



While I understand that my desired fence style is not permitted by the city, I find it unacceptable that Home Depots trusted service provider, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, is forcing me to either accept a different fence style that I do not want or pay a {$3500.00} cancellation fee. Both options are unreasonable and inequitable. 



Home Depot and THD fencing have been installing fences in XXXX for years. I on the other hand, have been living in XXXX for only 4 months. I trusted Home Depots expertise in choosing a reputable XXXX for my fencing needs in the XXXX XXXX area. I have family who worked for Home Depot for years, rave about how great of a company it is. And now, I deeply regret this decision and feel like the attorney general should investigate how Home Depot is taking advantage of customers by allowing third parties such as THD XXXX, to scam American homeowners out of their money. 



XXXX said she looked online and saw that our fence style is not permitted. If she simply looked online to find this important information, how does looking something up online cost XXXX. If this information is so easily accessible, why didnt Home Depot explain this to me the day they initially sent THD fencing to my home? Why am I as a consumer, given merely 3 days to cancel or a XXXX cancellation penalty for alleged permit runners and engineers? The fence was for a town home in XXXX XXXX not the XXXX XXXX. What kind of fence permit process totals XXXX? 



I respectfully requested that Home Depot intervene in this matter and instruct its service provider to reduce the cancellation fee to a more reasonable amount, preferably below 5 % of the total project cost. Furthermore, I requested that any charges made to my Home Depot Consumer Credit Card in connection with this project be reversed. The order number associated with the fence installation is XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ), and the last four digits of my Consumer Citi Bank Credit Card are XXXX. As of XX/XX/year> they reduced the cancellation fee to XXXX. This is still crippling, deceptive, and unreasonable. 
I am paying a XXXX cancellation fee on a citi bank credit card. As a consumer this fee is highly over inflated. The extreme cancellation fee wasnt even in the contract I signed with Home Depot. The penalty fee was very vague. This company did not do XXXX worth of work. Taking measurements of a townhouse yard and filing permit paperwork doesnt cost XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified several discrepancies regarding my GM Financial account : Limit Discrepancy : The limit is listed as " {$0.00} '' across all bureaus, which could be an error. Typically, an account such as this should have a reported limit or balance, and " {$0.00} '' does not provide accurate information about the account 's status. 
Past Due Information : XXXX and XXXX both report Past Due 30 Days as " XXXX '', while XXXX shows the same. However, Past Due 60 and 90 Days are reported as " XXXX  '' across all bureaus, indicating no overdue payments in those periods. Activity Dates : There are inconsistencies in the last activity dates : XXXX reports XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX reports XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX reports XX/XX/XXXX. These discrepancies in reported activity dates may indicate outdated or incorrect information. Last Verified and Reported Dates : The " Last Verified '' fields are blank for XXXX and XXXX, while XXXX reports it as XX/XX/XXXX. The " Last Reported '' dates also vary across bureaus, with XXXX showing XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX and XXXX show XX/XX/XXXX. 
Date of Last Payment : XXXX and XXXX report the " Date of Last Payment '' as blank, while XXXX reports it as XX/XX/XXXX. This inconsistency could impact the accuracy of the accounts history.These discrepancies in limit reporting, payment status, activity dates, and verification information raise concerns about the accuracy and consistency of the reporting across the bureaus. I am requesting that you provide verifiable proof of this account 's information or promptly update the account to reflect accurate and consistent reporting across all bureaus. If no documentation can be provided to support these entries, I expect the account to be corrected and updated accordingly.

Consumer complaint narrative: I spent over 2 hours on the phone with an agent of Coinbase. He would have contradicting information and refused to give any information I asked for except for their decision was final and he is not reversing or refunding anything. He stated he looked into all my cases yet when I asked him to look into a specific case number, he all of a sudden was not able to view that case. He stated I had plenty of time to resolve a chargeback or negative balance because I have up to 3 business days to do so but when I asked what notice and where my grace period was he would not answer the question. Its very odd that Coinbase stated my account just so happen to have the exact amount down to the XXXX needed to cover a negative balance I didnt know I had at the time - and depleted all my wallets to XXXX. Mainly XXXX. When I gave specific transaction numbers and case numbers, the agent refused to look into it and said he already has but then later said he couldnt look at that case. When asked to speak with a supervisor he stated I can not. When I caught him in lies, he backtracks and denies it. After 2 hours of going back and forth, when giving him specific numbers from information in my Coinbase account or specific emails from Coinbase, he refused to listen to them and talked over me. When I questioned the numbers at the end of the call, he made up that there was interest charged to make up the discrepancies im pointing out. After that he started retaliating and started giving me warnings for my language. Im sure the calls are recorded and I did not use profanity or inappropriate language a single time during the call. He went instantly from the first warning to a final warning when I questioned him about the warnings and the purpose and reason behind them, said he is going to start an investigation on my account and flag my account ( for what, I dont know ) and hung up on me. They offered no help or seemed to really care about any discrepancies on records from my account and their end.

Under this law, you must stop contacting me except to confirm the cessation of collection efforts or to notify me of legal action. 
I also remind you of your obligations under15 U.S.C. 1692to avoid any unfair, deceptive, or abusive practices. Failure to comply with this request may result in complaints to theConsumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or legal action.

2. You are instructed to stop all communication with me immediately. ( that includes credit reporting ) The only communications I will accept moving forward are : Written confirmation that you have ceased collection efforts. 
Notification of any legal actions you intend to take. 
Please confirm receipt of this letter and compliance within15 business days. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Indicated you were committing crime by not paying debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Customer Resolutions Unit, Thank you for your response to my recent complaint submitted to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding the student loan account serviced by your company on behalf of the U.S. Department of Education. I appreciate your acknowledgment of my concerns and the detailed information you provided. 

However, after reviewing your response and the enclosed copy of my Master Promissory Note ( MPN ), I must address several points that remain unresolved or inadequately addressed : Legal Authority and Loan Discharge Eligibility You stated that my loans are governed by the Higher Education Act of 1965 ( HEA ), as amended, and that I am obligated to repay in full unless eligible for discharge under a specific provision. However : Please provide a comprehensive list of all discharge provisions applicable to loans issued under Part [ B/D ], Title IV of the HEA.

Explain how these provisions specifically apply to my current circumstances.

Additionally, while referencing my Master Promissory Note ( MPN ), your response did not establish sufficient grounds to validate the debt as required by 15 U.S.C. 1692g.

Debt Validation Requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1692g Your response failed to address my explicit request for debt validation as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Specifically, you did not : Provide clear documentation demonstrating the original creditor 's claim or unbroken chain of servicing rights.

Verify the debt with an itemized breakdown of the balance, including principal, interest, and fees.

Offer certified evidence supporting the legitimacy of the debt and your authority to service it.

Until full validation is provided, continued collection activity or reporting of this debt may constitute a violation of federal law.

Clarification of Compliance with Consumer Protection Laws As a federal loan servicer, you are required to comply with all provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, alongside the HEA.

Please confirm that your servicing practices meet these requirements.

If any discrepancies or violations have occurred, I request immediate rectification and documentation of corrective actions. 
Income-Driven Repayment ( XXXX ) Application Status Your letter referenced processing delays related to the XXXX XXXX and XXXX applications. I request the following clarifications : Has my account been placed into forbearance due to these delays? 
How does this affect my loan balance, accrued interest, and potential eligibility for future discharge or forgiveness? 
Ombudsman Escalation Process While I acknowledge the option to escalate to the Ombudsman Group, I am seeking resolution directly from your office at this stage. Please confirm your willingness to address my concerns fully before escalation becomes necessary. 

Payment and Plan Adjustments Your letter suggested alternative repayment plans, but I request additional clarification : Provide the exact steps to transition to an XXXX  plan under current forbearance conditions. 
Include a timeline for processing and implementation once an application is submitted. 
Additional Information Requested As outlined in my initial letter, I request the following : A complete copy of my consumer file related to this account. 
A certified copy of the original agreement between myself and the lender, with supporting documentation from the Department of Education verifying your authority to service the loan. 
A notarized affidavit certifying the accuracy of the information being reported. 
Tender of Payment and UCC 3-603 In your response, you stated that I am obligated to pay the loan in " legal U.S. tender. '' It is important to highlight the provisions of UCC 3-603, which govern the tender of payment : Tender and Discharge of Obligations : If I tender payment of my obligation and it is refused by the person entitled to enforce the instrument, the obligation is discharged to the extent of the amount tendered.

Discharge of Interest : If I tender the amount due on the loan, the obligation to pay interest on the tendered amount after the due date is discharged.

Presentment Requirements : As the obligor, if I am ready and able to pay at the due date but payment is refused, I am deemed to have tendered payment.

This raises critical questions : If a tender of payment were made, would you accept or refuse it?

What specific actions have you taken to ensure compliance with UCC provisions regarding tender and discharge?

I request that you clarify your stance on this matter and provide documentation showing compliance with UCC 3-603 in handling payment obligations.

Next Steps This letter serves as both a rebuttal to your prior response and a formal reiteration of my original request. Please ensure that all requested documentation and explanations are provided within XXXX  days of receipt of this letter. Failure to comply with these requirements may result in formal disputes, additional complaints to the CFPB, and potential legal action to enforce my rights under federal law. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely and comprehensive response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Approximately two years ago, I opened a {$10000.00} CD account with CIT Bank, XXXX, CA in response to an internet ad. All communications with CIT have been over the internet or by telephone. 

Communicating with CIT is difficult. My experience is that it can take up to an hour to reach CIT personnel by telephone.

Internet communication is, also, difficult. In addition to entering a User ID and Password ( both of which are stored in my computer ), upon entry of the foregoing, CIT requires that I authorize a text to me of a Code to ( presumably ) a telephone number maintained by it.

The telephone number that CIT has on-file was not supplied by me and has no relation to me.

This incorrect number has been on file since the account was first opened and CIT has refused numerous requests from me that my correct telephone number ( XXXX ) be inserted in its records. 

The result is that it is not practical for me to monitor the content of my account - getting access requires at least one telephone call to CIT ( which can take up to an hour ) and undergoing a cumbersome telephone number resetting.

CIT routinely sends communications - other than those dealing with renewals - to me by email.

Communications regarding renewals are, according to CIT, archived in my on-line account, which I can not readily access. 

Over a year ago, I informed CIT in writing not to renew my CD because their renewal rates were not attractive.

CIT now refuses to send the entire proceeds of my account to me.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX I had XXXX flood events at my house resulting in insurance claims. 
in XXXX I had a XXXX flood event, which hit my insurance company limits and I had to use own funds and credit cards to work on repairs. 
in XXXX my company made a XXXX time adjustment to my compensation which lowered my XXXX W2 by close to $ XXXX. 
In XX/XX/XXXX I submitted a request to Freedom Mortgage to enter forbearance, to allow me time to pay off the consumer debt I incurred working on flood repairs to my house. 
In XX/XX/XXXX I found out through the Freedom mortgage website that they put me in a " modified payment plan '' lowering my payment for XXXX months and then doubling my payment for XXXX  months to catch up. That did not meet my request and didn't provide any assistance. 
in XX/XX/XXXX I resubmitted my hardship request and asked for any options available to me ( forbearance, loan mod, reinstatement ). Without discussing with me, Freedom Mortgage sent me a loan mod package, increasing the interest rate almost 3 % and raising my payment substantially. That didn't offer assistance I needed. 
In XX/XX/XXXX I re-submitted a hardship request again asking for somebody to contact me to discuss options and I explained the previous loan mod was not an acceptable option as it offered no relief. XXXX again without discussing with me sent another similar loan mod as the first XXXX ( raising the rate substantially and not offering any assistance ). Throughout the entirety from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX I have not been able to reach anybody at Freedom Mortgage with the authority to discuss options and was only able to reach general customer service representatives that simply " read notes '' in the system and could provide very limited information. A few times through those XXXX  months I would receive a missed call ( while I was at work ) and a voice mail that asked me to call them back but no information. When I called back again I'd only reach customer service and was not able to get put through to the person that left the voice mail. 
In XXXX of XXXX Freedom sent a process server to post a Notice of Sale date of XX/XX/XXXX. I called and re-submitted a hardship request in XX/XX/XXXX. 
In XX/XX/XXXX I had multiple calls with Freedom Mortgage customer service as they kept telling me " there was a title issue and they needed to know if my wife would be signing any documents required '' I verbally confirmed she would be if required. XXXX weeks later I called and they said there was still the same title issue and so I sent a written confirmation through their website portal. XXXX XX/XX/XXXX customer service told me they received my written confirmation and that they were " waiting '' for title to clear. 
On XX/XX/XXXX customer service told me that my hardship package was in underwriting as of XX/XX/XXXX and that the sales date was put on hold. I confirmed on the website that my account was in loss mitigation on the XXXX. 
on XX/XX/XXXX I received an email stating there was a " change in the status of my account '' I was traveling on business at the time in XXXX XXXX, IA. I logged into my account and the status said " active in foreclosure ''. I called and the customer service rep told me that my file was kicked out of loss mitigation on XX/XX/XXXX and that the sale for the next day ( XX/XX/XXXX ) was going forward. I asked for immediate relief/postponement and for somebody to help me and work on a resolution. The rep told me " it's too late. There's nothing you can do ''. That entire XXXX months I worked in good faith to reach a resolution and met nothing but roadblocks through the business processes of Freedom Mortgage, not having access to anybody with authority or detailed knowledge to assist me. 
on XX/XX/XXXX while still traveling in XXXX XXXX, IA I listed the house for sale and received an offer on it. My realtor submitted that information to the trustee for Freedom Mortgage. Late in the evening XX/XX/XXXX the trustee sent a request for additional documentation including a HUD XXXX settlement statement. Escrow offices were closed at that point. 
Early the morning of XX/XX/XXXX realtors, escrow company, and myself communicating repeatedly with the trustee 's office attempting to get them to postpone the sale even a day to review the sales offer. We submitted a XXXX settlement about XXXX AM on XX/XX/XXXX. 
The trustee pushed the foreclosure sale through and failed to give me any opportunity for performance. The house had close to {$300000.00} in equity. My XXXX for XXXX will be over {$300000.00}. I had the funds, the means and the ability for any reasonable solution Freedom Mortgage should have been able to provide. 
Freedom Mortgage uploaded a file to my website account offering assistance on XX/XX/XXXX but wouldn't provide any assistance as the document stated they would.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am writing regarding a reverse mortgage loan I obtained through XXXX XXXX in XXXX. I borrowed approximately {$60000.00} and began repaying the loan in XXXX. Due to the rapid accrual of interest, I transitioned to a traditional mortgage loan with XXXX XXXX XXXX, which allowed me to better manage my finances and retain my home. Years later, I contacted XXXX XXXX for assistance, as I had done on XXXX prior occasions, to inquire about possible relief options for the loan. This situation continues to trouble me, as it leaves me questioning how much I might have saved had I been informed of this opportunity. 

Given these circumstances, I respectfully request an investigation to clarify the following : Was an interest-free repayment letter sent to my home? If so, when was it sent, and to what address? 
A comprehensive review of the payments I made on the reverse mortgage loan to determine how much interest was paid that could have been avoided under interest-free terms. 
A review of the documents I signed when initiating the reverse mortgage loan, as I am concerned about the possibility of irregularities or misrepresentation in the documentation. 
I trust you understand the significance of this matter and the financial impact it has had on me. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide an estimated timeline for your investigation. Should you require any additional information or documentation from me, I will gladly provide it. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Demand for Immediate Account Removal Due to FCRA Violation To Whom It XXXX Concern, I am writing to formally demand the immediate removal of the following account from all credit reporting agencies due to your blatant violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Account Number : XXXX **** Under FCRA XXXX XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ), it is your legal obligation to notate an account as in dispute once a consumer challenges its accuracy. You have failed to fulfill this requirement, despite my previous dispute notification. This constitutes a serious violation of federal law and demonstrates your reckless disregard for my rights as a consumer. 

Your failure to properly update the dispute status of this account means you are reporting false and misleading information. According to FCRA 1681s-2, this violation provides me with automatic grounds for account removal.

I am demanding that you : 1. Immediately remove this account from all credit reporting agencies.

2. Provide written confirmation of the accounts deletion within 15 days.

Failure to Comply Will Result in Legal Action : If you do not comply with this demand, I will take the following action without further notice : File formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ).

Pursue legal action under FCRA Sections 1681n and 1681o for willful or negligent noncompliance, which may include claims for statutory damages, punitive damages, and attorneys fees.

This is your final opportunity to correct your violation and avoid legal consequences. I expect your full cooperation and confirmation that the account has been removed from my credit report.

You have 15 days to comply with this demand.

For over six years, we have disputed the loan balance and amortization of the loan agreement. The mortgage lender refuses to provide any information on how they created the re-amortization amount and has ignored the written collection records from the prior servicing company that brought our account current. 

We had made numerous requests via a Qualified Written Request to XXXX XXXX, all ignored. We offered to make payments in good faith while his issue was being addressed, but they never responded. They had sent our application ( without our consent and without disclosure ) to XXXX Mortgage XXXX to have us refinance ; however, the amount demanded, per our records, is over {$100000.00} overstated, if not more. 

On XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX acknowledged our latest request to them from XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX saying they needed additional time. Instead of responding to our request they began to use extortion and threats and on XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX  sent a XXXX Notice. 

On XXXX XXXX XXXX they sent a letter stating the robosigning of documents on the transfers had no validity. They claimed they could not provide the complete loan history nor amortization since it was not in their possession. They placed all their weight on Modification Agreement signed under duress and noted in writing that it was disputed when signed. 

The loan was transferred to Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing, and to date, they have refused to provide any requested documents, stating that for each request, they need more time. I had noted to XXXXXXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and Shellpoint Mortgage that I had a copy of the collection records from the prior mortgage holder, XXXXXXXX XXXX, stating my account was current, so increasing our loan balance from under {$200000.00} to over {$320000.00} was not justified by the facts. Furthermore, the mortgage holder had filed a fraudulent proof of claim with the bankruptcy court, voiding our rights to protection. 

We have disputed the accuracy of the debt numerous times in writing to Shellpoint, which at first they attempted to deny receiving ; however, I reminded them they acknowledged the receipt and asked for more time. We asked in writing numerous times for financial assistance ( making payments including a lump sum ) while they produced the documentation so we could have a forensic audit completed. They have refused and only responded with material misrepresentations to provide the information, threats, collection agents sent to my home, and threats of negative credit reporting.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Experian for failing to remove a collection account from my credit report despite my repeated efforts to have it properly validated and the lack of proof from the debt collection agency that this debt is mine. 

The collection account in question is reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX and appears on my Experian credit report. I first disputed this entry with Experian on or around XXXX or XX/XX/year>, requesting validation of the debt pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Specifically, I requested that the collection agency provide proof that the debt is mine, including documentation such as an original signed purchase agreement with the original party/lender. I requested such information from XXXX on XX/XX/year>. 

To date, the debt collection agency has failed to provide any valid documentation to substantiate their claim that the debt belongs to me. Despite this, Experian has not removed the entry from my credit report, which is not in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Under the FCRA, once a debt is disputed, the credit reporting agency must ensure that the information it reports is accurate and verifiable. Since the collection agency has not provided sufficient evidence of the debts validity, this entry should have been removed from my credit report. 

Furthermore, it is important to note that I was never informed by XXXX of this purported debt. It was added to my credit report without proper documentation or notification. The sole communication I have received from XXXX is an email dated XX/XX/year>, which informs me that I have failed to make arrangements for the alleged debt and it will soon be reported on my credit reports. 

I have made multiple attempts to resolve this matter with both the debt collection agency and Experian, but my dispute remains unresolved. As a result, I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that Experian removes this invalid collection entry from my credit report.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I learned my personal credit card and my husband 's personal credit cards were closed without any explanation. I've been a client of XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  which was merged with Capital One for almost 50 years. 

In fact, they declined a reoccurring health insurance bill. All of my bills are paid on time. All three cards are heavily used. My credit rating is in the XXXX. I earn and use many travel rewards. 

My husband I called personal credit card service to find out what was going on. I was told my accounts had been closed as capital one bank did not like the way I used credit card. A letter was in the snail mail. The decision is final and irreversible. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told the individual could not pass me on. I asked for a number to an executive complaint line and was told no. I asked if pending charges would be approved. XXXX XXXX could not answer that question. Disgruntled I hung up. I called the business cred card customer service and received identical response. 

So, they advertised a reward program and I used it? Isn't that false advertising? Surely a warning could've been sent or communication could have existed. The customer service was pathetic and awful. 

After posting messages on Capital one XXXX page, I finally managed to get a complaint email. I have emailed them, XXXX and your organization.

Consumer complaint narrative: Youre a big Bank. I dont know. Maybe I was XXXX, but whenever I lost my XXXX credit card and I called you to let you know that Ive lost it. You told me there was XXXX fraud liability and I was told I didnt have anything to worry about. I didnt use the card then I wouldnt have to pay for it well guess what all of that with a lie there was no truth in any of that cause just the opposite happened I reported the fraud as soon as I realized it, you denied it one time and you said I benefited from it so I got a hold of you and I explained the fact once again that I didnt have the card in my possession, we dont know what happened to the card. We dont know where it was at. We were in XXXX, Michigan and the card was used all over the place. I never left XXXX so you open the investigation again and this time you gave me a call and I answer the phone and you tell me that during that time that the fraud was occurring I had access to my account over 100 times that is just a lie I did not check my account at all. I typically do not check the account my credit card account until its time to pay the bill and if I didnt have the card, I definitely wasnt checking it during the period when fraud was happening over 100 times according to you, I asked for you to produce this information. I want to see the proof how you came to your decision oh thats just for Bank use you say so. Im just supposed to take your word for it and youre not gon na honor your 0 % fraud liability. You should be ashamed. Im a good customer and you are not helping at all. Im very disappointed with customer service with your fraud department and shes like if you produce some additional information we can look at it again what information she couldnt give me one example of the information you would need I didnt have the card. I never signed anything I didnt know who had the card I didnt get permission for anyone else to use the card and I definitely didnt benefit from it anyway none of the transactions belong to me. This is crazy. is this really the way you treat your customers?

Consumer complaint narrative: Now according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' Unfortunately I am victim of unfair practices.I am a consumer and Experian and XXXX Just to remind you I have a right to not have my information shared with third parties this is also backed ( 15 usc 6801 ) which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. " 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : IN ACCODANCE with the WRITTEN instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and Experian do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, Experian whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked effective immediately. Another reminder ( 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) a reference A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' I have yet to be informed of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission and is against the law. So I am now bringing it to the attention after long hours of research according to 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' and this is why I as the consumer I am demanding that reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX and Experian are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A chuonsumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting

All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington, DC XXXX Subject : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act by Equifax Dear CFPB Team, I am writing to formally report a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by Equifax regarding my ongoing disputes about inaccurate information on my credit report, specifically concerning an account listed as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Since XX/XX/year>, I have been mailing dispute letters to Equifax regarding this inaccurate account. As of XX/XX/year>, it has been over five months without resolution, despite the FCRA stipulating that credit bureaus must conduct an investigation within 30 days. Equifax has continued to stall my requests by sending me delay letters, which is unacceptable. 

Furthermore, I would like to draw attention to Section 2 of the FCRA, which states that a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. Both the financial institution involved and Equifax do not have my consent to furnish this information, nor do they possess any written consent from me. This lack of authorization raises serious concerns about the legality of the information being reported. 

I urge the CFPB to investigate this matter and hold Equifax accountable for their actions. I appreciate your attention to this serious issue and look forward to your prompt response. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Consumer complaint narrative:
I called MOHELA earlier this week for XXXX reasons. I needed to understand why my interest rates keep going up even though I've been paying my loans consistently over the last year, and what my repayment options were due to being laid off. 

In terms of the interest rates, I was not given an answer. In fact, the customer service rep lied to me about my rates going down. Around XXXX years ago, XXXX of my loans was at 10 % interest ; it's now at 13.75 %, and I've already paid beyond the initial amount borrowed by over double. It's very clear that 13.75 % is higher than 10 %. I was not given an answer other than " we can raise rates whenever we want. '' I find this to be an abusive and deceptive practice and violates UDAP laws. 

When I asked what my repayment options were, the customer service rep refused to give me information on what my options were unless I gave information first. This is also a deceptive practice. In addition, while dealing with this customer service rep, she raised her voice, spoke over me numerous times, and was outright rude and unfair. When I explained that I didn't need to provide information about my income or savings account, I was told that they were going to withhold from telling me their options. This is also UDAP violation, abusive and deceptive, as I was trying to understand what my options were to remain a good paying customer. I never got an answer from this rep. Even when speaking with their supervisor, I was not provided with what all the options were without providing my expense information, which is withholding and being deceptive about what I could do while facing financial hardship. 

Further, I've already paid beyond the principal of my loans at this point and likely will not be able to get out of these loans throughout my lifetime because they continuously increase interest rates without providing a reason. This is an example of unfair, abusive, and deceptive practices across the board.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased items in XXXX from XXXX that were returned in XXXX. I took said items to UPS ( receipt attached ) so I could receive a refund from XXXX. 

I received text messages stating my items had been received and I would receive my refunds. Photo of the three text messages on XXXX showing that I would receive a refund, even though it was for less than what I paid. ( The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is what this is about ) Then I received a notice from XXXX that I was going to be charged again for not returning my order. I got on chat via their app to get this squared away to no avail, and shame on me as I apparently lost my screenshots showing that I was informed that the issue with the return was on end, and I would not be charged.

I was charged.

I filed a chargeback via CapitalOne app, see
attached letter from CaptialOne acknowledging my chargeback.

I received an email on the XXXX letting me know that I had received a letter from CapitalOne. I signed into their site only to see that the letter stated that since I did not respond to their prior request for information, my dispute was closed. I never received any emails letting me know that I had letters from CapitalOne. Mind you I can see the letters in my folder on their app, but I was not notified!

Today, I have now spent over two hours trying to get this reopened by CapitalOne to no avail. Between their inept, XXXX speaking agents hanging up on me when I get fed-up and ask for a supervisor, or even better, JUST TRANSFER ME TO DISPUTES! BUT NO! I said I would be filing this complaint to the final
one since he refused to transfer me, only to be informed that I was NOW being transferred since I made a threat to complain to the CFPB & FDIC, only to be transferred to his supervisor, who was also no help!!

I hung up!

Consumer complaint narrative: I looked at an advertisement from XXXX, stating 150 % credit back, I went to look at it- chose items, and went to my cart to see if they were going to give me the discount, they DID NOT, so I exited the app. I NEVER HIT CHECKOUT! And they went into my cash app and took it!! My card was locked ... .I don't get how they can just take it. I called them immediately- they filed a report. AND DID NOTHING, as usual. I got scammmed last sunday- on a home rental. I gave a deposit on the home- and the lady took the keys and lease, and RAN! I filed a police report- and cash app refused to refund my money- or even try to help. The first transaction was {$360.00} total for the deposit + XXXX misc. The second ( XXXX XXXX was {$86.00} These are very expensive transactions- and I am on ssi ... minimal income. I need my funds! Please help me. Not only this- but while I was incarcerated- an acquantance got ahold of my wallet, and phone and managed to take {$2300.00} out of my cash app. She boldly sent the money to herself in several transactions... then the rest were atm withdrawls!! I never authorized these transactions. I got out about XXXX XXXX months ago- thinking I had money, but she XXXX me out!! I tried to get the funds back, and she denied it- even though I have these transactions in black and white on my account. Cash app didn absolutely nothing even though I sent them my discharge papers from the prison. Cash app needs to be dealt with. I haven lost thousands with them.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is a total loss of structure and contents. 

Insurance company issues check for the XXXX XXXX. 
Mortgage has outstanding balance of $ XXXX - I have never been delinquent. 

XX/XX/year> - I forward insurance check {$230000.00} to sent to Citizens Bank , NA Mortgage. 

XX/XX/year> - I received {$180000.00} from Citizens and am told the balance will be held until progress is made. 

XX/XX/year> - Mortgage Inspector comes to my property and confirms home demolition is 100 % complete. The property has its original foundation ( we are using this foundation to rebuild ). Land is graded. Straw on ground to protect foundation from winter temperatures. 

XX/XX/year> - Mortgage company notifies me they will not release the balance of the insurance money to me until progress is made. I explained to Mortgage company progress is made. The value of the foundation is {$20000.00}. The value of the vacant lot is {$70000.00}. The property value is {$90000.00}. This total value exceeds the balance of my insurance money {$51000.00} the mortgage company is holding, and this value exceeds the balance I owe on the mortgage. 

I want this insurance money returned to me, now. I am rebuilding my home. I want my insurance money put into my money market account so that I earn interest on my insurance money to put it back into my home. How can the Mortgage company hold my insurance money that now exceeds the value of the property and exceeds the value of the outstanding balance of my mortgage? Please help.

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a prinicipal in a company that assists borrowers in obtaining low interest assumable mortgages that are FHA or VA loans. 
I have been involved in over 20 closed loan assumptions with MrCooperNationstar and all have been difficult because MrCoopers disclosures to the buyer and seller on these FHA or VA loans errantly advise them that " In order to begin the qualification process for the assumption of the loan, the loan must be current at the time of the assumption '' and " please be advised that the loan is not assumable, according to the terms of the note, if an unrelated third party is requesting to assume the note '' These statements are incorrect, wrong and misleading and in addition to violating Section 5 of the Federal Trade commission Act as the sending of these letters are " unfair and deceptive acts affecting commerce '' they are also an UDAAP by CFPB regulations and guidelines.

MrCooperNationstar will not ALLOW an applicant to apply to assume one of their serviced FHA or VA loans until they are vetted by their up front process that mandates they receive and respond to these " welcome letters '' .This violates the CFPA requirements that an " application '' exists when the lender has 6 pieces of information their licensed loan officers refuse mailed applications for credit approvals on assumptions and refer it back to their existing intake process which begins with this " welcome Letter '' .I have clients who have sent their completed URLA, authorizations copy of purchase contract, etc to licensed loan officers specializing in assumptions and have it ignored until they go through their intake process.This welcome letter is intended to dissuade people from trying to consummate an assumption.

The letters I am attaching show reference numbers from MrCooper of XXXX to XXXX and that is over just one year.The question is how many of those XXXX plus inquiries were potential assumptors or assumptees who were disssuaded from consummation of the assumption because of MrCoopers deceptive practices?

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely,

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
So I have these unauthorized inquiries on my credit report that Im tryna get removed It was like a XXXX XXXX of inquiries all at once It all the recent ones because I havent apply for any credit Also account SYNCB/LOW and XXXXXXXX XXXX has unauthorized inquiries reporting to my credit profile I am writing to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report, as reported by [ XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ] in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I have identified multiple issues with accounts reported by [ XXXX, e.g., SYNCB/LOW ] that must be corrected or removed. Please investigate and take action within the timeframe required by law. 
The FCRA mandates accuracy in consumer reports under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), and I believe your agency has failed to meet this standard in the following ways : Details of the Disputed Accounts XXXX. Account XXXX : SYNCB/LOW [ last XXXX digits : XXXX ] XXXX. Inaccuracies Identified : The credit limit for this account is inconsistently reported ( e.g., {$5000.00} on XXXX and XXXX but {$0.00} on XXXX ). 
Late payment history is inaccurate ; [ describe inconsistencies ]. 
The account is flagged as closed due to inactivity ; however, no valid adverse action notice was provided by the creditor as required under 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( a ). 
XXXX. Applicable Violations : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Failure to maintain accurate reporting procedures. 
15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) : Creditor supplied inaccurate information and failed to correct known errors.

15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 : Failure to address suspected fraud, as indicated by my consumer statement of unauthorized services.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) : Credit bureau failure to promptly investigate prior disputes, if any.

Requested Actions 1. Conduct an immediate investigation of the accounts as required under 15 U.S.C. 1681i. 2. Remove or correct all inaccurate information related to this account, including : Late payment history. 
Credit limit discrepancies. 
Any derogatory remarks or account closures due to inactivity. 
XXXX. Provide me with a corrected copy of my credit report after resolving these disputes. Supporting Documents Enclosed are copies of relevant documentation, including : My consumer credit report highlighting the discrepancies. 
A copy of my consumer statement referencing unauthorized services. 
Legal Obligation and Timeline Under the FCRA, you are required to investigate my dispute within 30 days ( or 45 days if I provide additional documentation ). If the information is found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable, it must be deleted or corrected immediately under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ). 
Failure to comply with these requirements will leave me with no choice but to file a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and consider legal action to enforce my rights under the FCRA, including seeking damages under 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 15 U.S.C. 1681o. 
IF THIS ACCOUNT NOT REMOVED OR UPDATED TO POSITIVE THEN I WILL SEEK MONETARY DAMAGES FOR THESE INACCURACIES ON MY REPORT. Under the FCRA, I am exercising my right to dispute these accounts. Due to the severity of the violations and the burden of proof on the furnishers and credit reporting agencies. I am requesting the immediate removal of these accounts from my credit report. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution

I had 2 balance transfer promotions with Discover Card on my XX/XX/XXXX billing statement : 1 ) Balance Transfer at 5.99 % APR expiring XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$1500.00} 2 ) Balance Transfer at 6.99 % APR expiring XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$1700.00} I made a payment on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$1600.00} to payoff the balance transfer promotion expiring soonest on XX/XX/XXXX so that I could continue to take advantage of my promo that expires next year. Instead, Discover applied my funds towards the promo that expires XX/XX/XXXX and let my XX/XX/XXXX promo expire so that I'm now paying 25.74 % regular APR. 

I called Discover on XX/XX/XXXX to kindly ask that they reverse the my payment and apply to the 1st balance transfer with remaining balance of {$1500.00} and they refused saying that their policy is for payments to go towards higher APRs first, even if the customer has explicitly requested otherwise. This was unfair, deceptive and abusive and they need to comply with my request. 

I let them know that my phone conversation was recorded as well and asked if they'd like to reconsider to which they said no. 

I'd like resolution.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Portfolio Recovery Associates XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Assignment Contract and Validation of Debt for Accounts # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear Portfolio Recovery Associates, This letter serves as a formal demand for documentation validating your legal right to collect on the following accounts currently reported to my consumer report : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : Balance {$870.00} Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, you are required to provide clear and sufficient validation of the alleged debts. Specifically, I demand the assignment contract proving your legal authority to collect on these accounts. A bill of sale or billing statements alone do not constitute sufficient proof of ownership or assignment.

Legal Basis for My Request : 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) : Upon disputing the validity of a debt, the debt collector must provide verification. Verification requires substantive proof, including the assignment contract that demonstrates the transfer of ownership or the right to collect the debt. A generic bill of sale or billing statements are insufficient, as they do not establish your right to enforce the debt.

Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) 9-404 ( Rights Acquired by Assignee ) : Under the UCC, you must provide the original contract and proof that you acquired the rights to enforce the debt. If you lack such documentation, your claim to these debts is invalid. 
Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : In this case, it was affirmed that debt collectors must possess and provide evidence of a legal transfer of ownership or assignment to collect on debts.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) : Furnishers of information, including debt buyers, are prohibited from reporting information they know or should know to be inaccurate. Reporting debts without sufficient legal documentation violates this provision. 
Specific Documentation Required : Assignment Contract : Provide a copy of the assignment contract explicitly showing the transfer of ownership or the right to collect the debts from the original creditor to Portfolio Recovery Associates. 
XXXX Signed XXXX : Provide a copy of the original signed agreement between myself and the original creditor to establish the validity of the alleged debts. 
Purchase Amount : The purchase amount Portfolio Recovery Associates paid for these accounts must be disclosed to ensure transparency regarding ownership and collection practices.

Payment History and Balance Verification : A full and detailed account of the payment history, including how the balances were calculated, must be provided. This includes verification that the claimed balances are accurate and free from errors or inflated amounts.

Demand for Removal from My Consumer Report : If you can not provide the above documentation, it is clear you do not have the legal authority to collect on these accounts. As such, I demand that these accounts be immediately removed from all consumer reporting agencies to avoid further violations of the FDCPA and FCRA.

Failure to Comply : Failure to comply with this request will result in : Filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) for violations of the FDCPA and FCRA.

Legal action to seek damages under 15 U.S.C. 1692k for your willful or negligent noncompliance. 
I expect a full response within 15 days of receiving this letter. Noncompliance will not be tolerated.

Product: Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative: I was part of a hiring scam with a company called XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/year>. A wire was made from my account in two payments totaling {$5800.00}. This {$5800.00} was moved from Wells Fargo to XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX which I was told that it was a sub account of XXXX XXXX whom I was supposed to be hired by. The fraud immediately was detected after the first weekend following the wire transfers. That Monday following the incident, an account notice was placed by Wells Fargo as I notified them on the fraudulent activity and a new checking account was opened. Wells Fargo has been notified of fraud by phone. A month later in XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX showed a payment processing from the newly made checking account. Wells Fargo was notified to not accept the charge from XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX. Wells Fargo said they placed a note that the chargeback from XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX was unauthorized. The unauthorized chargeback from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX went through and depleted my account into the negatives.I have been trying to refund my initial checking balance of {$1300.00} from the {$5800.00} that the scammers defrauded Wells Fargo through my account. My account has since been closed by Wells Fargo and my credit card of over 10years with over XXXX credit limit closed as well due to this mess. Since then, I placed a police report and formal complaints with Wells Fargo and through CFPB to gain resolution to this problem. It was been over a year since my initial dispute. Wells Fargo contacted me yesterday about the negative balance they want me to pay back. As far as I am concerned, Wells Fargo actually owes me the {$1300.00} that they took back in XX/XX/year> when they allowed XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX to pull {$5800.00} that was labeled and noted as an unauthorized charge. I strictly told them to put a stop to the charge and what would happen If Wells Fargo allowed the charge to go through from them. Had Wells Fargo listened, then I would have had to deal directly with the neighboring Credit Union relinquishing any liability from Wells Fargo and initially myself. Since they allowed the unauthorized charges to go through to the new checking account I created, we all now have to solve this overly complicated Fraud case. I can not be liable for the full amount as I am covered, as a consumer, by federal law given that i reported the Fraud and took all the necessary steps within 3 days. I called Wells Fargo Fraud Department to file a new claim and no one was available when they transferred my call. The initial agent who was asking for the remaining {$4000.00} said that I needed to place a police report on the Fraud which i have done 2 years prior to now. This situation needs to be resolved asap.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear I.Q. Data international inc., This letter is being sent to you in response to a recent charge that was made on my credit report that I do not recognize.

Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g stating your claim is disputed and validation is requested.

This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you.

At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the XXXX major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX or XXXX ) this action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character. 
If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated.

If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Follow-Up on CFPB Complaint - ATM Withdrawal Dispute ( Chime ) Claim Number : XXXX Dear CFPB, This new complaint is related to a prior issue I reported on XX/XX/2024, under claim number XXXX. Despite my efforts, the issue remains unresolved. 

I am filing a new complaint regarding Chime Financial , Inc., and its handling of my ATM dispute for {$200.00}. Despite my repeated attempts to resolve this issue, Chime has failed to refund my money, citing their inability to recover funds from the ATM operator as justification. This violates their obligations under the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and shows a failure to protect me as a consumer. 

XXXX XXXX : On XX/XX/2024, I attempted to withdraw {$200.00} from an XXXX ATM. The ATM malfunctioned, and no cash was dispensed, but {$200.00} was debited from my account. 
The ATM operator confirmed that the transaction failed and provided a receipt as evidence. I filed a dispute with Chime, which they denied on XX/XX/2024, claiming no error occurred. 
After reopening the dispute, Chime later stated they can not refund the money because the ATM operator has not returned the funds after they requested a chargeback. 

XXXX XXXX : I request the CFPBs assistance to : Hold Chime accountable for its obligations under the XXXX. 
Ensure that the {$200.00} is reimbursed promptly to my account. 
Investigate Chime 's practices regarding dispute handling and compliance with consumer protection laws. 

Thank you for your time and attention. I am attaching all supporting documents, including : ATM operator 's receipt confirming no cash was dispensed. 
Communication records with Chime and their response letters.

I reported to Capital One that I had these unauthorized charges on my debit card : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I reported these unauthorized charges to Capital One on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, Capital One reversed my credit they had given me while investigating. 

I called Capital One on XX/XX/XXXX to understand why there was a credit reversal and they told me they had made the decision that these charges were not unauthorized. I asked them to give me more info about where the charges were from or how I could contact the places that had charged me. I asked them if they could give me a location of the places so I could confirm if I had ever been there. The names of the places that made the unauthorized charges were very generic like " STORE, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Places I've never heard of or been to before ). I reviewed the days that the charges had been made and was able to confirm that I did not purchase anything for the charged amounts. I believe the places were named in a way that allowed Capital One to ignore that these charges were actually fraudulent by being named very generically and having a name that corresponds to a place in my general area, like ( XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX ). I've never been to an area called XXXX XXXX and I live in the city of XXXX. Others were just named " XXXX  '' or " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX', giving no info to be able to identify where the charges were made or what they were for. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I requested the documents Capital One used to make their decision about my dispute and to reopen my dispute as it was unjust and I did not authorize the charges above. The request was denied.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had to file an insurance claim, and when my insurance sent me a check to reimburse me for my claim, they made the check out to me and my loan servicer, Newrez. I endorsed the check with my signature and then contacted Newrez to see what I needed them to do to have them endorse it. 

Newrez sent me instructions to send them the check by snail mail, that they would endorse it and send it back to me by snail mail. I let them know that that was not a good idea, because I already signed it. Their uneducated and uniformed service department proceeded to tell me that I could send them a XXXX mailing label ( they don't do XXXX ), so that they could send the check back to me more securely. 

There are MANY problems with this response. 
XXXX. Why do I have to send them a label? They're servicing my loan at a ridiculous interest rate, so they should probably have the money to make their own XXXX label, which is MUCH easier for them to do than me. Why should I pay for their business fees? 
XXXX. XXXX may track with the label, but that still doesn't insure the package. It's a XXXX check! For me to pay for the insurance on this label, XXXX wanted to charge me over {$80.00}. 
XXXX. Their answer should have been that they would deposit my check and then make out another check to me, sending me that check. This is the only secure way to do this. 

I called them back, and it took me a LOT of explaining for me to even get the person on the other line to understand that I already signed this check, and that once they signed it, it would be fully endorsed. Once the other person finally got it, I told them they needed to deposit this check and send me a new one. She said that she put a note on the account asking them to do that, and that they would. 

Today I opened my mailbox to find an envelope from Newrez. Inside is the fully enorsed check from my home insurance company, not a new check from Newrez. After multiple phone calls, making a formal complaint to Newrez, and assurance that they would make out a new check to me, these idiots put a fully endorsed check for almost {$10000.00} in the mail. I'm lucky to have this check right now and that nothing happened to it. 

This company SHOULD NOT be handling money!
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: Johnson Mark LLC on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has filed a court civil suit against me on a debt that has not been validated. I am submitting this complaint against Johnson Mark LLC on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for their attempt to collect a debt they are not legally authorized to collect. Their actions are in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and applicable Credit Reporting ( CR ) rules outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Details of the Complaint : 1.Failure to Validate the Debt : This debt is required to be validated under the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C.1692g ). the company has failed to provide proper validation, including proof that the debt is valid, that they own the debt or have the right to collect it, and a full accounting of the amount owed. 2. Debt Not Collectible Under CR Rules : Under federal law, debts sold to collection agencies may not be collectible unless the agency can legally demonstrate ownership and compliance with CR rules. Specifically : Credit Reporting Rules ( FCRA ) : Debts sold to collection agencies must include complete and accurate information about the debt, including its origin, the amount, and whether the statute of limitations has expired. Agencies must also notify credit bureaus if a debt is disputed. Debt Ownership : If the original creditor sold the debt, the collector must provide a clear chain of title proving their legal right to collect the debt. Johnson Mark LLC on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has not provided this. 3. Violation of My Rights : The debt in question appears to be unverified, unenforceable, and under applicable state law Attempting to collect this debt without validation is a violation of my consumer rights under the FDCPA and FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting a complaint regarding a car dealership, XXXX, for misrepresenting my role in a vehicle purchase on XX/XX/year>. While I agreed to co-sign for the vehicle, the dealership incorrectly listed me as the primary owner and submitted the vehicle for registration in my name. 

This mistake has created financial responsibilities and legal obligations that I did not agree to. The issue remains unresolved despite repeated attempts to address this with the dealership. 

The sales representative informed me that the customer, XXXX XXXX, was unable to obtain financing on her own due to her lack of credit history and required a co-signer to complete the purchase. The representative assured me that the vehicle would be registered in XXXXXXXX XXXX  name, and I agreed to co-sign based on that understanding. XXXX paid the deposit directly in her name, and the insurance for the vehicle is also in her name, with me listed as an additional driver to lower premium payments. 

However, the dealership submitted the title and registration in my name, despite assuring that the car would be in XXXXXXXX XXXX name. This has created legal and financial complications for me that I did not anticipate or agree to. 

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance in holding the dealership accountable and ensuring that my role as a co-signer is accurately reflected in all related documents, including the vehicles title and registration. 

I am available to provide additional details or documentation if necessary. You may contact me at XXXX or via email at XXXX. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Impersonated attorney, law enforcement, or government official
Consumer complaint narrative:
File number : XXXX I am writing in regard to the above-referenced debt to inform you that I am disputing this debt. Please verify the debt as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. 

I am disputing this debt because I do not owe it. 
Because I am disputing this debt, you should not report it to the credit reporting agencies. If you have already reported it, please contact the credit reporting agencies, inform them that the debt is disputed, and ask them to delete it from my credit report immediately. Reporting information that you know to be inaccurate, or failing to report information correctly, violates The Fair Debt Collection Act. 

* The original creditor 's name and contact information * A detailed breakdown of the debt amount, including principal, interest, and fees. 
* Documentation supporting the validity of the debt, such as a copy of the original contract signed. 

Also be advised that I am keeping accurate records of all correspondence from you and your company in false representation, including recording all phone calls, and I will not hesitate to report violations of the law to my State Attorney General, the Federal Trade Commission and the Better Business Bureau. 

Finally, please note that I do not wish to receive further telephone calls or letters concerning this debt I do not owe to your client. The Fair Debt Collection practices Act requires you to respect this request. See 15 U.S.C. 1692 ( c ) and 15 U.S. Code 1692 ( e ) - False or misleading representations debt collecting practices

I am writing to formally file a complaint against BMO Mortgage regarding their handling of my home loan application. Despite my application being described by their bankers as " strong, '' BMO delayed the loan closing and funding, leading to unwarranted charges of {$600.00} per day for five days, totaling {$3000.00}. 

I was in full communication with BMO throughout the process and promptly provided all required documentation in a single submission. However, the delays were caused by their underwriters ' inefficiencies and errors, including mixing my XXXX  and XXXX  business filings. This lack of diligence and attention to detail was unacceptable. 

The delays appeared deliberate and financially exploitative. Furthermore, the lack of urgency and apathy displayed by BMO caused me significant emotional distress. I had to dedicate excessive time and effort to push this process forward, only to face mounting frustration at their mishandling of my case. 

As a resolution, I am requesting the following : The return of the {$3000.00} in unjustified charges. 
Compensation for the emotional stress caused by BMO 's negligence. 
Reimbursement for my time and effort in addressing and pursuing this matter, including filing this complaint. 
I urge your office to investigate these unethical practices and take appropriate punitive action against BMO Mortgage. Customers should not have to endure financial exploitation or such a disregard for professionalism during critical transactions. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please let me know if additional details or documentation are required. 

Sincerely,

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal dispute to request that the account with ATL CAP BKXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) be updated to reflect Never Late status across all credit bureaus, due to several discrepancies that are preventing me from purchasing a home for my family. Below are the discrepancies that need to be corrected : Inconsistent Account Status Reporting : XXXX reports the account status as " Positive '', while XXXX lists it as " Negative '', and XXXX lists it as " Closed ''. This inconsistency causes confusion regarding the status of the account, and it is crucial that the information is aligned across all credit bureaus. 
Under FCRA Section 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy and consistency of the information in consumer credit reports. The conflicting status reports violate this requirement and need to be corrected. 
Discrepancies in Account Type Reporting : XXXX lists the account as a Secured loan, while XXXX and XXXX do not include this detail. This inconsistency could affect how this account is viewed by lenders or creditors. Under FCRA Section 1681c, all information reported must accurately reflect the nature of the account. The discrepancy in account type reporting must be corrected to ensure transparency and avoid confusion in credit assessments. 
Discrepancy in Last Activity Date : XXXX and XXXX list the last activity date as XX/XX/year>, while XXXX lists it as XX/XX/year>. These discrepancies could affect the aging of this account, potentially impacting its removal or continued reporting. Under FCRA Section 1681c, negative information must be removed after seven years from the date of last activity. The conflicting last activity dates could result in incorrect aging, violating this regulation. 
Inconsistent Payment Status and Account Reporting : The account is reported with conflicting statuses between bureaus. XXXX lists the account as " Open '' and " Current '', while XXXX and XXXX report it as " Closed '' with varying payment statuses. This inconsistency misrepresents the accounts standing and could affect my creditworthiness. Under FCRA Section 1681i, when a consumer disputes information, it must be investigated and corrected if found to be inaccurate. The discrepancies in payment status across the credit bureaus suggest inaccurate reporting and should be rectified. 
Request for Never Late Update : If this account has been consistently paid and has not been late, I request that the account be updated to reflect " Never Late '' status across all bureaus. The discrepancies in reporting have led to negative consequences for my credit, which is preventing me from securing a mortgage for my family. 
Legal Reference : Under FCRA Section 1681i, consumers have the right to request corrections to inaccuracies. If the account is reported inaccurately or misleadingly, it should be updated to reflect " Never Late '' status.

Given these discrepancies, I respectfully request that this account be updated to reflect a Never Late status across all bureaus, and that any conflicting or inaccurate information be corrected to align across XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. These errors are significantly affecting my ability to purchase a home, and I request that they be resolved promptly in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Previous mortgage company was XXXX XXXX, owned the contract for 7 years, sold the contract to PennyMac XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from my newer mortgage company stating their records show my condo unit insurance expired XX/XX/XXXX and will require evidence to show new coverage obtained. My actual Insurance policy didnt fully expire until XX/XX/XXXX. I provided the correct policy information and on XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter from the mortgage company verifying that policy information was received and account updated. However the mortgage company still failed to pay the policy from the escrow account before the expiration on XX/XX/XXXX, resulting in loss of my condo insurance policy, which was never communicated until I received another letter on XX/XX/XXXX stating that my insurance expired and evidence of new coverage will be required, again. 

On XX/XX/XXXX a water leak occurred and damaged my unit, resulting in {$15000.00} worth of damage ( first estimate, no work has yet to be performed ). Drywall, cabinets and flooring had to be removed to fix a riser pipe. The HOAs master insurance covered the pipe and structure repair, however I am left to cover the damage to my own personal property. I called my insurance company only to find out that my policy expired due to non payment, and that they would not reinstate my policy. I called the mortgage company and they informed me to purchase new insurance and that they will have lender placed insurance to cover from XX/XX/XXXX until my new policy takes effect. I shopped for insurance and was unable to receive any policys due to lapse in coverage, a previous claim in the past 7 months prior and the loss of most insurance companies refusing to insure in the state of California.

I called the mortgage company back informing them in my inability to receive insurance. I requested to purchase the lender placed coverage from them on XX/XX/XXXX. I was told that it would be purchased and go into effect on XX/XX/XXXX and will cover from XXXX. I waited the month to make a claim only to find out on XX/XX/XXXX that they didnt not purchase the lender placed coverage as requested and now stated because the HOA has a master policy, they didnt require me to provide insurance with my mortgage. I informed them that the HOAs policy was to cover the structure and not my personal living space. The master policy shows that its all inclusive to the structure, not my personal living space. I even emailed the HOA who verified that I would have a {$25000.00} deductible and that it wouldnt cover anything other than the drywall. 

I called again and was informed that the lender placed wouldnt cover the water damage either and that I should try to purchase government sponsored insurance which is way more expensive and still wouldnt cover any future water damage. I feel like there has been so much negligence on behalf of my new mortgage company and Im getting left to pay for it. My previous mortgage company paid on time without issues for the past 7 years. My insurance covered water damage multiple times in the past 7 years without issue. Now the first year of my new mortgage company owning my contract I lose my policy and stuck with the {$15000.00} bill.
