I explained to the recruiter my student loan financial debt I had already consumed from when my parents sent me out of state at the young age of XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was reassured I would have access to that information. The recruiter started my process and assured me I would be able to jump right into the program due to the already accumulated classes and meeting program pre requisitions. The financial cost will be affordable because I wouldn't require many classes and I could get fees waved. After speaking to enrollment, I voiced the same concerns I had with the recruiter. I was assured this program would be cost effective. I was still eligible the option for federal loans that would cover the program but I did not have any PELL GRANTS available. Graduated in XXXX, I shortly realized I was frauded and not fully disclosed imperative information. I accumulated an estimate of {$34000.00} worth of federal loans. I also discovered two PELL GRANTS were dispersed in the total amount of {$4900.00}, after advised I did not qualify for any. There are also federal loan dispersed to XXXX in XXXX. These were fraudulently taken. XXXX closed the college in XXXX due to financial mismanagement. A settlement was granted and student loans were discharged under XXXX XXXX XXXX. After discovering this information I filed the XXXX for my federal loans. I have also placed a report to the FTC regarding the college 's deceitful and untruth information regarding the college. Both the recruiter and enrollment intentionally withhold information regarding the financial obligations. Recently, the college has placed a collection for a loan, that I have no recollection of, in the amount of {$16.00}, XXXX I have asked numerous times for the original loan documents, financial statements, and disbursement financial documents. I have asked the collection agency for this information as well and nothing has been provided.

I am submitting this formal statement to report several discrepancies in my credit report and request an investigation into the accuracy of the information being reported by the credit bureaus. The following issues require attention : Account Status Discrepancy : The account with Regions Bank ( Account Number : XXXX ) is reported as open with a late payment status on XXXX and XXXX as of XX/XX/XXXX, but XXXX reports the account as closed. This inconsistency across the credit bureaus needs to be corrected to ensure the accurate representation of my credit history. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and complete information in consumer credit reports. The conflicting statuses may constitute a violation of this provision. 
Discrepancy in Date of Last Payment : The XXXX report lists the date of last payment as XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX and XXXX report it as XX/XX/XXXX. The differing dates across the reports may result in inaccurate account aging and could impact the removal of negative information from my report.Under FCRA, Section 1681c, negative information must be removed after seven years from the date of last activity. The inconsistency in the reported date of last payment could affect the accurate calculation of this period. 
Inconsistent Reporting of Payment Frequency : The payment frequency is reported as " monthly '' by XXXX, while no payment frequency is listed on XXXX or XXXX. The failure to provide consistent and complete information regarding payment frequency could lead to an inaccurate understanding of my payment history. According to FCRA, Section 1681i ( a ), consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate information. The inconsistencies across the reports may indicate inaccurate or incomplete data being reported. Dispute Status Discrepancy : The dispute status for this account is marked as " Account not disputed '' on both XXXX and XXXX, yet XXXX does not report a dispute status. This discrepancy may violate my rights to ensure the accuracy of disputed information.Under FCRA, Section 1681i, when an account is disputed by a consumer, it must be clearly marked as such in all credit reports.Given the discrepancies outlined above, I respectfully request that the credit bureaus investigate these issues and ensure the accuracy and completeness of my credit report. If the information can not be verified or corrected, I request that the inaccurate information be removed in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased for my wife and I two XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX refundable tickets. On XXXXXX/XX/XXXX, I placed a 24-hour " hold '' on a reservation for two XXXX XXXX ticket for XX/XX/XXXX XXXX The next day, I called XXXX and asked the agent to cancel the two XXXX XXXXickets XXXX apply the credits to the ost of the two XXXX XXXXickets, and charge my credit card for the difference in cost. I gave the agent my credit card number. He processed the transaction. After the transactions, I checked my wife 's and my XXXX account ( both online and via the XXXX XXXX ) and we were shown as being ticketed for the XXXX XXXXlight XXXX we has seat assignment for seats XXXX and XXXX, our XXXX  had been canceled XXXX and no XXXX  credits for those flights showed in the account. A check of the credit card showed we had also been charged {$300.00}. We were all set, or so we thought. 

Two and a half months later, when we arrived at the airport on XX/XX/XXXX to check in, we awere told by the gate agent I could check in but there was no record of a ticket number for my wife. We accessed the XXXX XXXXpp which showed for flight " XXXX '' she was " Status : Ticketed '' for a ticket that was " Issued : XX/XX/XXXX ''. They did not care, they saw no ticket number and we were told my wife could not fly unless I paid {$3200.00} for a ticket for which an XXXX XXXXgent had already processed a purchase ( for {$680.00} ). 

I have a phot of the App screen taken while at the counter showing her status as " ticketed ''. There system still had her seat reservation in place ( as well as her meal reservation ). Seat reservations can not be maintained if the reservation is on hold or has been ticketed and XXXX  claims neither was in place. 

The only explanation is there was a glitch in the processing of my payment for the two tickets. They payment for my wife 's ticket ( through credits and credit card charge ) did not get process properly and the ticket was showing as paid but no payments were recieved. But all that was invisible to us, it was a glitch in XXXX XXXX processing, yet XXXX, and Barclay 's Bank with whom the dispute was filed, are refusing to hold XXXX accountable for their error. And I am stuck with a {$3200.00} charge for a ticket which XXXX XXXXad already process the payment of such that the reservation showed as being " Ticketed ''. And in doing so, contradicts what XXXX XXXXndicates is possible with a seat reservation, that a seat had been reserved for XXXX months without it being on hold or paid for. Barclay 's has not, because it can not, explain why the evidence presented did not clearly demonstrate the {$3200.00} billing was a duplicate payment for a ticket that had previously been processed as " Ticketed ''.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Debt Validation Letter Collection Agency Name Address City, State Zip To Whom It May Concern : Debt Validation Pursuant to 12 CFR 1006.34C This notice is to inform you that you have unlawfully reported an alleged debt to my consumer report. Under the New Rule REGULATION F which took effect XX/XX/year>, You { XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Put correct name here } You have violated the FDCPA 1006.30a and its new rule by parking this alleged debt on my consumer reports. Cease and Desist the reporting of this alleged Debt immediately or I will escalate this matter to taking legal action. 

I have not given you written permission to put anything on my credit profile 15 USC 1681b2.

You have no permissible purpose by law to contact third parties with my private or personal information. Your offenses amount to Aggravated Identity Theft pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1028A. You have knowingly transferred, possessed, or used, without lawful authority, a means of identification of me, which is a felony punishable with up to 2 years of imprisonment, in addition to civil liability.

I AM A LITIGIOUS CONSUMER I WILL NOT HESITATE TO TAKE LEGAL ACTION AGAINST { XXXXXXXX XXXX  Put name of collections company here } 15 USC 1692c ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt.

I refuse to pay this alleged debt. Cease and desist all collections activity regarding this alleged debt and PROMPTLY Delete it from all consumer reporting agencies that you have reported this inaccurate, incomplete, erroneous and misleading information to at once.

The reporting of such inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, my reputation, my general mode of living and my ability to obtain credit for personal and house purposes.

You and your inaccurate reporting have damaged my livelihood.

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) Prohibition ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact.

Prohibition : a law or regulation forbidding something 15 USC 1681 s-2 Says you { XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX } are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency. 
You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information 15 USC 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) Prohibition ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

In conclusion I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. The information is, in fact, inaccurate.

The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of the Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information.

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is a final opportunity to Cure and DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report.

YOU HAVE 10 Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS! or I will take legal action for consumer law violation under 15 USC 1681 n, 15 USC 1681 o and 15 USC 1692k.

DELETE THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT/S FROM YOUR RECORDS AND ALL CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCIES.

Account name Acct # : ( List accounts here ) Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above referenced account, and send out a free copy of my report after the changes have been made will result in legal actions being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation of Character ( per se ) 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Fair Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC 1692g violations.

4. Fair Credit Reporting Act 15USC 1681 violations for willful noncompliance - 616. Civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] Thank you,

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Account reinstatement or redemption after repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
Heres the corrected version of your text, with improved grammar, clarity, and flow : The event occurred during the second week of XX/XX/year>. I remember the vehicle was initially towed due to judgment tickets. After recovering the vehicle from the impound for the judgment tickets, I was approximately 8991 days past due on the lease. Within a week of retrieving the vehicle, it was repossessed that evening. 

After the repossession, I contacted Infiniti Financial Services to explore my options for recovering the vehicle. Over the following weeks, I communicated with several customer service representatives, providing updates on my situation and discussing payment options. It wasnt until later in XX/XX/year> that I spoke to one representative and informed him I would be following up with a payment I was planning to send to Infiniti. 

After sending the payment, I reached out to them the following Monday. During that conversation, one representative informed me that I was still behind on the past-due amount. I explained to him that the payment I had sent the previous week covered the full amount required to recover the vehicle. However, after going back and forth with the representative, I requested to speak with a supervisor. 

I spoke with the supervisor for at least two hours as she reviewed the account notes. After thoroughly reviewing everything, she told me that I should have been able to recover the vehicle with the payment I had sent the prior week. I explained to her that the representative I spoke to earlier had not communicated this to me and had instead told me that I needed to send an additional payment. He also stated that the vehicle was scheduled to be auctioned off by a certain date. 

Hearing my frustration, the supervisor asked me to hold while she consulted her higher-ups to see if there was any way to release the vehicle. After waiting for 2030 minutes, she returned with unfortunate news. She explained that the vehicle had already been moved to the auction site, and although I was technically eligible to recover it, there was nothing further she or her superiors could do at that point. 

When I heard this news, it felt like being punched in the stomach and chest. I lost my sense of reality and was overwhelmed with emotions. This experience led me into a deep XXXX, affecting my employment, self-confidence, and overall sense of self for several months. Shortly afterward, the XXXX pandemic struck, pushing me further into a downward spiral.

XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Demand for Immediate Account Removal Due to FCRA Violation To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally demand the immediate removal of the following account from all credit reporting agencies due to your blatant violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Account Number : XXXX Under FCRA Section 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 3 ), it is your legal obligation to notate an account as in dispute once a consumer challenges its accuracy. You have failed to fulfill this requirement, despite my previous dispute notification. This constitutes a serious violation of federal law and demonstrates your reckless disregard for my rights as a consumer.

Your failure to properly update the dispute status of this account means you are reporting false and misleading information. According to FCRA 1681s-2, this violation provides me with automatic grounds for account removal.

I am demanding that you : 1. Immediately remove this account from all credit reporting agencies.

2. Provide written confirmation of the accounts deletion within 15 days.

Failure to Comply Will Result in Legal Action : If you do not comply with this demand, I will take the following action without further notice : File formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ).

Pursue legal action under FCRA Sections 1681n and 1681o for willful or negligent noncompliance, which may include claims for statutory damages, punitive damages, and attorneys fees.

This is your final opportunity to correct your violation and avoid legal consequences. I expect your full cooperation and confirmation that the account has been removed from my credit report.

You have 15 days to comply with this demand.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have called American Express XXXX on separate occasions to inquire about my Hilton Honors XXXX card. One of the card 's member benefits is a {$200.00} semiannual credit towards stays at XXXX XXXX. https : //global.americanexpress.com/XXXX On XXXX, I purchased a night stay at the XXXX XXXX XXXX property . It is an eligible resort property for the credit for {$200.00}. XXXX XXXX XXXX I purchased the advance rate on the XXXX app. It was coded as a XXXX advance purchase. I stayed at the property on the night of XXXX and checked out on XXXX. I incurred an incidental charge of {$1.00} that was charged directly to the property. I received a credit of {$1.00}. This reimbursement informed me that the app purchase is a XXXX issue that is not coding properly to receive the resort credit despite me purchasing/staying at the hotel in reliance of the credit and based on good faith.

In the course of bringing this up to American Express ' attention, I've been given the run around, on one occasion was outright hung up on when requesting a manager, and have encountered line service reps who generally didn't know how to handle the issue. 

I finally got a representative the week of XXXX who understood the issue and gave me a case # : XXXX. I was promised a manual credit for the stay for the remaining semi-annual resort credit balance of {$190.00} to be credited against the {$200.00} charge no later than Thursday XXXX. 

On XXXX, after seeing no activity, I called into American Express. I got a rep who told me that the case got referred to another department and told me resolution is expected to take XXXX weeks. 

The charge was on XXXX. It is now XXXX with the stay already having taken place weeks ago. American Express has indicated that it understands that this is a coding issue and that I'm supposed to get the remaining semiannual resort credit as promised as an XXXX XXXX  provision. I have exhausted my options, can no longer count on American Express resolving this, and now seek CFPB review.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I planned to receive {$1500.00} from a family member for paying my mortgage. She sent the money via Zelle from her XXXX XXXX account, and I received a text message from Zelle saying I had a pending payment that I needed to enroll with Zelle for. I've used Zelle before, with both my email and cell phone number verified, and yet it required me to enroll again. When I finished enrolling, it brought me back to my XXXX bank app home-screen, yet the funds were not in my account. When I called my family member, she said the {$1.00} had been withdrawn from her account, and that the Zelle transaction had been completed. 

When I looked into my Zelle activity, however, no {$1500.00} transaction is listed. I sent her a test {$1.00} Zelle payment to test if she was able to receive Zelle from me, and she did the next morning, though not immediately. 

When talking to XXXX and Zelle, they both direct me towards each other 's customer support, and both can not verify the existence of a transaction of {$1500.00} to my checking account. They both also confirm that my phone number was verified as a recipient for the Zelle transaction. 

I'm planning to wait on the payment to come through over the weekend, hopefully it just being a lag in their systems. But I find it disturbing that the transaction took money out of her account and failed to deposit it into mine, leaving it in a limbo state. Especially since the mortgage payment is due soon, and I can't afford to wait days or weeks for a payment of that magnitude and urgency.

Product: Debt collection
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC has not validated this debt. I am submitting this complaint against Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC for their attempt to collect a debt they are not legally authorized to collect. Their actions are in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and applicable Credit Reporting ( CR ) rules outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Details of the Complaint : 1.Failure to Validate the Debt : Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC must furnish proof of validation as allowed under the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ). Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC has failed to provide proper validation, including proof that the debt is valid, that they own the debt or have the right to collect it, and a full accounting of the amount owed. 2. Debt Not Collectible Under CR Rules : under federal law, debts sold to collection agencies may not be collectible unless the agency can legally demonstrate ownership and compliance with CR rules. Specifically : Credit Reporting Rules ( FCRA ) : Debts sold to collection agencies must include complete and accurate information about the debt, including its origin, the amount, and whether the statute of limitations has expired. Agencies must also notify credit bureaus if a debt is disputed. Debt Ownership : If the original creditor sold the debt, the collector must provide a clear chain of title proving their legal right to collect the debt. Portfolio Recovery Associates LLC has not provided this. 3. Violation of My Rights : The debt in question is unverified, unenforceable, under [ applicable state law. Attempting to collect this debt without validation is a violation of my consumer rights under the FDCPA and FCRA.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of an auto repossession on my credit report under account PNC BANK. This account was previously removed from my XXXX credit file, which demonstrates that the information is either inaccurate, unverifiable, or incomplete. Also, this account is being inaccurately reported for the full loan amount instead of reflecting the proper deficiency balance after the vehicle was sold at auction, as required by law. Furthermore, I was not provided with a required notice detailing the auction results and the remaining balance, which further invalidates the accuracy of this reporting. Therefore, I am requesting that you immediately investigate and remove this account from my credit file as required by federal law. 

Under 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and consistent records. Disparities in reporting across the XXXX major bureaus call into question the accuracy of the information being furnished and your adherence to your duty under the FCRA to ensure maximum accuracy in consumer credit reports ( 15 USC 1681e ( b ) ). Credit bureaus must report only accurate, complete, and verifiable information. Reporting the full loan amount after a repossession and sale violates this standard of accuracy. 

UCC 9-611 and 9-616 ( Uniform Commercial Code ) : Creditors are required to notify the borrower in writing of the time and place of the auction or sale of repossessed collateral ( 9-611 ). Additionally, after the sale, the creditor must provide an explanation of how the proceeds were applied, including the deficiency balance ( 9-616 ). Failure to provide this notice invalidates the debt or the claimed deficiency amount.

Additionally, the failure to verify the accuracy of this account may also constitute a violation of 15 USC 1681i, which requires prompt reinvestigation when a consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of an item. Given that XXXX has already removed this account, I believe the same standard of accuracy should apply to your records. 

If the furnisher of this information ( PNC BANK ) is unable to provide documentation verifying its accuracy and compliance with those applicable laws I stated, you must remove the account immediately. Reporting unverifiable or incomplete information violates 15 USC 1681s-2 ( b ), which prohibits furnishers from knowingly reporting inaccurate data. 

I am also concerned that continuing to report this repossession despite its removal from another bureau may lead to harm under 15 USC 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which provide for remedies in cases of willful or negligent noncompliance with the FCRA. 

Reasons for Dispute : XXXX. Failure to Provide Required Notices : I did not receive a pre-sale notice or post-sale explanation of the proceeds and deficiency balance, as required by UCC 9-611 and 9-616. Without these notices, the creditor is in violation of its legal obligations, and the reporting of the debt is invalid. 

XXXX. Incorrect Amount Reported : If the repossessed vehicle was sold, only the deficiency balance ( remaining amount after the sale proceeds were applied ) can be reported, not the full loan amount. Reporting the full balance is a clear violation of 15 USC 1681e ( b ), requiring accuracy in credit reporting. 


Requested actions : I respectfully request that you XXXX. Reinvestigate the Account : I request that you reinvestigate this account and verify its accuracy with the furnisher of the information and require the furnisher to provide COMPLETE documentation verifying its accuracy. 

XXXX. Obtain Proof of Notices and Accuracy : Require the furnisher to provide documentation of the auction results, the pre-sale and post-sale notices, and the calculation of the deficiency balance. If they can not provide this information, the account must be removed from my report. 

XXXX. Correct or Remove the Account : If the information can not be verified or is found to be incomplete or inaccurate, this account must be corrected or removed from my credit file as required under 15 USC 1681i. 

XXXX. Provide me with a written response within XXXX  days, as required by the FCRA, detailing the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 


Please note that I am prepared to escalate this dispute to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), or other appropriate authorities if necessary. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your written response.

Consumer complaint narrative: I noticed that you are reporting inaccurate information on my credit report and that you keep verifying this account when its clearly inaccurate. This letter serves as a DEMAND to validate this account : Account Name & Account Number : Please provide me with the following : ( 1 ). Full accounting for this account : ( 2 ). Copy of the assignment of purchase from the creditor ( 3 ). Every charge and what was purchased, fee, payment, credit, interest ( 4 ). How you calculated what you claim I owe ( 5 ). ( Fields v. Wilber Law Firm Coppola v Arrow Financial Services ) ( 6 ). Full chain of assignments from charge off to present ( 7 ). Proof that you own the debt with full clear title ( 8 ). Proof that you were on the original contract ( 73 Am Jr sect. 93 ) & ( Gearing v Check Brokerage Corporation ) If you cant provide me with sufficient proof as listed above, then you must delete the above account from all three credit reports ASAP. Let me remind you of the law : according to FDCPA 809 ( b ) furnishing, verifying and updating is considered collection activity. If you verify this inaccuracy from the credit bureaus without providing me with all of the items listed, you will be in violation of the law which carries a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. My attorney who specializes in suing debt collectors will be on standby waiting for my instructions.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Services, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) - Information relating to the purchase of a bad debt is not proprietary or burdensome. Debtor must phrase their request clearly to obtain : The source of a debt and the amount a bad debt buyer paid for plaintiff 's debt, how amount sought was calculated, where in issue a list of reports to credit bureaus, and documents conferring authority on defendant to collect debt. Intimate knowledge of the creation of the debt by you, the collection agency. As I am sure you are well aware, under FDCPA Section 809 ( b ), you are not allowed to pursue collection activity until the debt is validated. You should be made aware that in XXXX XXXX, Plaintiff, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF ARIZONA, XXXX, the courts ruled that reporting a collection account indeed is considered collection activity. Yours Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

XX/XX/XXXX FXXXX CREDIT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Re : Account # XXXX ( Late Payment ) Dear Sir/Ma'am, I am writing you this letter regarding payments that were marked late by your company for the following accounts on the following date ( XXXX ) : ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) ( enter late payment date XX/XX/XXXX ) It is my understanding that per 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), my consumer report should not contain information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer ( me ) and the person ( you ) making the report. Payment history and the late payments associated with payment history negatively impacts my consumer report and are considered as part of my transactions and experiences between your company and me.

Furthermore, I am requesting that you provide me with, in writing, the reasonable procedures ( according to 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ) that you have adopted to ensure that each periodic statement is mailed to me ( the consumer ) not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Include also, all the information required by Section 1637 ( b ) of Title 15.

You have 30 days from the date that you receive this letter to provide me with the information that i am requesting. If you do not provide this information in the allotted time given, then it will be assumed that you can not verify the late payments on the dates specified above ( lacking reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of my account ) and I would timefore request that you remove the late payments from my account and consumer report with the following consumer reporting agencies ( Equifax, XXXX XXXX XXXX or all that apply ) and update the accounts to positive. 
Please forward any changes to my account to the address below. Thank you for your time and consideration in this matter. I look forward to hearing back something positive. 
Regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Texas XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Cc : CFPB FTC XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to address the inaccurate late payment listings on my consumer report, specifically concerning the accounts associated with KIKOFF, KIKOFF and XXXX, XXXX, with the reported late payment dated on my credit report. This is my third attempt to resolve this matter amicably.

I still noticed discrepancies in the information being furnished on my credit report. It is imperative to acknowledge that various federal laws are in place to safeguard consumer rights and ensure fair business practices. I would like to draw your attention to 15 USC 1666 ( B ) and 15 USC 1637 a ( a ), which explicitly prohibits reporting or treating a payment on an open-ended credit plan as late for any reason.

Furthermore, 15 USC 16819 ( B ) stipulates that as a consumer, I must grant permission for the furnishing of information on my behalf. To date, I have not provided such authorization to [ Name of Company Reporting Late Payment ]. Thus, the reporting of late payments without my consent is a violation of consumer protection laws.

Additionally, the billing errors identified under 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) and 15 USC 1637 a ( a ), including the creditor 's failure to reflect payments properly on a statement and computation errors, further highlight the inaccuracies in the reported information. As per the Fair Credit Billing Act, the creditor is obligated to notify me at least 21 days before the due date if there are any discrepancies in the statement. Failure to do so renders any late payment designation as a billing error. The following items must be promptly updated to reflect " paid as agreed '' on my consumer report : KIKOFF - XXXX, KIKOFF - XXXX I demand conclusive evidence from the creditor 's records demonstrating that the reported late payments were indeed justified and not the result of billing errors. Your persistent failure to rectify these inaccuracies not only tarnishes my consumer report but also undermines my financial standing.

I hereby request that the late payment listings associated with the aforementioned accounts be promptly updated to reflect accurate information or removed entirely. Failure to comply will result in legal action seeking monetary compensation for violations of my rights under 15 USC 1681n civil liability.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The response from Chime Financial , Inc. to my complaint submitted through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), where Chime Financial asserts that it is not required to comply with Regulation XXXX, this assertion is incorrect. As a financial technology ( XXXX ) company providing electronic fund transfer ( EFT ) services to consumers, Chime Financial operates under the same regulatory framework as traditional financial institutions, including compliance with the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and its implementing regulation, REGULATION XXXX. 
XXXX companies like Chime Financial, which provide services such as online banking, debit card processing, and mobile money transfers, are required to adhere to the following regulations, Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1693 et seq. ) Protects consumers engaging in electronic fund transfers by establishing rights, responsibilities, and remedies. 
Regulation E ( 12 CFR Part 1005 ) Outlines specific protections, including error resolution procedures, investigation timelines, and requirements for addressing unauthorized transactions.

Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) Section 1036 ( 12 U.S.C. 5536 ) Prohibits unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts and practices ( UDAAPs ) in connection with the offering of consumer financial products or services.

Chime Financial response, denying its responsibility under Regulation E, is concerning. Specifically due to Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation. Regulation E mandates that disputes involving unauthorized transactions or errors must be investigated within 10 business days and resolved within 45 calendar days if provisional credit is issued.

Chime Financial failure to follow the regulatory framework constitutes noncompliance with consumer protection laws.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Jefferson Capital Systems , LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Demand of Validation of Debt Dear Jefferson Capital Systems, I am writing regarding the accounts listed above, which you claim I owe. I have no knowledge of this account. I have not signed any contract for this debt reported. In accordance with my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 809 ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), I am requesting that you validate this debt and provide me with the following information as required by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). Please ensure that all necessary documentation is sent directly to my address above. 
Under the CFPB 's guidelines, I am requesting the following XXXX items to validate this debt : XXXX. The amount of the debt Please provide a detailed and itemized breakdown of the current amount owed, including any fees or interest that have been added. 
XXXX. The name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed Identify the original creditor, along with any details that may have changed if this debt has been sold, transferred, or assigned. 
XXXX. XXXX that the debt belongs to me Please send me a copy of any documentation or agreement that clearly establishes that this debt is associated with my name and details. 
XXXX. Proof of your authority to collect the debt Provide evidence of your legal authority to collect this debt, including any documentation proving your agencys involvement, such as a contract or agreement with the original creditor. 
XXXX. Complete record of payments and charges I request a full payment history, along with any charges or credits applied to the account, showing how the amount claimed was calculated. 
XXXX. Verification of the debts age and status Given that certain debts may fall outside of the statute of limitations for collection in my state, please confirm the date this debt was incurred and the last payment date. 
XXXX. Notice of my rights I request full disclosure of my rights, including information on disputing or challenging this debt if the information provided is incomplete or incorrect. 
If Jefferson Capital LLC can not substantiate these items with verifiable documentation within require time frame of receipt of this letter, I formally demand that you immediately cease collection activity, delete any negative credit reporting related to this debt, and refrain from future contact regarding this account like the too many texts and emails you all send about an account I do not know anything about. 
Additionally, if you continue to report this debt to the credit bureaus without appropriate validation, you may be in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the FDCPA, subjecting your company to possible penalties. Failure to respond with the requested documentation may lead me to file complaints with the CFPB and my state 's Attorney General. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this request and respond within the time frame required to my mailing address above. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BAY AREA CREDIT SERV XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX GA XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX Subject : Debt Validation Request To whom it may concern, I am writing in response to a communication I received regarding an alleged debt you claim I owe. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am requesting that you provide validation of this debt. Please provide the following information : The amount of the alleged debt. 
The name of the creditor to whom the debt is allegedly owed. 
A copy of the original signed contract or agreement that shows I am legally obligated to pay this debt. 
A detailed statement of the account, including a breakdown of the amount owed, interest, fees, and any other charges. 
Proof of your authorization to collect on this debt. 
I request that you provide the above documentation before any further action is taken on this matter. Please note that until you provide sufficient validation of this debt, I will not acknowledge its validity or make any payments. I also would like to note the inconsistencies on the above account as it points out on one bureau the last date of activity was XXXX XXXX. But is reflecting XXXX XXXX on the other bureaus report. 
Additionally, please be advised that under the FDCPA, you are required to cease all collection efforts until you have provided the requested verification. If you are unable to provide proper documentation, I will expect that the debt be removed from my credit report and that no further collection activity takes place. 
Please send all correspondence regarding this matter to my address listed above. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing a complaint regarding multiple inaccuracies in the reporting of my Westlake Financial account, which directly violates the requirements set forth under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Specifically, FCRA Section 623 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ) mandates that furnishers of information provide complete and accurate data, while FCRA Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires a prompt and thorough investigation of disputed information.The issues include : An incorrect date opened, An inaccurate high balance, An erroneous status and account status, A falsely reported past due amount when none is owed, An incorrect last activity date, These inconsistencies fail to reflect the true history of my account and must be corrected. I request that you immediately investigate these inaccuracies in accordance with FCRA guidelines and update my account information to accurately represent my credit history.
